Reviews.Title: “Great Location and clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: Heather1967
Reviews.Content: Staff were very helpful and location is ideal-walking distance to Bourbon Street, French Quarter, and Riverwalk. Includes a daily hot breakfast-good and lots of choices. Only drawback is rooms on the main floor that face Magazine Street-New Orleans is a lively city all the time and the street was noisy; and the sound barriers were not great. We had a suite-large room with a bedroom and sitting area. Worked great for our family with 2 teenagers.

Reviews.Title: “Short & Sweet”
Reviews.Author: Mrs1wing
Reviews.Content: My husband, Allen, & I stayed last weekend in New Orleans at Country Inn & Suites & had our faith in the city renewed. The Manager on duty, Robert Blatt, directed us to the concierge, Kylie, who was able to point us to the National WWII museum & movie with Tom Hanks. It was GREAT! I know of another guest for whom Mr. Blatt personally walked over a mile to get Soy milk (which the hotel did not have). We had previously had very negative experiences with New Orleans. Thank you, Mr. Blatt, for such a wonderful visit to the Crescent City!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location...”
Reviews.Author: ManitobaDgs
Reviews.Content: Had the character we hoped to find, great hot breakfasts, really helpful friendly- never met anyone cranky in spite of the fact that it was Mardi Gras and many tourists had many questions. The pool worked out to be a perfect relaxing "warm-hot tube" where we often took an afternoon break. Best of all was the location as we walked everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant surprise in NOLA”
Reviews.Author: Katy04
Reviews.Content: We booked here for 4 nights before leaving on a cruise. We reserved at a very reasonable rate, so we were a bit concerned. No need to be! It's a great little eclectic hotel on Magazine Street. The hotel is fashioned from 6 or 7 old buildings and because of this, the interior has old brick and giant wood beams! It includes a continental breakfast in the lobby and even has a cute little bar in the evenings. Very central location...close to all...but not too close!!! The staff was very helpful and they even had fresh baked cookies every evening!! When we returned from our cruise, we had the entire day in NOLA as our flight didn't leave until 7:00pm. We didn't want to drag our luggage around the city so we contacted the hotel to see if we could store it there for the day. They couldn't have been nicer about it!!! These are the little touches that really impress me. We will definitely book here again on our next trip to NOLA.By the way...we were in town for St Patrick's day and it was the best St Patrick's day we have ever had!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A NOLA bargain”
Reviews.Author: lauramcamis
Reviews.Content: A reasonably priced hotel in the heart of NOLA. Rooms were quiet, spacious and clean. Beds comfortable. We walked everywhere even after listening to music late at night on the other side of the Quarter. Staff was very friendly and the cookies always fresh and yummy.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: jdk9
Reviews.Content: This is a fine hotel....clean, quiet, well-located, good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Debbie M
Reviews.Content: Not that we were expecting anything bad, but it offered some amenities we were not expecting like a lobby bar and concierge service. Very professional staff and the concierge (Kaylie) service was wonderful. Location was great; close to everything, but not right in the heart of the "party all night long" crowd. Very comfortable and clean rooms. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “This place has a bunch of problems....”
Reviews.Author: wahinisis
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our annual family trip to NOLA. I am still searching for that perfect hotel there... to no avail. This year we had more folks so I went with this hotel. I called ahead and spoke with Andrew at the desk who assured me I could get 2 suites next door to each other. I was crystal clear about what I needed. I reserved, and upon arrival learned this was not physically possible at this hotel. The first night my husband and I were at one end of the floor and the kids were in the other. BTW Andrew neglected to tell me this was an "interior" suite; which is close to a small prison cell. Day 2 we got moved to a standard room, but closer to the kids. This is where the maid took the cash off of our desk and then looked surprised and said "oh, that wasn't my tip?" Mind you the cash was attached to a safety pin! Fast forward to the "waterfall" in the kid's suite (#239) bathroom, leaking from above (toilet??? ewe) and they had to be moved as well. Oh, did I mention the maids did not clean their room for 2 days, then came in and took all of the snacks and alcohol and bottled water from the room? It was like something out of the Twilight Zone. I mean, who does that??? Tami, one of the managers assured me prior to checking out that the change in cost on our room would be recorded and that she would call me; BUT she did not make the needed changes nor call me. Heather at the desk had to do this because Tammi had done nothing. I am still waiting for the money difference on my CC. Heather was very nice and it remains to be seen if she comes through. This hotel is just plain CRAZY! My search continuezzzzzzzzzzzzzzzz

Reviews.Title: “Our Favorite Hotel in New Orleans!”
Reviews.Author: Mike-n-Ginni
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying at the Country Inn & Suites in New Orleans during French Quarter Festival this past weekend and will definitely book there again. We first fell in love with the CI&S 5 years ago and have tried to book it each successive year during the FQF but apparently we're not the only travelers that enjoy the experience -- booked solid 3 years in a row. Must have called when they just had a cancellation this year and were thankful to be staying there. GREAT location, helpful/friendly staff, nice rooms and common areas, decent complementary hot breakfast and the BEST bartender in NOLA (John Greer is AWESOME!). We recommend CI&S without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Loud and a bit dirty”
Reviews.Author: soccermom1965
Reviews.Content: I had booked this hotel because it had great reviews on Trip Advisor. I was disappointed. We were in a corner room on the first floor with people walking right outside our room all night making noise. This intimidated my young daughter. The room was cramped and the bed felt like it had sand in between the sheets. One of the towels also had stains. The breakfast was plentiful, but crummy. My oatmeal had congealed so it was not properly made that day. The location was okay, but not as close to the french quarter as I had thought. If I had to do it over again, I would have went with one of the larger chain hotels (cost less and would higher up to avoid the noise).

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Hali3
Reviews.Content: Just got back from our trip to New Orleans and another great stay at the Country Inn & Suites. As always I cannot say enough about the friendliness of the staff. There is not an employee of the hotel that you come across that fails to give you a smile and a big hello. Rooms are clean. Breakfast is a little different every day and always fresh. Location is perfect walking distance from the French Quarter and many other sites. Great value. We have stayed many places before finding this hotel and now wouldn't stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: John P
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the hotel for a business/leisure trip. Everything was almost perfect from the location, to the room, to the staff (especially the front desk and the bartender John!). Will definitely be returning back to this hotel when I visit NOLA next. I say "almost perfect" because I believe the room could use better lighting and the bathroom a fan of some sort. Other than that, we had an incredible time.

Reviews.Title: “overall good with some draw backs”
Reviews.Author: bigguy6
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a week in mid April. PROS: Good location 2 blocks from the French Quarter and 6 blocks from the WWII museum. Lowest price for a 2 room suite with such a good location. Place is a remodeled warehouse and has character. People are very nice. Car valet has good/nice people (but can take 10 to 15 minutes to get car) The pool (heated) and area around it is small but nicly done. Cons: The remodel didn't put a lot of effort into sound proofing the walls, can hear people next door. Most of the rooms go up 4 stories over an attrium above the lobby/bar/breakfest area and the sound from there can be loud and it echos up to the rooms badly. Many of the 2 room suite bedrooms are small with no windows. The free breakfast in the morning is over crowded with inadequate seating. Overall I would reccomend this hotel, but be aware of the drawbacks

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat it”
Reviews.Author: MichelleC10
Reviews.Content: Great location, great value. The courtyard with its tiny pool is relaxing, the breakfast is good, and the rooms are very clean. Nice historic feel with all the exposed brick, too. I've stayed there several times and will return.

Reviews.Title: “No news is good news.”
Reviews.Author: MD C
Reviews.Content: The hotel was friendly and organized. The bed was comfortable and the location very good. Took the #11 bus on Magazine to shop and eat places. Easy walk to streetcars and French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, clean and family friendly”
Reviews.Author: Chris G
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is just on the other side of Canal Street near the French Quarter. It is a small walk to the French Quarter (good to know when you have small children). We stayed in a one bedroom suite. The room was large, clean and had big windows with a great view. While the pool is a little small, the setting is tranquil and relaxing. The staff was wonderful. Helpful, patient with the kids and knowledgeable. It was a great hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great friendly hotel - perfect location”
Reviews.Author: lhr762
Reviews.Content: My 9 year old and I stayed here for a few days over spring break. Great location - it was good to be within close walking distance of canal st but far enough away that we could breathe. The staff was so friendly and helpful. Can't beat free breakfast and coffee when traveling on a budget. the room did have a stale smoke smell even though there were warnings about smoking fines all over :)

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and typical”
Reviews.Author: ItalyClaudio
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just at the border of the French quartier. It is located in an old mill that has been remodeled keeping part of the original architecture. Our room was big enough, with a leaving space, and well furnished. The breakfast is not very rich, however is complete. They do not have on site parking, however a valet service is provided at 28 $/night. Costs are reasonable. You will not miss the absence of a restaurant in the hotel, just a short walk away the streets are full of restaurants of different quality and price.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting hotel & wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: Dlbjkb
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our stay during the NCAA Final Four. The rooms were clean & comfortable and the staff was great!

Reviews.Title: “Small room, great location, great price. Poor car valet service.”
Reviews.Author: Boriski
Reviews.Content: Best for: those wanting a reasonable, mid-range hotel in a prime New Orleans location (close to the French Quarter). This was our 32nd hotel stay in five months travel across North America. We stayed six nights in a room with a king bed, for an average of $84/night (including tax), on the Carlson Family & Friends rate. Whatâ€™s good: Our room was on the fifth floor, tucked away from overlooking the foyer area, and with only 9 rooms on this floor we heard very little noise from the lobby that other reviewers note. Our room had a mini-fridge, microwave oven, coffee machine and flatscreen tv with usual selection of cable chanels. Breakfast included in the rate was a great choice of the usual continental style along with a hot dish and fresh make-it-yourself waffles. The breakfast area can get quite busy and a little crowded. Coffee/tea and small snacks (fruit and nut bars) were available after hours near the bar. Free cookies available daily from the reception desk. Washing machine and drier on 3rd floor for a small fee. Drink and ice machine also available. A small selection of grocery items are available next to reception. Thereâ€™s a small bar on ground floor that opens in the evenings. The large foyer with plenty of seating makes for a nice place to relax. And there's a small pool on ground floor though not used by us. We saw no evidence of bed bugs in our room, had no problems with them either but noted two reports for this place on one of the bedbug registry websites. In a first not seen anywhere else on our travels â€“ the hotel places signs near elevators in the evenings, asking people to be quiet between the hours of 11pm â€“ 7am. Itâ€™s unfortunate though that some people canâ€™t read, but we love the idea of asking people to be considerate. Minor annoyances: The room was very small and the window more a porthole â€“ up high with no view or light, but we werenâ€™t there for a view. Valet parking (outsourced to another provider) was quite expensive at $32 per night. Whilst we canâ€™t be certain it was caused here (but with a high likelihood it was), our hire car was returned to us the next morning with a small dint in the rear bumper following its overnight stay here. I note they limit their liability on the valet parking voucher to $10, so best to inspect your car before and after it returns from valet. Initially our mini-fridge and room safe were out of order, however both issues were resolved quickly once raised. Staff service was efficient and attitude depended on the individual, but sometimes was a little aloof. As other guests have commented, the explanation of a fee if you smoke in your room was emphasised quite harshly. The hotel has obviously had problems with this in the past. Whilst the bed was comfortable, our linen had some holes in it, and some rubbish from a previous guest remained next to our bin for the entire duration of our stay, so cleaning could be more attentive. Nearby: The French Quarter is around three blocks walk. In the same street as the hotel youâ€™ll also find several small convenience stores. Streetcars leave from two blocks away on Canal Street (St Charles Line). The start of Bourbon Street is around 6 blocks easy walk. Try Motherâ€™s Restaurant (for great Louisiana style food) a few blocks away on Poydras Street, and the Palace CafÃ© on Canal Street for old-style qaintness. Would stay again on the same room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Not one complaint”
Reviews.Author: Mary Gene E
Reviews.Content: Country Inn and Suites in the French quarter was great. We had a class reunion so there where close to 60 of us, Everyone was so pleased with the rooms, breakfast buffet and the staff. Lisa the manager made everything so easy for me to set up our reunion. The Inn was so close to everything and when we needed to get everyone to the cruise line they had all the taxis waiting outside for us. The price was outstanding and I would highly recommend this clean well run hotel to all!!

Reviews.Title: “Feels like home”
Reviews.Author: Herb F
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and 33 others stayed for a week and found the service to be exemplary. The entire staff was well trained and professional and provided everything we needed for a wonderful week in New Orleans. They made us feel at home and we will definitely stay there anytime we visit the Crescent City.

Reviews.Title: “Very Noce hotel Walking distance to Bourbon St”
Reviews.Author: nollvis33
Reviews.Content: This was a find on Trip Advisor. The rooms were clean and the staff was noce. The breakfast buffet was good. It was an inside room so it was like being on a cruise with no windows. Nice walk to everything in New Orleans, for the price I would definitely come back

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect for the area”
Reviews.Author: dustytrader
Reviews.Content: After staying in the French quarter for a few nights at Hotel St Pierre, this was like a mansion..and at the same price. No complaints, best place we stayed all week.

Reviews.Title: “Vintage Hotel "Charming"”
Reviews.Author: penright8888
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at this downtown location. It is a renovated old warehouse with much of the original brick and woodwork exposed throughout the lobby/common areas. Very charming and interesting. The rooms are very modern and well appointed. The bed was very comfortable, with a micro-wave and refrigerator in the room. The hotel is only a 15 minute walk from Harrah's Casino and the River Walk. It is only 5 minutes from Canal Street, the streetcar to the French Quarter, and the beginning of Bourbon Street. The free breakfast is better that average. The pool is small - more like a large hot tub, but in a beautiful setting. The staff are very kind and helpful. There are free snacks and discount drinks at the bar in the afternoons. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect - unless you like to sleep in.”
Reviews.Author: hnewheels
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a very cool old building and the way they've designed it has a lot of eye appeal. But it isn't very practical for people who like to sleep in. All of the rooms (all the way to the top floor) open up to an open area outside their door that looks down on the breakfast area. We were on the fourth floor and we could here everything - plates, sliverware, chatter, etc starting when breakfast opened up (6 am?). Now this isn't a bad thing for business travelers because they have to be up early anyway. But for those of us on vacation who just want to sleep in after a late night out, it wasn't enjoyable at all. There was no outside noise, which may be due to there not being a window in our room. The rooms are so large that I didn't even notice it. Everything else about the hotel is perfect. The room size is excellent, the beds are comfy, there is a microwave and refrigerator. The bathrooms are a good size and there are mirrors and outlets outside of the bathroom if you need more than one person to get ready at a time. Customer service is very helpful and prompt. The concierge is very knowledgeable and enthusiastic. There is a mandatory valet fee (I believe it was $20/day), which allows you to park right in front of the hotel and unload (and reload). But we got such a great deal on the room that this fee didn't bother me too much - I just enjoyed the benefits. Location is great. Two blocks walk to a main street where you can catch a trolley to take you all over downtown and to the convention center. If you're running behind getting to the convention center, it's a brisk 15 minute walk and you're there. Not bad on a beautiful day. So except for the early mornings, everything was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back”
Reviews.Author: 670Nanie
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nights at this hotel and enjoyed every night. The staff are friendly and accommodating. The free breakfast had a great selection. The staff go the extra mile to assist you in every way . The little mini market beside the front desk is a great convenience. We stayed at this hotel last year, and we planned to return in the spring of 2013. We love New Orleans and Country Inn & Suites

Reviews.Title: “A little noisy but perfect location an service!”
Reviews.Author: Christina P
Reviews.Content: I love the location! Everything is so close! But, it was a bit noisy at night and in the early morning.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Carrie P
Reviews.Content: Great, clean place to stay! A little walk was well worth the peace and quiet. Super clean, updated rooms. Nice breakfast and staff.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Value”
Reviews.Author: Firemandavid
Reviews.Content: As a family of 5 we stayed in a King suite during the week of March 13th. The room was exceedingly comfortable though somewhat narrow for a family and had a pullout couch that comfortably slept 2 kids and room for a large cot for another. The King bed was in a real bedroom separated by a door, its own chest of drawers, TV, and nightstands which made things nicer for Mom and Dad. There was a microwave, refrigerator, and coffee maker. 2 blocks from Canal Street in a well traveled area the hotel is in walkable distance from the Quarter, the streetcars, the river, the WWII Museum and a slew of other locations. The staff was polite and helpful and the complimentary breakfasts satisfactory. The pool is outdoors and very small but our sons (ages 11,10,8) enjoyed it anyway and swam everyday. Delicious cookies were always available in the lobby and they maintain a nice lending library of books geared mostly to young readers (great idea!!) The concierge was a bit disappointing steering guests to obvious tourist trap restaurants (Bubba Gumps, Margaritaville,) and expensive swamp and ghost tours from which she receives a commission. I'm sure some won't mind this but I prefer to know about more unique, local restaurants that can be researched and found here on tripadvisor. The breakfast area is well maintained but sometimes stressed to keep up with food demand when the hotel is very full or tour groups try to eat all at once. This caused some rudeness on the part of some guests but I witnessed nothing but polite responses from staff. All in all a great, comfortable and clean hotel at a reasonable rate with excellent service. And while valet parking seems expensive, compared to the surrounding garage's rates the hotel is a relative bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value in the Big Easy”
Reviews.Author: JSV-Minn
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd year in a row that I have stayed here for a girl's getaway trip. You are immediately greeted by friendly valet/bell hops to assist you with parking and luggage and then check in and check out with friendly and efficient front desk staff. The location is excellent to the French Quarter and close to the bus and trolley if you want to check out the Garden District. We really enjoyed taking a City Tour this year, had a great guide(Casey) who gave you the inside scoop of the city and people living in it, aka Brad & Anjolie. The trip to the 9th Ward really opened my eyes to the devastation of Katrina. Check in with the concierge for coupons and suggestions on restaurants etc. If you want a beignet, go to Cafe Beignet as it is closer to hotel and lines are not quite as bad as Cafe Dumonde. One last thing, when you check in, ask for a room with a window, as the inside rooms have very small windows as this building was converted from an office buidling to a hotel. WHO DAT!! Jean Marie

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay while visiting the French Quarter.”
Reviews.Author: tom m
Reviews.Content: A very convenient place to stay while staying in New Orleans. A short walk to anything connected to the French Quarter. There are trollys, Buses and tour buses all around to take you any where else. The staff were great and the rooms are quiet. They serve a nice breafast every morning.

Reviews.Title: “Room 343, 03/18/12”
Reviews.Author: cpldutch
Reviews.Content: Checked in early, no hassle and a pleasant lobby, greeted me. Taxi from MSY, $33 + tip=$40, pretty standard for the trip. Nice and pleasant cab drivers and clean cabs. On to the room on the 3rd floor. Got off of elevator and turned to the left to hallway, (down? a flight of stairs, then 10 yds., up a flight of stairs, turn left up 4 more steps then to room) King room overlooking a private valet parking lot. Nice view of taller buildings in area. aA couple of blocks to Harrah's Casino, 2 more beyond that to the RiverWalk. 2 blocks to the left of my hotel to Canal St. and Street cars, pretty close to Bourbon St. and viscinity. Good restaurants nearby. All in all a pretty good site. It was a King size bedroom and that just fit in there with a couple of night stands. Average bath and a good sink counter top. In room safe, microwave and fridge. Good lighting. Could not make room dark at night because of the way the drapes were hung. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Mary385
Reviews.Content: The Country Inn and Suites in the French Quarter has a lot going for it. The location is central to the River District and French Quarter and is a safe location. The accomodations are clean and comfortable and the hotel has a lot of character. The free breakfast is a bonus. The front desk staff, valets, and concierge staff were pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: lizzy b
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel in a great location for business or leisure, everything at walking distance. The staff were very friendly and always helpful, there is a great trip organizer to book your tours.Very clean rooms and a great bed! but noisy during the night (the more than an inch gap under the door didn`t help).

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Lynn S
Reviews.Content: Great experience at this hotel. Close to everything. Walking distance to all attractions. Very quiet too.

Reviews.Title: “Country Inn & Suites - New Orleans, LA”
Reviews.Author: mikellh
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4, joined by another family of 4, stayed in this hotel for 3 nights on our first visit to New Orleans. We loved this hotel. The front desk staff could not have been more helpful and friendly. The lobby has a very creative look to it and is attractive yet different (which we really liked). The fresh cookies in the lobby were awesome! The bellman went out of his way to help us secure a taxi to the port and load 8 of us and a ton of luggage into the van. The breakfast had a good variety. Exercise room was clean and cool. We didn't use the pool but it is fairly small with a good location and was clean. The only downside was that we were on the 3rd floor and the trash trucks in the alley woke us up at 6:30 a.m. one morning. Other than that, a great stay, a great location. We walked everywhere we wanted to go from this location and had a thoroughly enjoyable time. Close to the WWII Museum, Mother's (great local restaurant), River Walk, Harrah's and, of course, Bourbon Street.

Reviews.Title: “As good as it gets!”
Reviews.Author: pauline M
Reviews.Content: I just stayed here last weekend for a last minute girls weekend trip with my twin sister and best friend who flew in from Ohio. I literally booked this hotel the night before we left and very happy that I picked this hotel. PROS: - Everyone at this hotel is freaking friendly! From the doorman to the checkin desk to Brian, who was my favorite breakfast attendant. As soon as we checked into the hotel and settled into our room, the manager of the hotel called me and made sure to welcome us to the hotel and told us to not hesiate to contact them if we did. That was a wow factor! I have never had a manager do that before and especially in a big city. - The hotel is only 3 blocks away from Canal Street and the crazy Bourban Street. Honestly, for 3 girls to walk around in a big city at 2:00am in the morning, we felt very safe at all times of the day and night! - DId I mention that this hotel provides free hot breakfast every morning? I had 5 plates of hot waffles, bagels, oatmeal, mixed fresh fruit, scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, and pancakes! CONS: -Absolutely none! I would recommend this hotel for anyone that needs somewhere to stay down in NOLA!

Reviews.Title: “great stay.”
Reviews.Author: hazel c
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for 4 nights pre cruise, last day of mardi gras, superb value. walk across the road to canal street, french quarter, clean, lovely rooms, superb staff, breakfast complimentary. and very good price. will stay there again. great experience. new orleans has very happy people!

Reviews.Title: “All the good reviews are true: BUT run from an inside room”
Reviews.Author: CDinDC20009
Reviews.Content: Are you the least bit claustrophobic? If so, make sure you don't stay in a windowless room. Yes, the staff is working hard and thoughtful. Yes, the included breakfast is a great deal. Yes, it's nice to have two rooms and a microwave and mini-refrigerator. No, it doesn't matter that the pool is just big enough for a few sets of feet or that the towels are way too thin. The only problem is that the rooms that look over the lobby & seating area have windowless bedrooms. Return to the front desk. Get another room. And then enjoy all the good things about this place.

Reviews.Title: “Precruise stay”
Reviews.Author: missjane75
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not considered in the historical French Quarter district so the price is reasonable. You are only a few blocks from there. The hotel is old but clean. Our room was spacious, bed comfy. View was not good. Looking at an empty building. Overall it was a good location & if you like to walk, you can walk over to the French Quarter & the Casino. We also walked to board the boat. Make sure if you do this to ask for walking directions.

Reviews.Title: “Our Regular NO Place”
Reviews.Author: burtw
Reviews.Content: Have stayed there 2x during the past 3 months. Most recently 12/24-26. Helpful staff, very good accomodations for an affordable price. The location is within a couple of blocks to the French Quarter, a nice walk to the WW II Museum and right on the Magazine St bus line. For those interested in exploring NO outside the Quarter, try Magazine St.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: NY2theWorld
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at this hotel during Mardi Gras. This was my second time staying here and I was pleased once again. Great location, not too far from or too close to Bourbon Street, nice walk to Jackson Square. Super friendly and helpful staff and great breakfast! The only drawbacks for us were that the pool was a bit small and our room didn't have windows, but this didn't affect how great a stay we had!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location for trip to Mardi gras.”
Reviews.Author: ncmurray
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few nights before and after Mardi Gras. The location cannot be beat - very close to all the parades and right on a bus route, two blocks away from the cable cars, and the french quarter and not far from the waterfront. The room was spacious enough for a city hotel, the beds were very clean and comfortable. My only complaint is that the floors in the room were somewhat dirty. Also, the breakfast was delicious and comprehensive, but the hotel might consider having more breakfast attendants during busy times. There was simply no way that the VERY hard working and friendly attendant could keep all the different kinds of food stocked for all the people who flowed through breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great pick”
Reviews.Author: staaaar19
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 3 nights over mardi gras. 4 girls in a room, spacious enough...we enjoyed that the building had some character and a nice courtyard. Free breakfast was a bonus although a bit of a zoo. Great location, steps to Canal street/shopping mall/river plus a few blocks from the french quarter. Also right around the corner from Mother's restaurant where we ate twice. Would definitely recommend/return.

Reviews.Title: “Good place for the money”
Reviews.Author: 22Emma
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Country Inn & Suites 5 nights. It was clean, the room was average size. Very nice staff. Excellent breakfast. Super small pool though! Good value for money. Walking distance from Bourbon street 10 minutes. Not far from any Wallgreen in case you need some advil or so...Would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel close to the action”
Reviews.Author: joopvanderpoel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Country Inn & Suites By Carlson, New Orleans French Quarter in september 2010. It was certainly a good hotel, well located, near the river, near bourbon street and close to the streetcars. Excellent value for money, breakfast was not special but ok. Quiet place, so when tired of all the action it's a nice place to relax. Regrettedly pool was the size of a large tub.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accommodations near French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Hans v v
Reviews.Content: First time visit to New Orleans. Picked this hotel based on research of all hotels in the area considering price and services offered. We were totally satisfied with our stay - the accommodations were very comfortable and the staff were super friendly and helpful. Within easy walking distance of so much to see and experience. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Southern Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: bpierz
Reviews.Content: Country Inn met our criteria for a moderately priced hotel: cleanliness, locality, staff and ambiance. This complex of older buildings was well kept, and the convenient and relatively quite area made our visits to the French Quarter and Garden District easy to reach. The first was by foot and the second was by the St. Charles trolley. Staff greeted us with beads and smiles, gave us good suggestions for local dining and saw to it that our taxi ride to the airport was on time (cost-$33 one-way for two persons). Finally, the charm of New Orleans was evident in the painted Louisianna brick walls, exposed wood beams and vine covered courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel handy to French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: northernerpalmtreelo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is off the busier streets, but handy to the French Quarter and other attractions. The room was quiet, and the breakfast was good. The valet attendants were very nice. The price was more reasonable than many other hotels The concierge was very helpful in recommending restaurants and attractions. She booked us a city tour that ended up being one of the highlights of our stay. We could only stay one night, but would definitely stay here again when returning to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Pre-Mardi Gras Stay”
Reviews.Author: candidtraveler
Reviews.Content: There's a lot of great things about this affordable hotel, but unfortunately our stay there a couple weekends prior to Mardi Gras was rather disappointing. On the plus side the staff was very friendly and helpful, the breakfast was ample and well-stocked, the building was unique and had charm, the location was fantastic, they allowed us to do an early check-in, and our room (king bed suite) was a good size. However, these great things were overshadowed by three negatives. #1: The room (309) had a dank, musty smell from the momment we walked it. You didn't notice it after a while but every time you entered the room it was apparent and kind of made you feel like you were staying in a dirty place (even though the facilities were very clean). #2: Our room only had one window (in the sitting room area) which looked out on the atrium. As other reviewers have noted, noise from the lobby up the atrium is a real issue. The hotel does put out signs reminding patrons to be quiet at night which is helpful. However, if you wanted to use the pull-out couch provided in the sitting room area for someone to sleep I think this would be problematic as you are sure to have noise. #3: Our biggest issue was the fact that during our three-night stay there were two nights where a junior high/high school group was also staying in the hotel and the noise from their rooms was absolutely horrible. I was woken up at 1, 2, and 4am to conversations that I could hear clear as day through the wall. When I mentioned this issue to the front desk after the first night they said they had special security onsite to manage this group of students and that I could call the front desk if there were any additional issues. I did call the front desk when I was woken up at 4am the next night by the students. I appreciate the fact that the were responsive, but honestly when you are woken up multiple times two nights in a row it just puts a real damper on the stay. I get the impression the management does try very hard to make their hotel a great place to stay so my recommendation to them is to do more on the front end to make sure any school groups they take in are monitoried and checked for noise throughout the night, not only when another patron reports a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Pre-cruise Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Renee R
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at this hotel prior to our cruise and cannot say enough about the hospitality of the staff. They went out of their way to make sure we were happy, especially the concierge ladies. They arranged our city tour and transportation to the port, and they helped with dining. We had a large group and they made sure we had coupons so we all saved $$. The rooms were clean, quiet, and had character. We loved the high ceilings. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: beenglish
Reviews.Content: We were in town for a convention and booked a room based on Tripadvisor's past reviews of guests. We were not disappointed! When we check in our room we noticed a loud noise that sounded like the elevator shaft. We later found out we were near the ventilation system. We told front desk and they immediately moved us to another room, not just any room but a large suite street side. It was quiet and comfy. They went above and beyond. The breakfast had great food choices and convenient hours. We were centrally located for everything New Orleans has to offer. Would book again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - apart from the barman”
Reviews.Author: BagmanNZ
Reviews.Content: Our stay was great. Free breakfast, free cookies at the check-in counter, wonderful older buildings that are all connected together in a comfortable way. Location is just minutes outside the French Quarter but close enough to enjoy everything the Quarter offers. Rooms are very comfortable and the beds are good. Clean and spacious. The breakfast here is very good, a great variety and selection of food. It should not be missed if you can help it. Our only issue here was the bartender. When we arrived there were no cookies at the check-in counter. We didn't know there was supposed to be cookies, but there were. Guy at the counter said we could go to the bar and they had a supply there. It was on the way to the lifts /elevators so we stopped off to pick a couple up. There were two people at the bar, one of whom was waiting for service, the barman was not there. He came out a couple of minutes later, served the first person and came to us. We asked for the cookies and he said no, he didn't have time. That was it. Nothing else. Just no. It wasn't exactly like he was run off his feet or anything, we just seemed to be an inconvenience to him. Shame really as everything else about this hotel was very good. By the way, the cookies were at the counter every other time we came and went, and they were delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Nice quiet suite, great location. Walk to French Quarter and museums.”
Reviews.Author: honeybee2009
Reviews.Content: Great value. Booked early, paid only 114.00 per night for a suite. Very good breakfast included. Concierge recommended City Tours, wonderful 3 hour tour with James and Jean.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: JohnJill_15
Reviews.Content: We booked 3 rooms (3 couples) and were able to have access before lunch which was great. Very helpful and friendly staff and the rooms were great with character and lovely comfy beds. Excellent location - can walk to the main street (Canal Street) in a minute, the Riverwalk and World War 2 museum are only minutes away as is Bourbon Street and the French Quarter. Access to free internet in the reception area is a bonus. The breakfast was okay - could be improved upon. We would recommend and certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: volunteer1980
Reviews.Content: We booked a 4 night stay at this hotel on 2/1-5/12 b/c we were meeting friends who wanted to vacation in this city. Our friends picked us up from the airport and we arrived at the hotel ~2 pm and instead of holding our luggage, the management was able to let us register early. We had booked a suite which included a sitting room with couch & TV with another TV in the bedroom. The room had a refrig. & microwave with coffee/tea service. The suite was very clean. This hotel was originally 5 buildings which were remodeled into a hotel. We had high ceilings (15 ft) which added to the charm to this hotel. We enjoyed the hot breakfast (waffles,eggs, meat, fruit, oatmeal, muffins, bagels, juice, etc.). I liked that the hotel tried to vary the way to serve eggs; one day we had eggs burrito style with cheese, green peppers & salsa; another morning we had fried eggs instead of the usual scambled. In the evening they had drink specials which were pretty reasonable for a hotel. I also loved the fireplace room and comfy couch & side chairs to enjoy the morning paper or to wait for friends. There was a bright large lobby with additional seating. There was a coffee/tea station 24 hrs in the lobby and fresh cookies, too, by the registration desk. There are two computers with printers for guest use. This hotel was was ~5 blocks from the convention center (short blocks) with Harrah's casino as a diversion. Our friends used the Premium public parking around the corner for $10 a day. There were many public parking areas to choose from. One day we played for 30 minutes on the penny machines at Harrah's and that allowed us to park free at their parking ramp for 24 hrs. This hotel is very convenient to French Quarter; we were 2 blocks away from Canal street. We walked back every night after visiting the FQ and we never had any feeling of danger. Lots of people walking around at night; just use common sense. The cleaning staff corrected a flickering light in our room immediately. The hotel front desk & conciergie staff were extremely friendly and very helpful during our 4 day stay, always with a smile. I would stay at this hotel again and will recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “great location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Moonbaby728
Reviews.Content: 3 of us stayed here for 1 night and we could not have been happier. Check in was fast and easy and our bell man was super friendly and courteous. The hotel lobby is beautiful and we took advantage of the area by sitting for a while playing a card game. The gal at the tour stand was also very informative and friendly. Our room was well appointed and bed was very comfortable. My husband loved the full breakfast they offered - eggs, bacon, sausage, etc. We would definately stay here again should the opportunity become available!

Reviews.Title: “New Orleans Jan 12”
Reviews.Author: FM6
Reviews.Content: Very clean hotel. Friendly staff fresh cookies always at the desk. Nice breakfast each day. Helpful staff offering tips on where to and such. Two blocks from the french quarter

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: KSOUTHERN
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights from Jan 26th, 27th and 28th. I have nothing bad to say about this hotel what so ever! Everyone was very helpful and our hotel room was clean and the bed was comfy. The only thing that is kind of misleading is when booking online it says it is in the French Quarter and it is not. It is a 5 to 10 minute walk. That didnt bother us, even at night when coming from Bourbon I never felt uneasy about the walk. It is a ways from Bourbon though,so if you don't like walking or arent able to walk far get a cab.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Sunnysideoftown
Reviews.Content: This was a weekend getaway for my husband and I for his birthday. This was our 3rd time staying here. The hotel staff is very friendly and helpful. Andrew, Calvin and Heather you made this weekend a great surprise for my husband. Everything was perfect!! John at the bar is awesome as always! Sit with him for a while and have a drink or two and you will find out a lot about New Orleans!! Great and comfy place!!!

Reviews.Title: “Gets the job done”
Reviews.Author: nchristo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a bachelor party. We all wanted our own beds so we went 3 to a room and rotated the sofa bed (which surprisingly, wasn't too bad). Good sized rooms, tv in bedroom and 'living room'. Front desk has cookies out all day, they are OK. Very convenient mini mart in the hotel lobby, open all day, sell gatorades, waters, snacks, other sundry items. Front desk was helpful but the 'system' seemed to be down quite a bit. Couldn't sign our bill when we were leaving and also had trouble getting replacement keys a few times. A little further off Bourbon street but definitely walkable. Decently close to the rest of the quarter, never felt nervous about the area or anything, really close to the casino. Breakfast is decent, nothing special but not terrible. Overall solid place to stay if you're looking for a cheap spot that is clean and no frills.

Reviews.Title: “Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: jodamo
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with friends for the weekend and we found the location to be very convenient for exploring New Orleans. Just a short 5-10 min walk into the heart of the French Quarter. A short walk to catch the historic streetcar (Be sure to ride the streetcar to visit the Garden district!) ROOMS: Clean, comfortable, standard for a Country Inn. COURTYARD & POOL: The courtyard is beautiful with a small (well heated) swiming pool - a nice quiet retreat from the busy streets. Breakfast is served in the sunny lobby adjacent to the outdoor courtyard. STAFF: Service was fine. No issues. Our most pleasant encounters with staff were with housekeeping staff, the maintenance man, and the concierge. The front desk staff could have been a little warmer.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice stay”
Reviews.Author: KanawhaTraveler
Reviews.Content: Just spent 8 nights at the Country Inn and Suites on Magazine. It was a very nice location for moving around the city. Only 3 blocks or so from Canal St. where you can catch a streetcar and go further. The valet men at the hotel were very helpful. We were very appreciative of their help with cabs and storing our luggage. The front desk was always very helpful. I much appreciated them giving me a box to send home extra things I purchased and didn't want to bring home in my luggage. I believe they said Fed Ex and UPS will pick up right there at the hotel. The concierge was helpful but we often thought they were trying to push a certain line of tours and not sure just why that was. We were very happy with our stay here. We stayed in 2 different rooms here. The standard king bed room was pretty small but bathroom was decent sized. Also stayed in a 2 queen bed suite which was very roomy but had a small bathroom. The only issue we has was 3 women using the bathroom and there were no vents in the bathroom to get rid of shower steam. We dealt with it o.k. but was surprised at that. We would recommend staying at this hotel. It had a lot of good points!

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely go back!”
Reviews.Author: Leon S
Reviews.Content: Nice quiet place with very unique, old world charm. I wanted a place that was away from Bourbon St. yet close enough to check it out. It's within walking distance to all of the attractions in the French Quarter. As for the hotel itself, the staff was friendly and helpful, the bed was very comfortable, and the room was very quiet. The free breakfast was a real bonus! Would gladly recommend and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Staying 4 nights. Great room wonderful breakfasts and the best service we have ever had in any other place we have stay”
Reviews.Author: vineyardgal
Reviews.Content: This was not an expensive hotel but the service cleanliness,serviceand great hot breakfast couldn't be found anywhere else at this price. Plus it is convient to everything you would want to see and do. Walk, bus trolley or your own vehicle. Will stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Will Definitely Stay Here Again!”
Reviews.Author: Coreen
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 couples in 2 rooms the weekend of Jan 6 to 8th pre-cruise and on the 15th. We loved this hotel, great atmosphere, the rooms were clean and cosy - loved the exposed brick and whole look and feel of the hotel. The staff was very helpful and Mryna helped us book a great swamp tour which we really enjoyed and I believe it was Sam who recommended the Star Steakhouse on Decuter just across Canal street and down 1 block which was the best meal we had in NOLA. Amazing! Best of all was the location - we had easy access to the streetcar to go and check out the garden district, easy walk to Bourbon St., Jackson Square, French Market, Cafe Du Monde and Riverwalk - we loved our time in NOLA and definitely will be back. Our only 1 disappointed was the morning of the 16th we had a taxi picking us up at 6:30AM and we planned on having the breakfast in the hotel but by 6:20 it was still not set up and we ended up having to pay for breakfast at the airport, breakfast hours show that it is open at 6am. They should try to make sure that the hours are followed so that their guests can make their plans accordingly. Otherwise - we will recommend you highly. Thank you for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and centrally located”
Reviews.Author: tntac96
Reviews.Content: Comfortable, clean, good service, very accommodating, centrally located, nice breakfast, cute little courtyard with a warm wading pool. . .. . good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay with good location”
Reviews.Author: map0125
Reviews.Content: Our stay began around midnight with a very friendly and attentive young man serving as a bellhop. Check in was quick and easy and we were given a room on the 5th floor. The room was a bit small but wasn't too cramped for two of us. The room featured a very comfortable bed and large, flat screen tv. Nice toiletry items with the sink being seperate from the bath and commode. The shower pressure was fairly weak, but it was really the only negative thing we could say about our stay. The hotel does have an outdoor pool and also offers a nice, complimentary breakfast. The best part of this hotel was it's location. It is not on a loud, crowded street but is very convenient to the Fr Qtr, Bourbon and just about everything in the area. Quick, easy walk to dine or enjoy nightlife or souvenir shopping. I would return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice & Pleasant Stay Overall”
Reviews.Author: Mrs_VL
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three (3) nights over the holidays and overall, it was a nice and pleasant stay with only a couple of negatives to note. These I will categorize as "suggestions for improvement". * Hotel Pluses: + Friendly and personable welcome at the hotel lobby and helpful service from Mr. Boissiere, the valet and luggage porter. + Very convenient location on the edge of the CBD (Central Business District) within an easy leisurely walking distance to the French Quarter. Safe neighborhood to walk around in during the day and at night as well. + Clean, spacious and well appointed bedroom with all the amenities, i.e., refrigerator, microwave, coffeemaker, large closet with safe, roomy bathroom, free in room wi-fi, etc. + Quiet bedroom. Ours was on the 3rd floor facing the parking lot so although the view was not exciting, the silence was greatly appreciated. + Close to restaurants and cafes nearby, plenty of hotels in the area as well. + Hotel staff was friendly, personable and professional at all times. + Price was fair and reasonable. * Hotel Minuses: - We did not receive the free daily USA Today newspaper as was mentioned in the booking. Although I suppose we could have inquired at the front desk for it, we didn't bother since it was the holidays after all. - The small breakfast room is wholly inadequate to cater to large number of guests so during "rush hour" in the morning or during the holidays, the queue and wait time for a table can be quite long and tiresome. The first and only time we tried breakfast at the hotel, the breakfast sausage patty turned out to be totally 100% frozen still. I guess in the hurry to get the breakfast out as quickly as possible, the breakfast chef forgot to cook it! Well, since this is New Orleans and there are no shortage of places to eat, we recommend the Ruby Slippers Cafe across the street or the Commerce Restaurant around the corner for excellent breakfast. Skip the hotel breakfast and enjoy breakfast elsewhere instead ;)

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: SmileDoc7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property from 1/7/2012 to 1/9/2012 for the National Championship game. The staff, although overwhelmed by the sheer number of people, were all pleasant and eager to please. Our room was not ready at check-in (11 am) so we stored our luggage and went out to find some lunch. We stayed in room 502 in a one bedroom suite. We had 2 queen beds and a pull out sofa. The room was nice and clean, and comfortable. Linens and pillows were very nice, and the bed was comfortable. Only complaint was in the bathroom the shower took a LONG time to warm up. I thought I was going to have to take a cold shower but it finally got hot. It is within walking distance to the French Quarter and to the Superdome. I would definitely stay here again! Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Pleased”
Reviews.Author: MrEdgar
Reviews.Content: Good location, friendly and helpful staff, clean from top to bottom, great breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: Shannon S
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really beautiful and unique. The staff was extremely friendly. We we travelling with our kids ages 9, 14, and 17 and they thought it was the "coolest" hotel. The location was perfect ,walking distance to French Quarter and RIverwalk. It was also very quiet. We can't wait to stay there again!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “WORSE EXPERIENCE EVER! STAY AWAY!”
Reviews.Author: Mia M
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at hotels all over the country and this is by far the worse experience ever. First of all, I will mention that the hotel is in a great location and close to Bourben St and the casino. However it is NOT worth the money. I will bullet the issues we had: * Carpet in the room is old and dirty with stains * Rude and disrespectful manager * EXCESSIVE noise at night...could not sleep. screaming at 2am-4am...hotel management said there is nothing we can do...it is football season!!!!! *Paint on walls is chipping off * Coffee in the breakfast was ice cold!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and room for family of five!”
Reviews.Author: mbt3
Reviews.Content: Ask for a room with a view of Magazine St. We booked two rooms and had to pay an extra premium of $3 per day to have the Magazine St. view, but it was worth it. The room had at least 14 foot high ceilings and a great view off the main street. There are not many hotel rooms that will accept 5 persons in a room, but it was very comfortable. There are 2 queen beds in the bedroom. and a fold out sofa for two. The queen beds were very comfortable with fantastic pillows and bedding, that I would expect to find in a much higher class hotel. The hotel had great architectural features. Check-in was very pleasant and the morning breakfast was good. Our 5 year old granddaughter enjoyed the small pool, and the workout room was quite adequate. Great location as I would not want to be in the heart of Bourbon Street with all the evening noise. It was only about a 7 minute walk to get to Bourbon Street .

Reviews.Title: “Easy access to all the attractions”
Reviews.Author: ElectronEYE
Reviews.Content: Very unique hotel that consists of 7 buildings joined together by hallways, passages, and elevator stops every half floor. We stayed at the Country Inn & Suites for 10 days over the holiday with our family (total of 2 rooms). The lobby is very spacious with high ceilings and open beams. There are plenty of liittle nooks and seats to sit and read or wait and enjoy the people and sounds of the city. The complimentary breakfast typically had 2 or 3 hot choices including eggs, bacon, sausage, or french toast that rotated throughout the week. Besides all the normal juices, coffees, teas, toast, and cereal; there were also honey yogurt and hot Quaker Oatâ€™s Cereal that could be mixed with granola, raisins, and brown sugar. We never had any issues finding a spot for the four of us to dine together in the morning. There are various restaurants all within walking distance and strongly suggest checking out Bon Ton Cafe, Mothers Cafe, and Palace Cafe (we've written reviews on all of them from our trip). Access to public transportation is 2 blocks away (Canal St. street car) or the St. Charles street car is about 5 blocks and is really easy and convenient. The $3.00 all-day pass is well worth the price to be able to go from the Garden District to the French Quarter. We used public transportation for getting around to all the attractions but if you decide to get out of the city for a couple of days and rent a car as we did for 2 days when the forecast called for heavy rains; we used Avis's (2024 Canal St.) complimentary shuttle for pickup and drop off and parked the car on the street (free parking from 6 PM to 8 AM) to avoid the $24 valet parking fee. We didn't have any trouble or issues. We would recommend the hotel to our friends and family to visit New Orleans, we didn't have any major issues with the hotel with the exception of the room selection, see the additional comments under choosing a good room.

Reviews.Title: “convenient to French Quarter without French Quarter prices”
Reviews.Author: nw2travel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Country Inn & Suites for two nights in March. It is an easy walk to the French Quarter. It was spring break for a number of schools but we booked online several weeks in advance and were able to take advantage of lower rates. The hotel is a series of connected buildings, which add to its character. We stayed on the fourth floor, which is on three different levels, and which required several flights of stairs to get to our room. The king room was small but private and very quiet, and the bed was comfortable. There is a small courtyard with a pool. Breakfast is a variety of cold and hot entrees, although they ran short by about twenty minutes with the hot food one morning. There is a small lounge area in the lobby with wine and beer for happy hour. The hotel staff, including the front desk and the concierge, were very friendly and helpful. There is a charge for parking, and everything is handled through valet service, which was likewise friendly and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - big rooms - great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Goodwaterwitch
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel. Would have rated 5 stars if room had been just a bit more "kept-up". Showed some wear and tear in room, but I will definately choose this hotel again for my trips to New Orleans. Awsome location, easy walk to Insectarium, Aquarium of Americas and French Quarter. I had my elderly mother with us and she had no problem walking to all of these. I've stayed in 5 different hotels during New Orleans visits and this is the one I will book again. Large rooms with fridge and microwave. The breakfast was great, staff is wonderful and helpful, pool is warm. The pool is very small, but perfect. My 7 year old and I hung out in the pool in the rain at night, the water was warm and it is outdoors but very protected. We just loved it. The hotel has great character being an old factory(?) and they really did a great job chaging it over.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious Rooms - Great for Families”
Reviews.Author: MrsB306
Reviews.Content: This was my second time staying at the Country Inn and Suites. The rooms are spacious which is great when traveling with a family of five. The hotel is smoke-free and has a refrigerator & microwave in every room. There is also a hot breakfast each morning which makes it easy when starting your day. The hotel staff is friendly and the location is within walking distance of all major attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. AWESOME staff.”
Reviews.Author: drnovak
Reviews.Content: I travelled to New Orleans in November 2011 and shared a room with a friend. We had a bit of an adventurous trip which I'll get to in a minute as it relates to my review. The location of this hotel is excellent. Easy walk to the Quarter and to Canal St. The building is nicely renovated and the rooms are what you'd expect. Very clean. However, what set my trip to this hotel apart was the staff. During our trip to New Orleans, my friend became injured and required a trip to the hospital and also needed the use of a wheelchair (which, of course, we did not have). The staff at the Country Inn and Suites went ABOVE AND BEYOND what was required to help us out. Upon returning from the hospital with my friend, the staff acquired us a wheelchair to use, the doorman helped us get to and from the room. We also needed to move from a room on the 3rd floor to a room on the 1st (due to the wheelchair and my friend's inability to walk) and the doorman helped me move all of our baggage to our new room in the middle of the night. The desk staff made our room switch very easy in difficult circumstances. The staff at the desk repeatedly asked how my friend was doing and if there was anything we needed. We had a difficult trip but the staff at this hotel made it as good as it could have been. A simple Trip Advisor review is hardly enough to thank them for all they did. The bartender even recommended a great restaurant for us (Coop's Place on Decatur). Also, the cookies at the front desk were delicious and plentiful! :) Seriously, this is a nice hotel with a great staff and while it may sound cheesy, I'm indebted to them for helping us out when we had some difficult travel circumstances in a strange city.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in a great location”
Reviews.Author: ArubaWeddingsbyBonny
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to New Orleans and it was better than our first thanks in part to the hotel we stayed at. The rooms are fine for this type of property. The staff is very friendly and accommodating but best of all it's location is away from all the noise but close enough to all the action.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value”
Reviews.Author: JMOutings
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived, a bellhop took our bags to our room, we were in 231, overlooking the pool, a small room with a kingsize bed. We had a fridge, micro, and a safe, small but nice. It took us about 10 - 15 minutes to walk up to Canal ST.to trolleys and buses, The breakfast buffet is really nice if you want to fill up before a long day!! Around the corner(heading towards canal st, is Chucks Bar, most draft beers are only 2$ pretty cheap if u want to grab a beer before going to hotel!!! Met some great people there!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, very helpful & friendly staff, lovely historic updated building!”
Reviews.Author: EMTtraveler
Reviews.Content: The Country Inn & Suites on Magazine Street in New Orleans is a gem! We paid $6 extra per night for a top floor, quiet room, and we got a suite that was a good size, quiet and pleasant. The hotel was formed from an old warehouse and the original bricks remain to add color interest to the property. The original elevator mechanism is displayed in the lobby area. We had two queen beds in our room, which were very comfortable. Since the room was a suite, we had two TVs and a pull-out bed couch in the "living" room. Because the building had been a warehouse, there aren't many windows in the hotel, but our bedroom had one from which we looked out over the city. The included breakfast buffet was very good, with attendants constantly refilling and cleaning the breakfast area. Our stay was only two nights, but on each morning a different egg/meat offering was available, along with cereals, yoghurts, fresh fruit, breads, juices, etc. The hotel was kept in tip-top condition, all questions were answered in a friendly and helpful way. It's location allows for an easy walk to the French Quarter and the river. The parking rate is $28/night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel All Around”
Reviews.Author: WisconsinCruisin09
Reviews.Content: We booked several months in advance and got a great rate. When we checked in for four nights, we were upgraded to a junior suite which was really cool with 15 foot open beam ceilings and 12 foot high windows. The large room was very clean and comfortable, especially the king bed. I don't know what brand it was, but I wish I could get one for home! The room had a fridge and microwave. The high speed internet was fast. The free breakfast had a nice variety of items, including different kinds of eggs and sausage. The bold coffee was good too. The staff was always friendly with a smile and a hello. As for location, it is just 3 blocks from the French Quarter, which is close, but not too close for the noise at night. It is also two blocks from the St. Charles streetcar line which takes you to the Garden District, Tulane Univ or Audubon Zoo. No doubt, I would stay here again as my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “A rough gem of a hotel! Very pleased!”
Reviews.Author: LARose50
Reviews.Content: I had never heard of this chain of hotels and was frankly skeptical but I read the reviews and got a fantastic deal on it so we decided to try it. We were upgraded to a suite and was very pleased with the room. I asked for something quiet so we were sent to the 4th floor. The bed was very comfortable (no window in the master but it was ok). The bathroom was good and the sleeper sofa looked brand new and was the best one I have ever layed down on. The kids were in there and the mattress on it was almost as comfortable as the bed. I guess my only criticism was that it could be a bit noisy from the ground floor where the lounge was but it could only be heard if you were in the sleeper sofa, not in the master room further back. And to their credit, when we rolled in after midnight one night, there were signs posted on the way to the elevator to please be quiet, that guests were sleeping. I thought the breakfast was very good, they even offered cut up fruit, instead of just the usual banana or apple. The front desk was very helpful and efficient. The rate was fabulous. Somehow I stumbled on to their promotion that if you opened one of those points type account with them and clicked "like" on your Facebook page, they would give you a special rate. Our whole school was in New Orleans for high school championship football games and my friends paid $140-$230 for comparable rooms (maybe fancier lobbies, but who cares), I paid a whopping $69 plus taxes and car storage of $28 per night (about average for the location). With what I saved, we were able to eat at some nice restaurants. Definetely worth the price!!

Reviews.Title: “Halloween 2011”
Reviews.Author: vermillion66
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 4 nights over the Halloween weekend. Had a very late arrival. Check in was super smooth. Valet was efficient and friendly. Room was clean and perfect for our needs. Plenty of towels, no noise heard from other rooms. I have stayed at other Country Inns and I find the chain to be a perfect blend of service and price. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, cozy hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Choie82
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly located- short walk to bourbon st,harrahs- but far enough for a good nights rest. tiny rooms, mini fridge, microwave, small bar, late nite bites, hot shower! Free cont breakfast til 9 30, free wifi & coffee 24 hrs.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ffemtrn
Reviews.Content: This hotel just off the French Quarter is very interesting. It consists of seven buildings that were or have been connected. There are exposed wood beams in the halls and the exterior walls are original giving the hotel a very interesting look and feel. We stayed one night prior to a cruise and will return for a night post cruise. The hotel is approximately 3/4 of a mile from the port. We are going to try and walk we'll see how that goes. No problems with check in and the cookies are great. We did not have the free breakfast which looked good, but instead chose a restaurant down the street and had an excellent breakfast. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for a family”
Reviews.Author: thefers
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Country Inn over Thanksgiving weekend. This wound up being a good choice for the family. We opted for a one bedroom suite. Daughter stayed in the living room and we had privacy in the bedroom. The room was well kept and roomy. Like others have said it was a bit noisy. Wall were thin and the room opened to a an atrium reaching from the lobby up to the fifth floor. We heard every rowdy guest as they entered the hotel. However, with a little white noise it wasn't too bad. Although breakfast was included, it was worth skipping. After all you are in New Orleans, the food capital of the US. Our daughter enjoyed nightly dips in the heated pool. Although not very large, it was enough to keep a 9 year old occupied after a long day of walking. Love the location. Quick walk to the French Quarter, arts district and the streetcar is one block away. The liquor store around the corner came in handy for more than just liquor. It was nice to stay close to the action without having to be in the middle of it all. We felt very comfortable and safe walking to and from the hotel. Overall we were pleased with our choice. We had trouble finding other suite hotels that actually had a separate/private bedroom. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, very nice hotel, beautiful interior”
Reviews.Author: jonnycarwash
Reviews.Content: I really liked this location...about a 10 minute walk to the French Quarter and is in an area with some good restaurants and close to a market. I found the people at the desk and the concierge to be very helpful and I enjoyed the complimentary breakfast. I also thought the open ceiling and exposed beams in the main area were a nice touch. ONLY issue I had, was when I called to make the reservation, the desk person quoted me a much higher rate than what we found online, and when I questioned her about it, she basically said words to the effect of "well, we can't offer you the lowest rate at first..." and was then able to immediately offer me the online rate I had found (and knew the exact details of it.) I found this to be a bit deceptive, but with that being said, we enjoyed our stay and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I was expecting”
Reviews.Author: Zepol95
Reviews.Content: I am a pretty frequent traveller and stay in Country Inns and Suites most everywhere I go. It is a decent chain for bbusiness travel. I have a 1 night stay here, and I am glad it was just one night. Checkin was odd to say the least, made me a little weary..got warned several times about smoking in the room, and the consequences (I am not a smoker!)..Well, when I got to my room, this was hands down the worst smelling room I have EVER been in. I feel like they should have paid me a penalty. It smelled so bad that I kept my clothes in my bag as to prevent smelling like a bar for my meeting the next day. Other problems were: Holes on the carpet, stains on the carpet, writing on the bedsheets (see picture), damaged furniture. I didn't complain..just wanted to get my meeting done and get OUT.. Otherwise, aside from odd checkin discussion, the rest of the staff was great and helpful...breakfast was great. Overall outside and lobby architecture was great...room I was in, not so much. When I go back, I will try someplace else..plenty of other Hotels for the same price range that are a little higher scale.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, but bring your walking shoes.”
Reviews.Author: minnie482
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice. The breakfast was great and free. It is a good walk to the French Quarters, but if your ready to walk a bit, you are good to go. The only bad thing about this hotel is the walls are thin. You really can hear everything. Otherwise it was great.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: dowmom33
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Country Suites. We could walk to any location we wanted, the French Quarter, Canal Street, Riverwalk, Harrah's, not to mention all the good restaurants. We thought the free breakfast was good. The breakfast had hot food, fruit, muffins, waffles, oatmeal with toppings, yogurt, juices, dry cereal and more. Best of all coffee is available 24/7. There was always plenty of room to sit with the tables located outside the breakfast room. We are sorry we didn't take advantage of the food that can be ordered during Happy Hour at the bar. The suite was spacious and we liked the separate shower in the bathroom. We were on the first floor facing Magazine Street and the possible noise was not a problem. The staff was always courteous and ready to solve any problem (our only problem was our remote didn't have batteries). We felt safe walking back to the hotel after dark. Don't miss this unique downtown hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rjm376
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the heart of New Orleans.You can walk to french Quater,River Walk, Casino and Many of the best restraunts.This hotel was perfect for a long weekend in the Big Easy.All of hotel staff went out of thier way to make our stay as pleasant as possible.The front desk was great all that worked it.Very Good.This hotel will be my choice from now on,Once again I can not say enough about the staff there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Clean, good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Polysemous
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Country Inn and Suites while at a convention in November, 2011. It was not the convention hotel but was close and considerably less expensive. The location of the hotel is good, it is about 2 blocks from Canal Street and 4 blocks down from Bourbon St. The French Quarter is close as is the Warehouse District and, not much further, the Garden District. Check in was quick and easy. Getting to my room was a little more difficult. I was on the 3rd floor and had to go up and down (after taking the elevator to the 3rd floor) 3 sets of short stairs to get to my room, bags in tow. This was inconvenient. I found a closer elevator later, which required only one set of steps, but still annoying. The room, with a single king size bed, was small but very clean. The television was at an odd angle and thus difficult to see, but I didn't watch much so it didn't bother me. My first morning I signed off on "no room cleaning" because I had work to do and didn't want to be disturbed. I went out for lunch and when I came back somebody had cleaned the room anyway, and that was bothersome. I also don't understand why hotels put out the "save the environment" cards regarding towels and linens, I returned towels to the towel-bar, but they were changed anyway. Really don't need the greenwashing. The hotel advertises free breakfast; I went once and it wasn't good. Micro-waved bacon and not very good biscuits and gravy. Far too many great restaurants in NOLA to bother with the b-fast here. Price included internet, which I appreciate. Overall, and for the price it is a fine place to stay and my wife and I will be staying there when we go down in December. Cheers

Reviews.Title: “1st time in N.O.”
Reviews.Author: irene0114
Reviews.Content: this hotel is so close to walking everywhere - we never took a cab, except to and from to airport, we walked everywhere even to mardi gras museum and if you look at the map it is far away and the river is close to walk too -

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: Kristin M
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location and staff. The building is amazing when you think about how they renovated it. Breakfast was a great addition. We were pleased with our choice to stay here- would definately return to this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Iscoot
Reviews.Content: I was in New Orleans for a conference at the Marriott, but didn't want to pay the cost for rooms reserved in that hotel. This hotel was about 2 blocks away and was great. The service was outstanding, the price was right (it event included a good breakfast), good location with lots of attractions in walking distance or you could catch the trolly quickly. The hotel was lovely and rooms were very attractive and clean. Our only problem was the remote was gone and the new one didn't want to work, but then again I wasn't there to watch tv. All of the staff were friendly and helpful. The bartender was great, so funny and friendly even when we weren't buying drinks. I would stay there again in a heartbeat and would not hesitate to recommend a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Very cozy, attractive, and well-appointed hotel”
Reviews.Author: jhw516
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here for four nights for a conference that was headquartered 1.5 blocks away at the Marriott. The staff just couldn't have been any friendlier or more helpful. The room was very nice. I was disappointed at first that i hadn't been able to u/g to a king suite -- but the regular room was actually just fine. I have come to expect small rooms in urban hotels. Everything was in good working order, the TV was great, temperature easy to regulate...basically all of my requirements. Very clean, too. The beds are EXTREMELY firm. This was probably my only major problem because I really have trouble sleeping on firm mattresses. The breakfast was just so-so but a breakfast has to really knock my socks off for me to say anything really good about it. :-) There's a good variety of stuff and the staff, again, was just great at helping out and keeping the area spotless. Unique property with a lot of great character, yet modern amenities. I expected a "motel" and really got a full-service downtown hotel. Great concierge, bell-hop, and front desk assistance. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Southern Hospitality at its Finest”
Reviews.Author: Rubyfire
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Hotel 3 blocks away from noisy Bourban Street and French Quarter. Walking distance to buses, streetcars, Harrah's Casino, Frenchman's Street, Riverwalk shopping. Complimentary breakfast. Super friendly staff. Great rooms. Complimentary fresh baked cookies at front desk. We would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Very good place”
Reviews.Author: Alexkov
Reviews.Content: Nice place. Rooms are not big, but very clean. Looby is very impressive. Service is great. Hotel is very central. French Quarter is about 7 minutes walk. Casino is close and river is close as well.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location, comfortable room and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: timmye
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights leading up to Halloween. Arrived in the early evening and had no problems checking in at all. Front desk staff are always prominent and accessible. The room was of good quality, comfy large bed and good tv. Bathroom was well kitted out and roomy. The building is a unique shape and has a few interesting features such as the balconies outdoor areas and bar. Location wise this place was ideal.
