It is nice and close to the French Quarter and Casino yet you are not too close that you are in the thick of it all. Overall I was very happy with my stay here and I will look for the Country Inn & Suites again at more locations if possible.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel close to everything”
Reviews.Author: melissa328
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel from November 10-14th for a long weekend getaway. We chose this hotel based on price and other trip advisor reviews. This hotel was great. The location was super. Close to everything, within walking distance from the french quarter and buses and street cars. It was also very quiet and restful. The hotel was decorated nicely and was very historical. Check in was a breeze and we had a room on the first floor. Everyone was friendly and helpful. Since this was our first time in New Orleans, the front desk gave us some strands of beads to welcome us. The standard room was small, but very nice. Beds were extremely comfortable and bathroom was nice with a strong hot shower. A nice plus was we had a refrigerator and microwave in the room. We had a great flat screen TV and free wireless internet. Another plus was a nice, small fitness room and a small outdoor pool, although we did not use either. Another perk was the breakfast. There was plenty of seating in the breakfast room, outside the breakfast room and even in the courtyard area by the pool. Service was great and everything was replenished quickly. Staff even cleared your dishes. There were nice selections for every taste, hot and cold options. There were even to go bags to pack something quick and take it with you, like granola bars. Very good breakfast overall. It's very nice to start your day with an included breakfast. It can really save you some money. Another nice touch was the fresh sometimes warm cookies that were available around the clock at the front desk. They were delicious and addictive. I continued to grab a few on my way in and out throughout the day. Concierge available too and was helpful with questions. Lending library a nice touch and free daily newspaper great too. Overall a really pleasant stay in a nice area and great location with a nice staff. I highly recommend and would stay here again without question.

Reviews.Title: “Great jumping point to visit ALL New Orleans has to offer”
Reviews.Author: ctfamof4
Reviews.Content: This hotel is truly a great location to access all parts of New Orleans. The Convention Center, Riverwalk area, French Quarter and Streetcar stops were ALL an easy walk from the Country Inn. The walk to the WWII Museum and Confederate/Civil War Museums were probably the longest we took & was only about 15 minutes. We found the staff to be friendly, helpful and always pleasant. We will definitely plan to stay here again on future trips to NOLA. Some reviewers had negative comments about the rooms and/or breakfast area. We found both to be good. The daily breakfast always included a hot option which was refilled often and yummy. Our kids loved the make you own waffles too. As for the rooms - we stayed in a 1 bedroom suite on the 5th floor which included a large living room area and equally large bedroom. The beds & pillows were super comfy. The only drawback were the 2 small windows which limited our view but still gave us adequate light when we were in the room - which wasn't often during our 6 days in NOLA. A winner of a hotel !!

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: VisitorTraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Country Inn based mostly on reviews here at Trip Advisor. I don't have a lot to add to the reviews already posted, but want to reiterate that this is a great alternative for those who don't want to stay right in the heart of the insanity (French Quarter). We found this hotel to be easy walking access to everything we wanted - the St. Charles Streetcar, Decatur Street (which leads to the French Market and Cafe du Monde), Harrah's casino, and yes, even the French Quarter. Room was just fine, we did hear our neighbors one night (but hey, it was Halloween weekend, and we expected some noise), but for the most part were not bothered by either hotel noise or the noise from Magazine Street. I was less impressed with the breakfast than many of the other reviewers here, however. The "hot breakfast" choices were just not to my taste (rubbery old "fried eggs", turkey bacon, French toast that had been sitting for awhile, etc), Coffee was only okay, but I'm from Seattle so I guess I'm too picky on that. The front desk staff - especially Tammy - was great, the concierge was great. Cleaning staff - well, let me just put it this way: our second day there, we were out all day, got home at 3:30 in the afternoon and the room hadn't been cleaned. We let it go. But the next day, we went out, didn't return until almost 4 pm, and the room hadn't been cleaned. To be fair, when we mentioned it, they did clean it right away. But it was a tad annoying to have to go downstairs and wait 20 minutes, which cut into our all important nap time! But really, these were minor inconveniences, and I was quite pleased with this hotel, all in all. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: Evmit
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an amazing building created out of 7 historic buildings. It's location was convenient to the French Quarter, the Central Business District, Riverwalk, etc. We were able to walk most everywhere at all times - day and night. The staff were very sociable, professional and helpful. The complimentary breakfast buffet was more than adequate. The valet parking was away from the hotel so we had to have the car brought around whenever we forgot something in the car.

Reviews.Title: “Good service, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: vashtin
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent location. Walking distance to all major spots and attractions but away from the noise and filthy streets of the French Quarter.Also if you have any mobility problems you do not want to stay in the French Quarter. The sidewalks are challenging for even the most able. Good value for money. We had a 3rd floor room to the back of the hotel. Didn't mind not having a view of Magazine Street as there was not much to see on Magazine Street. . The room was very spacious and had 2 full sized beds with enough room to move. I was surprised as from the other reviews I read before I booked I thought the rooms were going to be European size. It was not a suite but yet spacious. The bathroom was impeccably clean. My husband laughs at me because I usually judge a hotel by the bathroom and the staff. Lots of counter space in the bathroom. Love that as well. The towels were a little on the thin and rough side though. The staff, especially the front desk and restaurant, were genuinely warm and interested. They were the most helpful hotel staff I have ever encountered. Even the Concierge went out of her way to explain the process for the tax free shopping and she did not try to sell us any tours. Breakfast was decent. I am not big on breakfast so the toast and coffee were perfect before heading out for the day. I have been to lots of other hotels with a similar free buffet breakfast. This one stood out because the staff was always pleasant and willing to help and the buffet areas was kept clean even with the steady flow of guests. While we did not experience any noise from the other rooms and we were far away from the high traffic areas within the hotel our room was opposite a housekeeping room and one night there was such a racket in there. I don't know if there was a fight with the brooms or dishes or what. It went on for a few minutes and disturbed our sleep. The next morning we were rushing to meet our tour and when we returned we forgot to mention that issue to the front desk. Another morning it was the garbage truck. Really? And then another morning it was guests returning from what sounded like a wild night of partying. From other reviews it appears that noise in some form is an issue in most of the hotels in New Orleans. If you are using a taxi from the hotel to go to the airport verify the price and whether you would have to share. When our taxi arrived we were surprised to see another guest boarding with us and I don't think we paid any less in price compared to if we were not sharing.

Reviews.Title: “A very good option in New Orleans....”
Reviews.Author: kgcrouch
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Country Inn and Suites in New Orleans (Magazine Street) on November 1 and 2, 2011. This is truly a nice option in New Orleans. Sometimes there are events planned and some of the bigger hotels are very expensive during that time. This was the case during our stay. The Country Inn and Suites are across Canal Street from the French Quarter and within very easy walking distance of the sights there. It was a third of the price of some of the hotels just across Canal. They upgraded my husband and me to a King suite, which had two rooms (separate bedroom and living room), nice sized bath, microwave and mini-fridge, two TVs, etc. It is in an old New Orleans building and they have left the wonderful architectural features of the building in place. It is very clean, comfortable and nice. I will stay there again. And...the desk staff and service are very, very good. The breakfast is included and is just fine. it includes scrambled eggs and bacon...not just the usual cold foods.

Reviews.Title: “Elegance with creativity!”
Reviews.Author: dufstrmom
Reviews.Content: This hotel has it all- fabulous breakfast and happy hour with a great location. Staff was friendly and very eager to make my stay comfortable. The hotel was formerly a factory and updated with elegance and charm. My room was extremely comfortable. Location is close to Bourbon Street and the Riverside shops. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Hotel With a Traditional Style”
Reviews.Author: Bkbuzz
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Country Inn & Suites, New Orleans in the French Quarter was great. The lobby area was amazing and quite traditional with the time. The rooms were very nice and clean. The free breakfast each morning had several selections and was very good. An item was stolen from my room and when I reported it to the front desk, they just acted like "okay," it seemed like an every day occurrence and were not surprised. The evening prior to checking out, I asked the front desk to request a taxi to the airport because I did not wish to be stuck in a shuttle with several persons and having to stop at several locations before making it to the airport. In the morning, the front desk informed me they requested a taxi, however, I would be sharing it with others.

Reviews.Title: “Great except for being noisy.”
Reviews.Author: Kyle H
Reviews.Content: Really reasonably-priced hotel in a good location (just outside of the French Quarter, easy walking distance to all the sights). Even if you can't quite bring yourself to stumble home from Bourbon Street, it's just a few dollars' cab ride. The breakfast was not bad, and the lobby is attractive and inviting. The staff was friendly and unobtrusive. On the downside, our suite, which was at the very front of the hotel on the second floor (which is open to the lobby) was LOUD. Lots of noise drifted up to the room from the lobby (to the front/sitting room) and from the street (to the bedroom in the back). I suspect that rooms that don't overlook the lobby would be less loud. I was in New Orleans for a wedding and shared a suite with friends, and even though I drew the short straw and got the foldout couch, I slept well (it's a very comfortable foldout, even for grownups). I did have to wear earplugs due the aforementioned noise issues, but that's standard travel procedure for me anyhow. Next time I visit New Orleans, I will definitely consider this hotel, though I would request a less-noisy room (and still make sure I had my earplugs!). I would totally recommend it, especially if you're planning on spending a lot of your time in New Orleans out and about, not hanging around the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: roadtrip411
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights and got the last minute upgrade to the king mini-suite. It was nice to have the extra room even though there weren't any exterior windows. There was a window in the living area that faced the courtyard, so did still get some natural light. The room was spacious and comfortable and clean. The location is excellent, being a short walk to the french quarter and riverfront, but on a quiet street with a store and several restaurants. All the staff we talked to were really friendly, not just "customer service" friendly, but felt genuine. They were happy to provide suggestions and to call ahead to check hours, print street car schedules, etc. The breakfast was just average, but the waffles were good and there was a decent selection. Overall, this was a great choice and considering the price we paid with the AAA discount we were very happy and are looking forward to our next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: oakleafgal
Reviews.Content: Charming hotel, great location in the warehouse district. Walking distance to the French Quarter, WWII museum, convention center, casino, etc. Clean and nicely appointed room. Our king, 243, was very small, but comfortable, looking out over a parking lot.Very courteous front desk staff. Good full breakfast with meat, eggs, waffles, fruit, and more. Here's the disappointment. The concierge staff are employees of the tour companies and we know, in retrospect, that we were not given the best advice on how to see the city. Without going into all the details of our troubles, here are the lessons we learned. If you want an overall tour of the city, - or - a specialized tour to a specific area, find a veteran cab driver and arrange him to drive you. This is tricky as lots of cab drivers are new to New Orleans (at least post-Katrina) and do not know their way or the history. But there are veterans who will give you a wonderful personalized tour. The bus tours can waste 1.5 hours of your day as they pick up and drop off people from other hotels. Next, Tripadvisor reviewers have it right --- Confederacy of Cruisers bike tours are super. Jeff and his staff are full of history and information and advice and humor and his tour was the highlight of our trip. Also loved Mulate's, Mother's, Acme Oysters, Preservation Hall, Cafe du Monde, Coops, Adolphos.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Good Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: Oscar2331
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our recent stay at this hotel. The hotel is located about 2 short blocks from the southwest corner of the French Quarter. You can walk to the heart of the French Quarter in under 10 minutes. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful when needed. The hotel seems to be an old mill and has some of that historical feel (large windows, exposed brick walls). Breakfast was included and was your typical continental stuff, they do have eggs and breakfast meats. It wasn't all that great, but a little better than what I expect at a hotel like this. The room had large LCD tv's, microwave and refridgerator. My only complaint was the shower nozzle was pretty abrasive for me, but to be fair, my wife thought it was fine. I rated this hotel a 5 more because it was a nice hotel with a great location for a very affordable price ($100). A really great value. I would definitely stay here again and would recommend it to anyone that is looking for a value hotel. One thing to note, if you drive, there is a $25 per day valet parking charge. This seems to be a standard daily parking rate in New Orleans and parking on the street isn't easy. I wouldn't waste time seeking an alternative to valeting your car.

Reviews.Title: “location, room, staff, buffet breakfast - all good”
Reviews.Author: StChris
Reviews.Content: This place is located just a couple blocks from the French Quarter, so is quieter. The room had a small safe, mini-fridge, microwave. Staff can recommend restaurants and the concierge can arrange tours. The small outdoor pool was heated a bit too much considering the weather but nonetheless was a nice feature. There were 2 computers in the lobby although you had to stand. Good AAA rate with early booking.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Good Location, Good People, small room”
Reviews.Author: camerajim
Reviews.Content: This place was nearly perfect for our three night visit to New Orleans. The only thing detracting was the size of the room, which was so tiny the TV was mounted sideways to the bed in a small alcove of its own. This meant you either had to watch while sitting on one of the two small chairs (one a tiny dining chair, the other an office chair) or see only part of the TV from the bed. Well, we weren't in New Orleans for TV, were we? The rest of the experience was great. The location, just a couple of blocks outside the French Quarter, meant we had a short walk to almost everything. And, we needed the exercise, to work off all the great food just within reach of the hotel. We particularly enjoyed the Bon Ton Cafe right next door, which can compete with the best in this food-crazy town. The people at the hotel were friendly, most with the sort of wry humor you often find in NOLA. We might not have felt we were familiy, but we certainly felt they were letting us in on their jokes. Breakfast was more than adequate, though not a match for what's available outside. A tip: walk over to Conti Street and try the Somethin' Else Cafe for breakfast at least one morning. Wow! Also within short reach is the St Charles St. Trolley, for a trip to the Garden District. And, don't forget to get your beads from the hotel concierge.

Reviews.Title: “Another excellent hotel in this excellent hotel chain”
Reviews.Author: pamperedagain
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent location for all the sights of New Orleans. The staff here, as in all of Country Inn and Suites hotels we had stayed in during our tour, were friendly and helpful. The Concierge was really knowledgeable and had a fab sense of humour. All of the Hotels in this chain have been excellent without exception. Their customer service is something else. Not that we were swayed by the complimentary cookies and coffee on arrival or the complimentary breakfast in the morning! This Hotel was the largest in the chain that we had stayed in, but nothing was compromised, the rooms were nicely decorated and clean with many extras. Everything was within walking distance, the French Quarter, Harrah's, the market and we felt safe walking about the City even in the evening. The Natchez boat trip down the Mississippi was well worth the expense, we went on the evening cruise and enjoyed seeing the city by night. The food on board was good and plentiful, finding a table was a bit of a rugby scrum, but all in all a good trip to take. Take good walking shoes when in the French quarter, some of the pavements are in disrepair, but a lovely place to enjoy both in the daytime and the evening. We took a bus tour of the City and saw so much including the devastation of Hurricane Katrina and of course we tried the bignets!! If I am lucky enough to return to the States I will use this hotel chain again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place”
Reviews.Author: Frances H
Reviews.Content: We vacationed in NOLA for a long weekend and stayed at the Country Inn downtown. It was fantastic, great value, very friendly staff and good location. Walking distance to the French Quarter and the trolly. We enjoyed our stay very much and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, central location”
Reviews.Author: onegaucho
Reviews.Content: Was in town for a wedding and they booked these rooms for us. Central to many places such as the French Quarter, Jackson Square, Convention Center, Harrah's, etc. Most within walking distance and if not, other forms of transportation are nearby. Service was great as they were attentive to our requests for extra towels, tissue boxes, etc. Valet is very helpful and very responsive as well. They ran out of baby cribs that weekend but we managed without it. Rooms have darkening shades so you can get it really dark (which lets you sleep in!) If you're in one of the rooms that faces Magazine you might get a little noise from the street during weekends but it's not too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: NDAshley
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location if you want to see the typical New Orleans stuff (and we did!) Here's where the hotel is in relation to typical tourist attractions. Keep in mind that we are young but not into walking super-long distances (not marathoners!), so everything I list as walkable was relatively close. (And safe to walk to!) THINGS YOU CAN WALK TO FROM THIS HOTEL: *Bourbon Street (like two streets over, which is perfect b/c Bourbon St is loud!) *French Quarter/Jackson Square *Harrah's Casino (very, very close) *St Charles Street Car stop *River Walk area *Insectarium *St Louis Cathedral *Cafe de Monde/French Market THINGS THAT YOU CAN NOT WALK TO: *Garden District/Cemeteries (but you can take the Street Car for only $1.25!) *Superdome *Mardi Gras World (call for the free shuttle!) *National World War II Museum The hotel itself is very interesting...it's made up of 7 historical buildings. We got a king suite, which was unlike any other suite I've ever been in! It had a comfy pullout bed that we watched TV on, nice sitting area and roomy bathroom. The bedroom, however, was...um, odd. It was cement-style walls with a really high ceiling. There were no windows so I felt like I was in a jail cell, kind of. I think people who like old buildings will love it and appreciate its uniqueness, but it wasn't my cup of tea. Otherwise, the room was great!!! The grounds are great; wonderful free breakfast, VERY friendly staff and a cool little dipping pool. The courtyard was a romantical place to have breakfast or an afternoon drink. Overall, I would totally stay here again and recommend it to friends!!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: jacmar10
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. Friendly staff. Quiet and clan.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value in the center of New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: thorYorak
Reviews.Content: This hotel was an incredible deal after using a coupon code from the Carlson Friends program for a king suite. Even without the great room rate, I would still highly recommend this place. From what I understand, this hotel is independently operated under the Country Inn & Suites name, and it really shows with lots of attention to detail and unique touches. We were traveling with our 10month old daughter, who simply loved the warm wading pool in the courtyard and didn't mind sleeping in the courtesy crib provided to us. Our king suite was the largest we've ever stayed in, with all the amenities we needed in the sitting room. The king-size bed was huge and the bathroom was spot on, with good water pressure for showers and baths. The staff at the front desk were very helpful with recommendations and info. The hotel is a 3 minute walk to the French Quarter as well as the St. Charles and Canal St. streetcars. Of course the food in New Orleans is exquisite, so try not to fill up on the buffet breakfast or too many free cookies. My only advice to the management would be to upgrade the decor of the hallways to match the ambiance of the rooms. The rooms are nice, but the hallways feel like so many other chain hotels, which is a shame for such a special hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Big value in the Big Easy”
Reviews.Author: missd721
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Country Inn & Suites in September of 2011 with another couple (in separate rooms) for a much needed vacation. The hotel staff was helpful and friendly from check-in to check-out. The room wasn't huge, but well laid out, modern, and had GREAT air conditioning, which is key in this city. The free breakfast was super convenient, and the patio/terrace area was a gorgeous setting for drinks in the evening. The location was ideal- so close to the French Quarter and transport to all the major street car lines, but tucked away from the noise for a perfect sleep. The price was also a nice surprise for the quality of accommodations. With alllllllll of the taxes (which are high in Louisiana) it was $700USD for 6 days.

Reviews.Title: “Good in every way”
Reviews.Author: arnhart
Reviews.Content: Wonderful centrally located hotel - staff very helpful - being able to have a cooked breakfast included in the price was an added bonus. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone planning on visiting New Orleans. Thank you Country Inn and Suites!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: FLYTHEW0RLD
Reviews.Content: The Country Inn & Suites is a good hotel in a great location. The hotel is situated just outside the French Quarter and is in easy walking distance to all of the French Quarter. The area feels safe. The front desk staff were really friendly. The room is of a reasonable size. The wireless Internet connection was really poor! The breakfast was excellent. Overall a good clean hotel in a great location and it's recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay between French Quarter and Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: So_Cal_Illini_81
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel very last minute the week before we were to attend a conference at the convention center. Our first room was on the second floor right above the electric front door. We couldn't figure out what was going on when our room would shake and we would hear a loud rumble every couple of minutes. The next morning when we told the desk they claimed no one had ever mentioned that before. We found that very hard to believe. Luckily another room came open and we were able to move. The second room was much quieter. Our room was a suite, the front room had a loveseat (very hard and not very comfortable) a desk and a chair. The bed room was in the back. The room came with a free breakfast that was pretty good, lots of hot and cold options. The staff did have trouble keeping the food stocked and the room cleaned. Most of the breakfast staff was a little surly too. the front desk staff and bellboys were all very nice. It is an easy walk (about 11 or 12 short blocks) to the convention center and about three blocks to Canal street (the border of the French Quarter). It was also within walking distance of the WWII museum. I think the hotel is a pretty good value and a good place to have an extended stay due to the extra room of the suite. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Location is good”
Reviews.Author: diamondruby
Reviews.Content: Stayed there 5 nites in early Sept. Check in very good, young man at desk very friendly, gave us a large corner suite overlooking Magazine St. First 2 nights very peaceful and quiet, bed very comfortable. Breakfast was OK. Third nite was horrible. Came back to a next door neighbor having a large rowdy party with marijuana, Security attempted to handle situation but it went on for hours. Next morning I asked to be moved as neighbor was not checking out for 1 more day. I was disappointed at response by desk clerk. It was on us as far as inconvenience. We were expected to pack up everything and vacate room so that it could be prepared for someone else. I had to ask for help getting belongings to lobby. We were called on my cell phone when another room was ready. My husband had to bring up bags Room did not compare to the original room. Bedroom had no window but a brick wall. Front sitting area had a window overlooking atrium. It was eery. You could not tell if it was daytime or not.. I realized by the 4th nite that part of the problem was the paper thin walls. We could hear everything from our neighbor's room, and I do mean everything. Best thing about the hotel was location to all tourist spots and transportation but I would not stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Just like the description”
Reviews.Author: Steve P
Reviews.Content: When we walked in to the hotel at about 8pm after 24 hours of travelling from Australia, my first thought was that I had been there before, I hadn't but the descriptions I had read of the hotel were so accurate. The welcome after such a long journey was warm and friendly, the room was large, cool and welcoming. Breakfast was nice, both hot and cold dishes were offered with plenty of variety. The hot breakfast changed daily and was more than adequate. The bar was a reasonable price with a happy hour (or so). the staff were friendly and helpful and the position of the hotel allowed easy access to the Quarter without the noise in the evening. (other than some inconsiderate guests that no hotel can be responsible for). The hotel was in a location that was handy for the sites, the shops and transport. The only thing that spoiled a perfect stay was the taxi we had ordered for our departure turned up with out a meter and we were ripped off on our journey to the Greyhound Bus Station. A journey of about half a mile cost us $10. This was not the hotels fault as it was ordered by the tour desk, but nevertheless the hotel uses this facility. This happened in other hotels on our trip across America, but we learnt in the end to hail our own taxi's. It's the sort of thing that leaves a sour taste after a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “nicely renovated old warehouse”
Reviews.Author: hippiedr
Reviews.Content: We got this for $57 during the week. The room was nice with 12 ft ceilings. Unfortunately the rest was modernly done but still nice. This is a good location to walk to the French Quarter or Canal St. Breakfast was good with waffles and hot eggs and bacon with fresh fruit. There is a huge parking charge of $35 per day.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Pattyjpp
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a wonderful atmosphere - everyone was so friendly and helpful! The building is as unique as the rooms were. The way the bedroom was set up in the back with no windows made it dark and comfortable to sleep as long as you wanted. We never noticed any outside noise and everything we needed was there or we just had to ask. We enjoyed sitting on the patio and eating our breakfast and it was within walking distance to just about everything. Front desk was very helpful with any question we had. When we went to leave our car battery was dead (had been giving us problems prior to the trip) and the valet employees did everything under the sun to help us. Friends of ours stayed at the Ambassador one night and then switched everything over this hotel with us. They were SO happy to be there! Love this place & would certainly go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Cenobite3
Reviews.Content: We stayed a total of three nights and would book this place again. It's close enough to walk to the French Quarter and also to public transit - but far enough away that the noise won't keep you up. The interior is old with nice brickwork in the rooms, and it's well kept. Our first night we asked the gentleman at the front desk for a local map. We got this and he also wrote out on it recommendations and areas to visit or avoid. Everyone was always very helpful and friendly. My only complaints would be that the pool is a little small and the laundry cost three times what I was originally told (still not very expensive.) This hotel is a great price for the quality we received and I'd definitely recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good value close to the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: charlotte7208
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Country Inn & Suites on Maganzine St. the last week of Agust, while helping my daughter move. The hotel is architecturally interestingly, the rooms are clean with a good layout and the staff is helpful (although the front desk staff is mostly pretty slow . . . ). I do have 2 beefs: my neighbors were rather loud (but the hotel isn't responsible for that) and I sent a silk blouse out to be dry cleaned and it came back with 2 large spots on center front. In essence, it was ruined. Hotel called cleaner who offered to reimburse immediately. Still awaiting the reeimbursement . . . . Otherwise, good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT SUPERDOME LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: TRAVELCRITICTEAM
Reviews.Content: wanted someplace very walkable to make a saints game and this fit the bill. only about 20min away. got a package of website including free parking and free hot breakfast!!! staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. only 2 blocks from canal st and 2 from poydras.

Reviews.Title: “What a great find for a hotel”
Reviews.Author: folkma
Reviews.Content: I just completed a 7-day stay at this hotel and I could not have been more happy with my choice. I absolutely have nothing bad to say about the hotel and the staff. Everything was perfect. I always feel a little uneasy when I choose the hotel for friends traveling with me in their own rooms but they also were quite pleased. The hotel even provides breakfast in the morning with mostly "cold items" but 1-hot entree is also provided every day. The hotel is not in the French Quarter but it is an easy and safe walk to the place. The staff was so friendly and accommodating and place was very clean. The room was a nice size and in very good shape. I would not hesitate to say here again and would definitely recommend it to friends and associates.

Reviews.Title: “good Location”
Reviews.Author: alloved
Reviews.Content: Rooms extremely small. Advertise "somking rooms" on internet. We booked this trip according to that add. FALSE ADVERTISEMENT. Sign in lobby area says "Coffee 24 hours aday" ALSO false advertisement. When I woke up at 4 am from my back hurting from the bed, I went downstairs to get a cup of coffee so I would't wake up the rest of the family, NO COFFEE.!!! A worker sitting in there playing cards told me there was't any coffee. When I reffered to the sign I was told, "coffee is available 24 hours a day when they make it".

Reviews.Title: “Bang for your buck.”
Reviews.Author: whodat39564
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice hotel, rooms were very clean, and it only cost $60 per night. Location was very good, and a very helpful staff. The only down side was the size of the room for a standard king, kind of cramped for 2 people but if you are traveling alone it will work just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a one night stay”
Reviews.Author: outtagas
Reviews.Content: The room we were given was small but very clean and comfortable. Good for a one night stay but would have been too small for a longer stay. The hotels is comprised of what appears to be several adjoining buildings so although an elevator takes you to your floor you may have to manuver some stairs with your luggage. Very kind and courteous staff especially the desk clerk that checked us in when we arrived. Would consider staying again but would request a larger room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice!”
Reviews.Author: TrvlLuv
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent for the proximity to the FQ whether you choose to walk, take the trolley or drive and park. The hotel was very clean and charming. Our room was spacious and quiet, even though we were above the lobby and near the street. We had a voucher for free valet parking and the manager happily honored the arrangement for our entire stay. We are big fans of Country Inn & Suites and this property doesn't disappoint!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: mikestamm
Reviews.Content: We just spent four nights at the Country Inn and Suites for a family vacation. The staff was friendly and helpful, the room and facilities were very clean. The best thing about it was the location on Magazine St. The area is quiet and safe, yet only 2-3 blocks from the French Quarter. The breakfast was better than average for a free hotel breakfast, with several different hot items every morning. There is no restaurant on site but the desk manager had delivery menus from a couple of local places when we were too tired to go out one night. The small pool is nestled in a very pretty courtyard. The parking valets were attentive and we never had to wait more than 10 minutes for our car.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in an awesome spot”
Reviews.Author: curlgirl4u
Reviews.Content: The service we received from the moment we checked in until check out was extremely good! We booked a 1 bedroom suite and there was plenty of room in it, the beds were very comfortable (I travel alot and am very picky with the bedding), and it was very clean. Don't get me wrong--it is not a Westin or Waldorf--but you are also NOT paying $300+ a night. Considering the cost of a room here and its location (walking distance to most everything in the french quarter and the warehouse district--very convenient), I was more than pleasantly surprised--in fact I was apprehensive about booking it because i can be a hotel snob--I've stayed in many really nice hotels and because of that have certain expectations. I had my children with me (teenagers) so it was nice to be close to everything and to feel like I was in a safe neighborhood when walking back to it at night. The breakfast had a good variety (but not my favorite comparing it to other hotels in a similiar price range) and was fresh but I really can't complain when it's included with the room. My only complaint is one evening at 11:30 pm, we went into the courtyard to unwind and I put my feet into the pool to relax them after walking all day. After being there for 5 min, a security guard rushed out and said that the pool closes at 11. (You are allowed to be in the courtyard but a sign says the pool closes at 11--I didn't think putting my feet in 4 inches of water while sitting there quietly and completely sober would warrent the security guard to come rushing out but I guess technically I was breaking the rule of no swimming after 11.) Overall this an awesome deal!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, comfy bed!”
Reviews.Author: ccumomsc
Reviews.Content: We spent only one night here while visiting New Orleans. The location of this hotel is excellent. Walking distance to Bourbon Street, the streetcar pick up spots, Harrah's Casino and many bars and restaurants. The hotel itself is several buildings connected in a way that you almost don't realize its not just one building. The exposed beams make the place feel really old world. The bed was so comfortable, not your typical hotel room mattress. The room was equipped with a mini fridge which is convenient for soda and snacks. While breakfast was included in our room rate, the breakfast area is really small and congested. We ended up not being able to really take advantage of what they had to offer to eat, couldn't get close enough to the food to put any our plate! Also, a small complaint but the hand towels need to be upgraded. They were so small and thin you'd need two to do the job one. All in all, we would probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A GREAT PLACE TO STAY IN NOLA”
Reviews.Author: LI-fam
Reviews.Content: Our second stay at this really excellent not so little Inn in NOLA. We love the location, close to the quarter, but quiet at night when you want to turn in. An easy walk down Canal to the Riverfront, and up Poydras to pick up the St Charles street car. The entire staff, front desk, valet, maintenance and cleaning are all quick with a friendly greeting and to lend a hand if needed. The rooms are smallish, but have a fridge (if requested) and the beds are really comfortable. A really good vigorous shower too. A fair breakfast is included, perfect to start your day, because you'll eat fabulous New Orleans food for the rest of the day.

Reviews.Title: “Decent stay”
Reviews.Author: kh895
Reviews.Content: Didn't have a car so we walked to everything. Fairly close to everything but we did put miles on the shoes. Also chose this place due to the free breakfast. The breakfast was just okay.

Reviews.Title: “Failed to honor reservation”
Reviews.Author: coldlite
Reviews.Content: I booked through expedia. When we arrived the room we had reserved had been given to another person (we were there at 5:00 p.m.). Told me point blank that they don't honor expedia reservations and if someone else wants your room they will get preference over you, even if you booked the room months in advance (which I had). I told them they had my money for months but they still would not honor my reservation. They couldn't because they had given it to someone else. They sent me to another hotel at no additional charge and I got a room, but I missed out on some the festivities I planned to attend because of it. I won't be back. Musty odor in lobby and clearly not a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: abel11
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed staying at this hotel. The location was perfect, right in the French quarter, and in a safe area. The hotel was charming, loved the architecture and the set up. The room was clean and comfortable. The breakfast buffet selection was wonderful. Friendly and accommodating hosts. Especially loved the concierge, Kathy, who was so helpful to us and gave awesome recommendations on where to go and what to do in New Orleans. She had helpful information on local tours, restaurants and hang-out places. We really enjoyed New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel, shame about the noisy neighbours!”
Reviews.Author: truckstopblues
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, good sized rooms that are very comfortable, very friendly and helpful staff and a superb breakfast. Only downside is the rooms have paper thin walls so you hear everything that is happening in the next rooms which meant no sleep!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: theja1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for Chrismas 2010. Very nice hotel. Very clean, Valet parking only, has a small bar and a small pool (outdoor, but heated). Only issue we had was the walls are thin and you can hear everything from the other rooms. Wasn't too bad, but I'm a light sleeper.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BROWNSDM
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Country Inn and Suites. It is ideally situated...within walking distance of the French Quarter, downtown and the River. Upon entry each day we were warmly greeted by the staff. The breakfast was the best and the breakfast staff did a great job keeping the area clean and replenishing the food. The coffee was great and so were the cookies available at the front desk. The few times we called housekeeping, our request were readily handled. The only complaint I have is the with the the person who cleaned our room since she or he never replaced the coffee filter or soap. I highly recommend this hotel for families.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, Great Price, Great Locatoin”
Reviews.Author: samsternjones
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here for three nights in late July on what was the first trip to New Orleans for both of us. We shared a big 1-bedroom suite, that allowed for enough room and a locking door between us (my friend can drown out a freight train when he gets to snoring). The hotel was affordable, the room was clean. The bed was comfortable and very nice, and we had a lot of big windows, in our corner room. There was a safe in the closet, good water pressure and lots of channels available on both the TV in the living room and the one in the bedroom. Free WiFi was really nice as well. The hotel is not in the French Quarter, but is very close by, and on a quiet, nice street. I thought the location was ideal, close to the action, but far enough away that when you came home, you could sleep. I would definitely stay at this hotel again if I were back in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “What a beautiful spot”
Reviews.Author: Dre0303
Reviews.Content: The building is truly original - made up of a collection of buildings you can see the bones of the original structures throughout the space. Very nice and in a quieter part of NOLA just blocks from the French Quarter. One odd thing, the pool is more like a pond. It looks rustic and you can float and look at the stars, in the openings of the walls surrounding the space but you certainly cannot do laps.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: armadillotexas
Reviews.Content: We booked a hotel through a deal at Expedia where you only know the price and they don't tell you what hotel it is until you actually book the rooms. We booked 3 rooms for 2 nights and were very happy with this hotel. Staff was friendly, cookies were good. One of the rooms we got smelled like smoke and when we told the staff, they gave us another room. Breakfast was delicious, with a lot of choices and real silverware and plates. The rooms were clean. We got one room on Magazine Street, but could not hear the noises or traffic. We loved this hotel and will probably be back on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, lovely, friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: IRL-MexAus
Reviews.Content: We were a large party in a family reunion. We had 3 rooms for 2 nights before going on a cruise and 3 more rooms afterwards, so we really got to see a few different rooms. All were great, some were HUGE! for the same price we could really see that some rooms are much larger than others, but even the smaller ones were of a very reasonable size, the other ones were just much more than expected! Clean and nice, branded toiletries, comfy beds, lots of room, all great! The breakfast is also really good. The pool is tiny but it was not in our plans to spend much time there. If that is important for you, then you might want to reconsider, but if it is just to cool down or for the kids to spend a bit of time there, then it is more than plenty. But the best, is the PEOPLE! super friendly and helpful, keen to help and accomodate every single request we had. We would definitely stay there again when we go back to New Orleans!

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: Thepeevs
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my family for 3 nights in June 2011. Hotel has great character, meshing the old with the new. If you don't like your room, ask for another one because there are several different styles/layouts. Service from all employees was excellent. We enjoyed the free hot breakfast and cookies. Within walking distance of the French Quarter, casino and WW2 museum. I was not comfortable walking at night by myself but we never had any problems while we were there. The pool is very small but quaint.

Reviews.Title: “superb!”
Reviews.Author: sashamar6
Reviews.Content: Reserved one bedroom, were upgraded to a suite due to friend's available points. This is what a hotel should be. Clean and spacious; everything you could want. Free breakfast with lots of choices (and free fresh-baked cookies in the p.m.) Received a call from the staff after check-in to see if we needed anything. On-site bar, 24-hour coffee, a staff that aims to please in a lovely setting and good location to everything. Valet parking, and we were allowed to leave the car and luggage longer than noon check-out without an extra charge. The staff seemed genuinely happy that our stay was a good one! What a difference (like night and day) between this and our stay at Hotel De L Eau Vive just down the street the week before. That was a huge disappointment. What a dump!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!!”
Reviews.Author: boo98
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week and it was great, terrific location, only a couple of blocks from the french quarter, the WW 11 museum, and the conferate museum. The breakfeast were terrific, and Frank the conceirge was the best!!! Helped us with where to go, what to do and gave us coupons for some of the best places to eat!!! He is a real gem!!!. Front desk staff was very helpful and friendly. Rooms a little tired but the bed was great and the rooms were clean.

Reviews.Title: “STAY HERE, STAY HERE!!”
Reviews.Author: moonlight3374
Reviews.Content: Nothing but good things to say about this charming hotel. Loved the friendliness of all the staff. Loved the front desk clerks, and of course Ryan was also a great deal of help with suggestions and ideas of where to go and what to do..... We loved the courtyard for our morning coffee (and evening drinks!) The bartender was also a doll!! The breakfast was delicious and they never ran out. Coffee was wonderful as well! Great location. We easily walked to the french quarter, Bourban St. and nearby restaurants. Lovely experience. We both loved it and would def stay again!

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: diceman13
Reviews.Content: I booked a one bedroom suite and did get but it was right by the elevator,but turns out no big deal never heard any noise and the bedroom in suite had no windows and a steel door so very quite and dark,perfect for sleeping.The rest of suite was very light and pleasant.May not be the sexy place to stay but staff was great and slept very good.Would come back here any time which i do not say very often.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff and atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: missy1600
Reviews.Content: My first time to New Orleans, location made walking to downtown French quarters,waterfront and trolley stops a breeeze.Loved the way they took an old wharehouse and converted to the hotel. Cannot thank the staff enough ,everyone went out of there way to make sure your stay was perfect. Thank you so much

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, friendly staff, exactly what we expected...”
Reviews.Author: kyliesaute
Reviews.Content: I checked TripAdvisor before booking this hotel and found all the positive reviews helpful...I couldn't find a thing to complain about. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly, our room was clean, the pool, though probably the tiniest pool I've ever seen, was perfect for a quick dip to cool off after a long day of walking through the French Quarter and Garden District. Breakfast time was a little crazy, perhaps a better layout would ease the congestion in the breakfast room, but there was plenty of food - not great food - but plenty to get you started to eating your way through New Orleans. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value close to everything and far enough to be quiet.”
Reviews.Author: Robbroamers
Reviews.Content: Ok. Clean and quiet. Watch out for rooms that require you to go up and down the stairs. Ryan, the conceirge is nice but shouldnt be working here as he obviously only leaves Burbon street and alcohol long enough to sort of work. Other than that, Andrew at the front desk is awesome and Bryan at the breakfast area is a dream!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place-can't wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: duckypole
Reviews.Content: This hotel property was a sweet surprise! Not like your average Country Inn and Suites that are usually a stand alone hotel near an airport. This property is a renovated warehouse building, that has both the charm and european feel of the French Quarter, plus a fabulous staff and accommodations. We loved the architectural design of the main lobby with it's exposed cypress beams above in an atrium-like area. It is located only 2 or 3 short blocks away from the Quarter, off Canal Street. I would go there again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “If im back in NOLA ,ill give you a call”
Reviews.Author: aussielen
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a hidden Gem,although our plans changed when our adult daughter was a late addition to our holiday we had 3 of us in the room but still had enough room,this hotel is just the right distance from the main GAME, bourbon st and the french quater ,close to canel st and the wharf ,we never felt unsafe at night . the breakfast was great and the staff were very helpful with any question we had ,most of all the price was great . would not hesitate going back to this hotel ,

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but not great”
Reviews.Author: janefromtexas
Reviews.Content: The staff was quite pleasant. Concierge one evening was really not too well informed, but tried. Our room had not been thoroughly cleaned after the previous guests and they responded to our concerns. We stayed 3 nights, but only had 1 breakfast because of a large tour group that overwhelmed breakfast area and attendants. Suite 501 was at the end of the corridor with 2 small high windows that furnished natural light, but minimal view. Beds were comfortable, but furnishings showing wear. Plenty of very thin towels available. Location was convenient for walking the WWII museum, river, St. Charles steetcar, and French Quarter. There was sometimes a delay in car valet service, but all personnel were professional and polite. However, one day as we waited with our teenage- granddaughter, a homeless man came in and sat in the lobby to chat with us while he cooled off. Because there was no one at door or staff persons aware, we eventually moved until our car arrived. No harm was done, but we did feel uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: skipper1952
Reviews.Content: Staff was awesome! Customer Satisfaction is their TOP priority.

Reviews.Title: “Love this Country Inn & Suites - Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: Fepeaux
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Country Inn & Suites July 5-9, 2011. This hotel is awesome! The location is on Magazine St 2 blocks from Canal and the French Quarter. Magazine turns into Decatur St on the other side of Canal so you are on the main path to walk to Jackson Square and Cafe Du Monde. The street is relatively quiet and safe. The hotel is made out of the renovation and combining of four distinct older buildings and has so much charm! We had a suite on the 3rd floor overlooking Magazine St. The suite was 1 bedroom king with small hall and a front sitting room with a queen pull-out sofa that our 8 year old slept on. The rooms and bathroom are small but the extremely high ceilings make it very comfortable. There is a microwave and small fridge and 2 huge flat screen televisions. The included breakfast buffet runs from 630-930 weekdays and 730-1030 weekends. The food includes bagels/toast/muffins/cereals every day along with a couple of hot items which change each day. The food does run low near the end of the breakfast time so it does help to not wait until the last minute. The small courtyard pool is more of a 'dipping' pool about 8'x12' and only 4 ft deep at the most. It is fun to splash around in for kids but not much else that that. But it is so charming! The best things about this hotel are the walking distance to everything and the great service! We especially appreciated Andrew who ran the front desk in the evenings. He was always quick to help with any question. This hotel is not the Ritz and not a high end 5-star hotel, but it is one of the best deals you are going to find in New Orleans! (We had a suite for $99/night and parking was $24/night plus all standard taxes.)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: shelleyscorner
Reviews.Content: With so many hotel choices, I wasn't sure what to expect. The staff was fantastic! The 2 suites that we had were perfect for our family of 5 (incl 3 college students) and clean. We enjoyed not having to pay for internet and also having a fridge & m/wave in the suites. The breakfast, while better than a standard "free breakfast", was not plentiful so do not wait until the last hour to eat or you'll stand the risk of getting the leftovers. They also offer free cookies & milk, but were always out of cookies by the time we got in each night (11ish). Perhaps because of the prices (compared to many other sites), there were plenty of younger families with running and loud children. Can't think of an excuse for the loud and obnoxious adults though(probably the loud kids' parents)! We'd stay here again...the location is hard to beat!

Reviews.Title: “Would Come Back!”
Reviews.Author: addie33
Reviews.Content: Very gracious staff. Hotel was unique. Rooms were clean and comfortable. Cookies (FREE) awesome. Close to WWII National War Museum and within walking distance of French Market. Only drawback was the small pool. Great family experience.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Room, Convenient location. What more can you ask for?”
Reviews.Author: S_A_HALL621
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during the last week of June. Booked kinda last minute through orbitz. Was a bit skeptical due to some of the reviews on here. But i was in for a pleasant suprise. It is one of the better hotels ive visited during my travels. No complaints about the room whatsoever. It was small but clean & tidy. The hotel also is in a location, quick walking distance from all the action but still on a safe quiet block. It is right around the corner from the French Quarter;the party strip of Bourbon st., the classy art galleries of Royal st, and a streetcar tram which will bring you to the outskirts of the city. The staff seemed a bit frigid at times but that was not my main concern concern. Its a good hotel. I'd suggest it to anyone visiting NOLA, especially first-timers. And most importantly, a free coffee machine too!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it - good quiet location - close to action”
Reviews.Author: AnneinVirginia
Reviews.Content: We loved the Country Inn in New Orleans. It's just a few block from from the action, near the WWII museum and great food. The rooms are big with high ceilings and clean. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great overall”
Reviews.Author: drjGa
Reviews.Content: Convenient and quiet location. Easy walk to river and French Quarter. Restored series of buildings so nice my wife wants a condo like this. Sheez! Breakfast typical of CI &S, would have liked boiled eggs also as others have...but ah well. Outstanding part is the front desk (pm) Andrew. Spot on w/ recco for restaurants!!! Cheerful and attentive, baby sat a doll for a 5 y/o, upbeat and professional. Can't pay folks like this enough. Frank, as concierge, was helpful (birthday cake!), could have a bit more knowledge in depth of various venues but that will come in time. He is a gem. Only minor negative is concierge isn't "linked" to hotel. eg, Can't bill to room, has to use personal cell for calls. Come on,if he's there to serve give him the tools he needs. Clean rooms and comfortable beds Would return and probably will.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and price - Will definitely come again”
Reviews.Author: Hoosierderby
Reviews.Content: This was a business trip for my husband, and fun trip for myself. Loved the location of the hotel. Steps from Canal St, Harrah's, and Bourbon St. and the Convention center weren't too far away either. The pool was pretty tiny, and the exercise room was small but efficient. Cool architectural details in the lobby. Only weird thing was there were stairs to get to our room coming off the elevator. Kind of a pain dragging your bags down all the stairs. Besides that, we loved it and will be back.

Reviews.Title: “What's Important?”
Reviews.Author: svanwass
Reviews.Content: When staying in New Orleans there are a few things I look for in a hotel. One is location. New Orleans is a walking city. This hotel is located in a good spot, two blocks off Canal so very close to the Quarter but not in it. Two blocks from the casino and a two blocks from a street car pickup location. Second is a quiet room. Our room was perfect, on the top floor and on the end of the building. We did not hear much at all during the night. The last thing is value. This was a very good value. We got the room for $67 per night, including tax, on Hotwire. That was an excellent value. Now the room was small but youâ€™re not in the room much. The staff was OK except for the evening clerk which never got anyone to our room to clean it one night. The hotel was an old warehouse so it has lots of charm. The pool is the size of a hot tub and the elevators are very slow. Free breakfasts were typical and what you should expect for free. All-in-all, I would stay here again for the value, location, and quiet rooms. If you want an up-scale hotel go someplace else.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased”
Reviews.Author: TarHeelBiggy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I returned to New Orleans for the first time in fifteen years and wanted to try somewhere other than Bourbon Street for our stay this time. Thanks to the recommendation of family members we chose Country Inn & Suites and were not disappointed in any way. The hotel is clean, the personnel very personable and helpful, and well trained in their jobs. I am not wild about valet parking, but this was the best experience I've had with that. The breakfast is very good and well presented with a pleasant place to eat and both the concierges we talked with while we were there were extremely helpful. Our room was not large, but neither was it too small. If you need larger rooms, or even suites, they are available, too. The location is very convenient to the French Quarter, and my wife and I had no problem at all walking everywhere we wanted to go for three days in that area, and we're both pushing 70. After we checked out, we drove to the Garden District and enjoyed a wonderful walking tour of that area before we left the city. NOLA is still a great city with many wonderful attractions and if we visit again we will not hesitate to stay again with our friends at Country Inn & Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectation”
Reviews.Author: brownfishrach
Reviews.Content: To start - I am extremely critical of service as an industry worker of eight years. The service received is worth taking time to share even though I did not stay actually. The booking and cancellation were easy. However, there was still the refund adventure. I was unable to do anything with the booking company except rely on Ronnell and his team, namely Rachelle and Kendrick (I called Kelvin), who were exceptional. They graciously accepted the task requested and kept me well informed while remaining professional, friendly and enthusiastic. If ever I were to stay, I would try this hotel based on the service received thus far via the phone which is often more challenging than in person.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: funinthesun44
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Country Inn and Suites June 1 for 3 nights. Travelled with my mother in law. We had a one bedroom suite with 2 queen beds. The room was so spacious and had a mini fridge and a microwave (which we did use both). The complimentary breakfast each morning had homemade waffles (yummy), bagels, bakery items, sausage, eggs, cereals and fresh fruit (yummy). We did put our feet in the small pool one day to cool off some. The pool was located in an adorable courtyard The location was excellent. We were within a few blocks of the french quarter and Harrahs. I have to say I am so glad that we did NOT stay in the heart of the French Quarter as it was too crowded and had a rank smell about it!! All the employees at the hotel were extremely friendly and helpful. I would definately recommend this hotel to all my friends and family. I hope to visit New Orleans again in the future and would stay here again thanks for a wonderful quick getaway!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and felt welcomed. Will return on future trips.”
Reviews.Author: mamamiaWashington_La
Reviews.Content: When we entered the door, we were welcomed with Mardi Gras Beads. No hassle check in policy. We wanted to stay an extra day and the front desk did excellent job to assist. They did everything possible and no was not an option. They lady at the information desk was very helpful with showing us where to go to eat. The hotel was cozy and felt like home. The breakfast served hot food, cereal, fruits, etc.......We left the hotel full and ready to start our day. A great way to save a few dollars. Had cookies throughout day for children to snack with granola bars. The area was centered for all the activities we had planned for the kids and yet walking distance to Bourbon. We were tucked away from the "Big City" atmosphere, yet enjoyed and was able to walk everywhere we needed. Had bus transportation and streetcar. Note: BUY A DAY PASS OF $3.00 PER PERSON AND RIDE STREETCAR TO ALL DESTINATIONS INCLUDING THE ZOO. Then take shuttle bus to zoo. Great place to stay. Will definately stay there again. We had an extra treat. Was able to watch the filming of Nicholas Cage's new movie Medallion being filmed behind our hotel. We sat in our hotel window and watched some of the filming. Was even able to see Nicholas Cage.

Reviews.Title: “One Of The Best!!!!”
Reviews.Author: marilynjoy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here right at the start of our 5 week holiday in the USA, we found the hotel lovely, a nice change to the concrete block buildings, that can be found in any large city , in the world. Our room was spotless, and the beds oh so comfortable, the little extras, like fresh cookies, just made us feel more at home. Our evenings always started with happy hour at the bar, John and Melvin, looked after us so well, thank you! We had lots of laughs with you guys. Even though we stayed at many fantastic hotels during our trip, we both think, Country Inn was one of the best. We would love to come back one day!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: hseider88
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great, people were always friendly and was in walking distance to anything we wantd to see downtown. They let us hold our luggage after we checked out and even made it available to check in early so we could store our stuff. The breakfast was great and had lots of choices. If you are looking for a pool for kids this isn't the place to stay but is in a historic building and had great and helpful conceirge to help book things so will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, perfect price”
Reviews.Author: jenitravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our first time in New Orleans. Basically we went by other reviews and price was a huge factor. At the time we stayed here (last week in January) we booked it in advance I got a standard queen for about $50/night. This hotel is a 2/3 star hotel and even though it is not extravagant, it definitely is not a dive. The hotel is located right outside the french quarter in a very quiet street off of a very busy street. Hotel staff was very nice. Free hi-speed internet and free printer. Hotel has pizza and a small bar. Rooms were very clean and have a fridge and microwave which is a plus. The Harrah's casino is very close by and so is some of the more popular restaurants such as Mothers and Cochon. It is the perfect distance from the French Quarter- close enough to walk to and far enough not to be near all the noise and partying. Would stay here again and would also recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we wanted”
Reviews.Author: Nellnee
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel and a great staff. We had this room booked for six months and read all the reviews before hand so we knew what we were expecting. Did ask for a room that faced the street and not the atrium and it was quite and although short on windows that made it very easy to sleep! Kathy the concierge was not only helpful but friendly and engaging. Rochelle at the desk is a sweetheart. All the staff was friendly -- and trust me, we saw a lot of surly in the city, too. The breakfast was more than we expected and we were able to grab some fruit and granola bars to get us through morning tours. Location is great to get to the French quarter and the garden district. It is definitely a three-star hotel though -- if you want four star you should go elsewhere and pay for it.

Reviews.Title: “Front Desk was terrific, but some lady freaked us out”
Reviews.Author: sfcoyote
Reviews.Content: When I walked in the door I was enchanted by the building, what a great use of space. My first encounter was with Gordon and he was very patient and understanding while I searched for my credit card, great asset to the hotel, then some lady came from behind with blond hair screeching "how ya'll doing", and about scared me half to death! I have heard of southern hospitality, but really, was that necessary? Room was comfortable, though it looked a bit warn over the years. I think with the rates that are charged they could take some of that money and put it into some renovations. Breakfast was mediocre at best, and when we arrived there was no hot food to be found. I wonder what they other guest ate? We left and went somewhere else for breakfast Frank was very nice and knowledgeable and told us a great place for breakfast. When we checked out, Gordon was back at the desk, I wonder if he ever gets a day off? Housekeeping was great. Let me know when you do some sprucing up? If it wasn't for the front desk, I don't think we would have enjoyed our stay that much.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable hotel in an expensive city”
Reviews.Author: cull_family
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Country Inn & Suites in the Central Business District, about a block or two away from the French Quarter. Canal Street divides the French Quarter from the Central Business District, and this hotel is located about 2 blocks away from Canal Street. It's only a couple blocks from the Audubon Insectarium, to which my husband and son walked because it was so close. The hotel is about 7 blocks away from the Louisiana Children's Museum, and we walked there, as well. Once you reach Canal Street, you can take the Canal Street cars down to the Mississippi River, and take another street car from there--right in front of the Audubon Aquarium. Or you can take the Canal Street car down to the St. Charles street car down to the Garden District. The swimming pool is kind of small because it's tucked into a charming little courtyard, but it does the job if you just want to take a quick dip for cooling down from the New Orleans heat. It's a nice little spot with lots of greenery and waterfalls. As far as parking goes, this hotel has valet parking only. So you will have to pay hefty charges for parking in this city. I forgot what we paid to park; you might want to call the hotel for that info. But better to pay for parking and walk or ride public transportation where you can. Don't drive here if you're from out of town. We were thankful that a relative of ours living in New Orleans drove us around the Garden District because of the potholes and unpredictable traffic patterns. This hotel has a charming look with rafters extending above the lobby area. Compared to newer suburban area hotels, the rooms are kind of small, but with high ceilings. So voices carry easily within the rooms. We had two problems during our stay: 1. The small refrigerator in our room, so all the food we had in there spoiled. 2. The toilet overflowed because the ball inside the tank kept getting stuck whenever we flushed it. Luckily, when the water spilled out of the toilet and all over the bathroom floor, it was clean water. I was a little disappointed that no one from staff helped us clean up the mess; we had to do that ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Gave away our prepaid room”
Reviews.Author: RichlandMiniBreakers
Reviews.Content: Cannot recommend this hotel for the main reason that, in spite of pre-paying all 4 nights of our stay (not just the first night) 6 months in advance, and in spite of us calling the hotel at 3pm the day of our arrival to tell them we would be arriving late, they gave away our room. They put us up at another hotel of their choice for the first night at their expense, and refunded the first night. Nice, but if we had been offered this option up front, we would have declined - we wanted the room we prepaid for. We spent a good part of the next day dealing with the fall-out, from checking out of the other hotel, walking our baggage ~1/3 mile to the original hotel, leaving bags because it was too early for check-in, then returning later in the day (but not too late) to actually check in. They were aware that their solution to the problem did not make things right for us, but making things right was apparently not important to them. No other options were offered. This apparently happened to another guest (the manager confused me with someone else who was apparently a victim of a similar situation) so it appears that this strategy is not uncommon for them. I suspect that rooms were available, but not 'standard' rooms, and it was cheaper for them to move us to another hotel for the first night than to upgrade us for 4 nights. During the course of the conversation, the manager said that if we had not used a 3rd party, the outcome would have probably been different. The hotel itself was fine - not great - and the customer service aside from resolution of this problem was good. But their attitude in resolving a major problem - no interest in making up for a huge mistake on their part that caused their customer tremendous inconvenience - would keep me from ever staying in this hotel in the future. If we could have easily changed hotels, we would have ... but as this would have required yet more effort and made a bad situation worse, we decided not to leave. Ultimately they hold all the power and can do whatever they want. They certainly exercised this right. All we can do is write this review.

Reviews.Title: “Closer to the Quarter than I thought it would be!”
Reviews.Author: Linda24
Reviews.Content: Having badly broken my foot this winter, I was a bit worried about how close the hotel was to the French Quarter. Thankfully the few short blocks are really and truly very short blocks. Our room was quiet, pretty and clean, the staff were all helpful and friendly, and the courtyard was tranquil. I would absolutely stay here again, and look forward to my next trip without mobility issues!

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: randomMA
Reviews.Content: We have been to New Orleans many times and 2 years ago we dicovered this hotel. We loved it and knew we'd stay nowhere else when visiting the city. So we spent the 1st week of May/2011 there and again it was great. The rooms while not big are very nice. The staff is outstanding and we love the hotel's location...5-10 minute walk to French Quarter, waterfront, etc. It is the only place we will stay in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Great value. Friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: KerryNetherlands
Reviews.Content: Was treated like royalty from moment of arrival. Room was clean and reasonably big. Only minus would be that there isn't a restaurant...but there are plenty of places around the hotel to eat. Fairly close to Bourbon Street, too.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE customer service!”
Reviews.Author: DSeb
Reviews.Content: Visited New Orleans for a night with my family. Had a great time - rooms were nice. However, we encountered 2 issues that will keep us from ever staying here again. 1) the valet stole our iphone charger from the car, and 2) we were double billed for the room - once by expedia and 2nd charge from hotel. I have been calling the manager, Ronelle, for 3 weeks. He said he saw the extra charge, will take care of it and call me right back. Over a week later, I'm still waiting for that call, the charge has not been credited, and Ronelle and his assistant mgr are not available. I've left a number of messages on his voice mail. Do yourself a favor and stay somewhere else - lots of nice places to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay at the Country Inn & Suites”
Reviews.Author: Coznut
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent four nights (4/22 - 4/26) at this hotel for our first visit to New Orleans. I have to start off by saying that the front desk staff were so nice and friendly, they greeted us each time we left or returned to the hotel. My hubby had contacted the hotel to request a room with a view (didn't get one--but didn't need it) and he let them know that we were in NOLA to celebrate our 25th anniversary. We were surprised to find a basket of goodies in our room with a 'happy anniversary' note attached to it.....so sweet! We arrived at the hotel early in the day and they were kind enough to store our luggage for us so that we could get out and enjoy the city. Actually, every employee we met was extremely kind. This hotel is in a excellent location. We opted not to rent a car and we were not sorry. We walked everywhere. We appreciated the free wi-fi, and the free breakfast--there was plenty of foods to choose from. The swimming pool is quite small but it is located in a lovely courtyard, plus we weren't staying there to use the pool. The workout room is small and the equipment is a little worn out. The bar area is small but we received great service and the drinks are reasonably priced. Room: We booked a 1-bedroom suite and we had plenty of space. The room was spotless and the bed was extremely comfortable. We appreciated having a mini-fridge that we could stock with soda, water and beer. Overall we were very satisfied with our stay and we would stay at this hotel again. :o)

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in NO”
Reviews.Author: blakeaa
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed here four nights. Great place. The staff was all excellent and helpful and the valet car service was fast and first rate. The room was large and very nice - no complaints. The free breakfast seemed typical but we were in New Orleans so we used every chance to go out to eat. The location was great - two blocks from the French Quarter, the river and the Canal and St. Charles trolleys. My only complaint would be because of the layout of the lobby and hotel, it was quite a walk to get to our room (with a number of small sets of stairs). Would recommend to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff poor design for NOLA”
Reviews.Author: MDskins
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on TA I decided on staying here on a 4 day vacation with my Mom. The entire staff is great! Didnt meet one rude person, everyone was very helpful all the time. We stayed Wed through Sat so it wasnt a very busy time. I have been to NOLA numerous times but this was my Moms first trip. This is the first time I stayed at Country Inn in NOLA and probably wont again. I think the design of the building is nice to look at inside but its not a good idea in NOLA. I am talking about the open atrium from the lobby/bar area being open all the way up to the 5th floor (where our room was located, the top floor). This city is known as a party city and the bars dont close so people come in at all hours of the night and if someone were to sneeze when they come in the door, you can hear it in your room. You can imagine that most people coming in to the hotel throughout the night have been consuming some beverages and most people are not quiet after drinking. I heard numerouse people complaining about the noise during the breakfast time in the AM. My other con of this property is the elevators, WOW they are slow! The hotel was not busy and did not seem to be full during our stay but the speed of the elevators you would have tought it was. I normally travel to NOLA during festivals and Mardi Gras, so there is no way I would stay here during a busy time as the noise would be much more and more people equal slower elevators. I dont have one complaint about the staff though, they trully were great and they couldnt have done anything to improve my visit. Just a bad design for this city thats all.

Reviews.Title: “This is the place to stay in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Snausage7
Reviews.Content: My friends and I have visited New Orleans for four years straight, and for the last three, we have stayed at County Inn & Suites.
