This is such a great hotel and it is in a perfect location to enjoy the French Quarter at a nice little...distance. Three blocks and you're there! Plus there's the 24 hour "everything" store just two blocks up. Very convenient for when you need to pick up a souvenir or a strawberry flavored cigar to enjoy in the fire-fountain patio at Pat O'Briens. The concierges were so helpful, both Kathy and Frank. Both would great us whenever we entered the hotel. Frank even printed us up a French Quarter Festival schedule from the net after he found out the hotel didn't have brochures for it. Even the desk guy (pardon I didn't get his name) gave us a funny recommendation for a german restaurant that he liked. He thought the schnitzel was fantastic. Who eats schnitzel in New Orleans? Of course, John the Bartender was fantastic. He remembered us from last year! Gave great tips for interesting eating places...Lucy's Retired Surfer restaurant was fun, and jut a few blocks away. Obviously, I highly recommend this hotel. And yes, the little courtyard is a jewel, with the pool and fountains and the blue-lighted glass bricks sprinkled around.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay in the French Quarter area”
Reviews.Author: MXB
Reviews.Content: This was our family's first visit to the Gulf Coast and to New Orleans. The Country Inn & Suites was a nice place for us to stay--the converted warehouse-to-hotel was very unique and the court yard was picturesque and beautiful. The free morning breakfast was decent and the hotel was conveniently located to walk to most attractions nearby. The staff was very helpful and friendly, especially the concierge Kathy. She was extremely helpful with making suggestions for dinner, activities and warning us NOT to take our young teenage kids down Bourbon Street after dark (very good advice :o) ). The only negative part about this hotel was the view from our room. We were on the ground level with ceiling to floor windows that overlooked two trash dumpsters in an alley. To make it even less appealing was that cars were parked in the alley only 5 feet outside our window, so we were unable to keep the curtains open. And both nights in the early morning, loud arguments broke out between couples in the alley which woke me up and continued on for 30 minutes or so. I realize the hotel had no control over some of this, but this negative situation was a result of the hotel's location. One attraction that is walking distance several blocks away is the National World War II Museum. Highly recommend this, especially the 4D movie Beyond All Boundaries. If only kids could learn about history in school watching something like this. . . amazing! Would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the French Quarter area, but be sure to request a room that is NOT on the ground level.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean”
Reviews.Author: AndreaL19
Reviews.Content: Kathy was a great concierge. The room was very clean. A short walk away from the French quarter. The courtyard was beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED this hotel - a great place all around.”
Reviews.Author: travelingkerry
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a quick weekend trip. We LOVED this hotel. Architecturally it's very interesting, as it is a group of old warehouses converted into a hotel. So, that was very cool. Rooms are basic but clean and comfortable. Not much food to offer in the evenings, but there are tons of great places to eat nearby. We LOVED the bartender John and struck up a nice friendship with him over the weekend. Breakfast was free and satisfying. Great location. We will stay here again next time we come to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but forgot to mention a few things!”
Reviews.Author: MichelleK23
Reviews.Content: I came down to New Orleans for a conference that was in Baton Rouge, but decided to stay in New Orleans to check out the Mardi Gras festivities. I stayed March 2-5, so it was slightly before. The hotel is pretty in an old school warehouse. We spent the extra to get a suite so my parents (who decided to join) could have the bedroom and I would sleep on the pull out bed. The first night they placed us in a suite with a couch that did not have a pull out bed. I had to sleep on the most uncomfortable couch and all they did was give us a measley $20 which really wasn't enough for the price we paid for that night and the discomfort. The moved us to another room, but it was quite annoying and a waste of two hours to do the switch. The breakfast is great; the bartender (forgot his name) was also really nice. The worst part is that the hotel FAILED to tell us that if we left the hotel, we would not be able to come back to it until the next day. On March 4th, the day of my conference, we left the hotel at 8am and when we tried to come back around 7pm, we were told to leave the city and come back at 1am. UH WHAT?! The staff alerted us that there would be valet delays and limited access at time, but they really should have said NO ACCESS. When I called, stuck on a street three blocks away, they were no help with directions. Thankfully we found street parking and didn't have to pay to park in a garage. With all this, the staff simply did not care. They ended up not charging us for valet parking for that day, but we have to tell them not to. I wish for all the trouble they put us through, they at least compensated us. The hotel is in a great location, but they need to work out their kinks. Mardi Gras is every year and the parades have the same routes--you think they could have warned us?!

Reviews.Title: “This is a wonderful hotel for the price and location~ a few issues, hope it was an isolated issue”
Reviews.Author: Roswatki
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the country Inn and Suites for 4 nights. Husband had a conference and my son and I tagged along. Great room, great lobby area, great front desk / concierge service, small but cute warm clean pool! A few issues: room cleanliness / lack of toiletries/ supplies. We found a clump of hair (on my husband's foot~ not our hair) when he walked around bare foot in the bedroom. I had to call front desk for toilet paper twice (mostly empty rolls left on holder and no spare left behind). Had to call for shampoo (none left) on one occasion. Bathroom counter was not wiped down even when I moved our stuff to the other side of counter. Soap dish not cleaned daily and small soap pieces were soggy in the dish. I really really like this hotel and a hope this was an unusual event during our stay. I would return and hope for better next time. I have always had great experiences at CI & Suites lodgings!

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hali3
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a week during Mardi Gras 2011. We can not say enough good things about this hotel. Clean rooms, friendly staff, and beautiful lobby. We have stayed in a different hotel every time we have visited New Orleans and this is the first one that we said we will never stay anywhere else. Walking distance to everything including Bourbon Street and the French Quarter. And the warm cookies waiting for you when you come back from a long day sightseeing....WOW!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Inexpensive Stay in the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: V1210
Reviews.Content: I stayed her from December 29, 2010 - January 1, 2011 with a few of my girlfriends. We wanted to ring in the new year in NOLA and were so happy that we found this hotel at such a great rate during the holiday season. As soon as we arrived at the hotel, we were able to check in immeadiately and were given a room way before check in times. We were in our hotel room by 12pm instead of the usual 4pm. The room was clean, conveniently located. It is a short walk to the French Quarter area and close to Harrah's Casino. The next time I visit NOLA, I would definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: vol13w
Reviews.Content: Great location, Great customer service and a great breakfast. Enough said!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Reid72
Reviews.Content: I stayed four nights with my family and we all enjoyed the hotel. I had a room with two queen beds on the first floor. The hotel was quiet and a couple of blocks to the French Quarter. The daily breakfast and cookies were an added bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and value”
Reviews.Author: iceman68
Reviews.Content: The front desk and valet staff were friendly and helpful. The heated pool was small, but was like warm bath. The complimentary breakfast was the same for 98% of the week, but that was alright. Elevators were large, as was our 2 queen bed room. We had a fridge included in our unit, which I was not expecting. Conveniently located near the Aquarium, Insectarium, Riverwalk, French Quarter, and Convention Center. The free WIFI worked well.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with character”
Reviews.Author: BorderRambler
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. Built from a converted warehouse the beams and courtyard gave it a great deal of character. I'd read some people complaining about no outward facing rooms, but ours looked into the courtyard which was fine. Very comfy beds and decent shower pressure. Breakfast was also good with large variety (cereals, bagels, waffle iron, fruits, scrambled eggs...), served a bit early on weekdays though for those enjoying New Orlean's nightlife. Location was superb, a block from Canal St and a stroll into the French Quarter or to the museum sector. Parking was standard for New Orleans at $26, but we were lucky enough to find spaces on nearby streets for free (try Natchez St) the whole time. Would've given full marks but on our first evening there were about 100 teenage school kids on a trip there running wild about the hotel. At 7.30am on a Sunday they descended upon the small pool screeching and causing a riot. Having lost an hour due to summer time change I was in no mood and complained (along with many others) a number of times, yet it took till 9.30 to be dealt with. Thankfully they were leaving that day, but the entire trip could've easily been a nightmare. Perhaps the hotel shouldn't accept such large school parties or if so, perhaps more stringent control of them be ensured out of courtesy to other guests...

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, choice location, right price, and charming site.”
Reviews.Author: LRS3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Country Inn and Suites, Magazine St, right after Mardi Gras this year, and we could not have been happier with our choice. From the very first moment we arrived, we were treated with special care and consideration. The space was spectacular, the price was right, and everyone made us feel like a valued guest. For a chain hotel, the building was really architecturally unique; we actually hung out in the Lobby several times because it was light-filled and comfortable. The pool was small, but that didn't matter at all, because it was really warm! and in a charming courtyard. The staff went above and beyond to help us out, to respond to our questions, and to ease our stay. There's a concierge right in the lobby who can help you make sightseeing plans and help you get transportation, etcetera. Our room was large, clean, and comfortable. We especially appreciated having a small fridge and free WiFi. Also, though there's no business center, printing is free and easy to accomplish. If we return to New Orleans we will definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great value”
Reviews.Author: okcJohn
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights during Mardi Gras 2011. Hotel is in several renovated historic buildings approx 2 blocks from Canal behind the Sheraton. Easy2 block walk to the quarter but approx 6 bloks from Bourbon. Staff was fantastic and there is a small bar in the hotel. Room included mini fridge and microwave as well as coffee pot. Breakfast is included and the one morning we ate at hotel, it consisted of assemble your own breakfast burritos, bagels and other breads, oatmeal, danishes and cereals. Did not use pool but is in a nice little courtyard setting. Room was clean and bed was decent. There was some noise with people coming in drunk but that is to be expected during Mardi Gras. If concerned with noise, do not get a room overlooking the atrium. One important detail, a lot of hotels in New Orleans seem to be relaxed on housekeeping as far as restocking and making room fresh each day. This is even more the case during Mardi Gras where poor service is abundant with the excuse "it's mardi gras". That is not the case at this hotel. The housekeeping, breakfast service, bar service, front desk service was better than what I see at the higher end hotels during non carnival stays. I also noticed a borrow a book shelve by the front desk which looked to be tourist guides and there is also a concierge. the front lobby has a great living room area woth sofas and a fireplace. Rooms are similar to Hampton or Comfort Suites. Could use bigger pillow and nicer tv but the pillows and tv were adequate. Internet was free but seemed slow. (Hotel was sold out so probably alot of users) There were computers and printers for guest use by the front desk. Limited food available through the bar.

Reviews.Title: “Great family hotel”
Reviews.Author: SFmama_11
Reviews.Content: We spent five nights at the Country Inn and Suites in February during the first week in Mardi Gras. It was a great location for us. Close enough to the French Quarter to wander over for beignets at the Cafe du Monde, but far enough away from Bourbon Street to avoid the drunken crowds with our kids. And several of the Mardi Gras parade routes finish up right near the hotel. The hotel is a rennovation of a series of four old, narrow warehouses. The middle of the hotel is very open with a courtyard holding the small pool. The lobby is long and soars four stories up, showing the structural beams of the floors above. The rooms on the long wall don't have windows since they abut the adjacent warehouse, but they open into the lobby atrium. We had two rooms - a suite and a double. The double was on the second floor with a window right onto Magazine Street but we heard no street noise at all. Breakfast was delicious and ample. We always choose hotels with breakfast when traveling with the kids- who needs to spend the time and money on breakfast? The hotel had waffles, sausage, oatmeal, scrambled eggs, pastries, cereal, and fruit. Great value. And unlike many hotels, the breakfast room staff was continually restocking the selection.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: bounder_of_adventure
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the CI&S for three nights in February. I chose it based on reviews from here and the fact that they have free breakfast and internet. The location is excellent. It was a quick walk to the French Quarter where all of the action is. It's tucked away on a relatively quiet street. We were upgraded to a suite when we got there. It had no window (except for the window overlooking the hallway) but really, it just made for a great sleep since it was so dark in the room at night. Staff was excellent. We had an issue with the concierge but apart from that, the front desk, housekeeping and bellman were always friendly and helpful. And you'd always get a hello from staff when they walked by. One thing I didn't love is that there is really no restaurant/room service there. I know people don't go to New Orleans to eat at the hotel restaurant but when our toddler was really sick one day and we couldn't leave the room for dinner, we had to rely on Chinese food delivery. Being that we had a sick toddler and my husband and I had a touch of whatever she had, we couldn't use the pool. That being said, I wish I could have. It looked really cute and it was nice and warm when I put my toe in.

Reviews.Title: “Indiana Girls Gone Wild in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: SEB103054
Reviews.Content: The best value of the City! Great room rates, absolutely perfect loction, clean and those beds! Thank you CI&S for the time of our lives. We loved the city, the experiences and our hotel. The rooms were clean and hotel quaint - not like the typical CI&S, old warehouse in the best part of town. AND great breakfast. Staff was very helpful and so friendly, from the gentlemen who unloaded our luggage, the lady who helped me with the bagel toaster and the bar tender who let my have happy hour 2 minutes past 7 - don't tell.!!! We will tell all our friends and definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “nearly perfect”
Reviews.Author: butch469
Reviews.Content: my husband and I had the peasure of staying in a lovely king suite here in January. The room was exactly what we were expecting, large and spacious with all the pleasures of home, only better, because it wasn't. The staff, with one minor exception went out of their way to make our stay an exceptional one. We had a minor glitch at the beginning of our stay....the room was not ready for us when we arrived. The front desk staff took care of that quickly though, and the rest of our stay was problem-free. My thanks go out to the staff and management for making our 2nd honeymoon one that will last in my memory for years to come.

Reviews.Title: “Superb southern charm and atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: pivko
Reviews.Content: One of the best leisure hotels I have ever stayed in. The hotel has a very pleasant southern charm, it is roomy and well lit. The lobby is nicely built, with an atrium, rooms are comfortable and clean. Location is also superb - only few steps from Canal Street and French Quarter, although the hotel location itself is very quiet. The location of the hotel also appeared very safe. Breakfast adequate by U.S. standards, unlike many U.S. hotels, they brew very good coffee. You can also visit house bar with nice bartender who is keen to give good tips where to go for good food and music apart from the usual tourist places. The hotel really provides unbeatable quality for the price and can always be recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience at a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Dino33327
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 days (Jan 27-30th) and had a great experience. The facilities were clean, the 1-bedroom suite was roomy, the staff was friendly and helpful. The location just 2 blocks north of Harrahs and 2 blocks west of the French Quarter was perfect. Just far enough away from the noise yet close to everthing. For the money...unbeatable. (Note: I have been to NOLA at least 8 times during the past 15 years and I would definitely stay here again.)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hidden gem, super value”
Reviews.Author: Teacherbear
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been contructed out of three old warehouses so has a unique character and feel to it. The location is wonderful as it is only 2 blocks from Canal street and 4 blocks from the French Quarter. The rooms are not large but very well furnished and super clean. The price is wonderful for both location and decor. In addition, it has one of the best breakfasts I have encountered. They call it contiental but it is far from that. They had 3 hot choices and wonderful breads and pasteries. The third asset to this hotel is the staff. Everyone was super friendly and helpful. The front desk staff could not do enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Service Overcame many mistakes”
Reviews.Author: PooleTripper
Reviews.Content: My husband and I planned to stay 3 nights here, celebrating our 25th anniversary. First trip to New Orleans, very excited. Arrived late to find no room available -- hotel overbooked. They walked us to a nearby hotel. Then they checked us out a day early - came back to find room locked, couldn't get in to room. Lots of apologies, small "gift" basket left in room -- only they forgot to tell us and we assumed it was like a courtesy bar and didn't take anything from it. Location is fantastic and the rooms were very clean. We were right over front entrance, but didn't notice any undue noise. Not great for the handicapped. Lots of walking and steps. Otherwise we found this location charming.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, and good service all around”
Reviews.Author: wildindigo
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights. We got a great price on their website which was 20% off of a 2-night stay. Everyone was very friendly from the valet parking staff to the bartender. While this is not a luxury hotel, and there are some beautiful ones in NOLA, it is a great hotel. It is very convienently located - you can catch the street car just a block away, the French Quarter is less than a 5 minute walk, every shop you can imagine within walking distance and restaurants galore. Plus, it is on a fairly quiet street so you don't get a lot of outside noise. The rooms are not huge but the are perfectly adequate - very clean and very quiet. We were on the 4th floor - didn't have a view of the outdoors but who cares - we were outside 90% of the time anyway. I will stay at this hotel the next time I am in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “great location, nice place, but room did not have a window”
Reviews.Author: JKA229
Reviews.Content: I agree with previous reviewers - location was great, breakfast was good, and this was a great choice near the French Quarter. However due to the unusual architecture our room did not have a window. It was somewhat uncomfortable especially during the day. I think some rooms had windows (maybe just the suites) and I would recommend requesting one if possible.

Reviews.Title: “Still a great deal”
Reviews.Author: mortravel
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at the CI&S on a prior trip to NOLA and decided to stay there for our trip to the Sugar Bowl. Although rates were higher due to this being a "special event" it was still a great deal over a lot of nearby hotels. Due to the Bowl game, a lot of people were pre-registering, so our room wasn't available when we arrived early (the last time I arrived at 11:30 am and was placed in a room with no wait). The front desk staff was pleasant and told us they would hold our luggage for us (in a LOCKED room....believe it or not I have actually been in a hotel that kept the luggage unsecurred in the lobby!) and park our car so we could go ahead and get out to team events. No problem with check in when we arrived back at the hotel. Our room was on the 5th floor overlooking the atrium. Although we heard some noise from downstairs earlier on (that's the area where the bar is), by bedtime it was quiet and the hotel posts requests for quiet after hours. Even the night of the game, when everyone was coming back kind of hyped (especially the winners-yay!) it was peaceful. They have coffee in the lobby 24 hours. The only suggestion I would make is that they make hot water available too. We were able to brew tea in the room, as we had a coffee maker and a refrigerator, which came in handy. We had free internet in the room that worked with no problems. We had a suite with 2 queens, a pull out sofa in the living room, TVs in both rooms and a vanity area separate from the bathroom, which was good because there were 3 of us. The window in the bedroom was small but let in ambient light and the window in the living area looked out over the atrium and let in plenty of light from the skylights above. People could see you if they walked by, but there were only a few rooms on that floor and we never found people looking in our window to be a problem. The hotel is about a a block from Canal Street and the French Quarter and the same distance from Poydras Street (where the Super Dome is) so we were able to walk everywhere with no problems. You are close to the Quarter and can enjoy it without the craziness and noise of staying right there. The hotel is also about 2 blocks from Harrah's and about 3 blocks from the Riverwalk, which offers shopping and food and even has a Cafe du Monde (the beignets were great). The bar does offer some limited food in the evenings (we didn't try any) and the breakfast buffet was very good with protein choices and make your own waffles. They also give you adequate time to eat and the breakfast room and open lobby area have plenty of seats. Check out went smoothly and our car was brought up quickly. If you are looking for a nice, quiet hotel that is close to the action but not in the middle of it, this is a great choice. The building is historic (it was made out of warehouses) so it is kind of quirky, but it has some nice charm (like the old fashioned "parlor" off the lobby with the fireplace) and brick walls. I feel that it represents New Orleans well and we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Clean Room”
Reviews.Author: livetotravelToronto
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights when we visited New Orleans recently. We had a one bedroom suite which was quite roomy and clean. The furniture & carpeting is a bit tired but otherwise, comfortable. My son used the pull out sofa in the livingroom and said it was comfy - which is sometimes a challenge with pullouts. My only complaint about the room is that the bedroom did not have a window. There was a window in the livingroom that opened up onto the hallway, and unless you wanted to see guests walking by your room, you had to keep the curtains closed, so very little natural light. The breakfast room was well stocked with the usuals (cereal, waffles, breads, coffee, juices, etc.). No other restaurant on the premise but there was a bar if you wanted a drink or wanted to bring something up to the room. It's located just outside of the French quarter - about a 5 - 10 min walk from all the sights - but this also meant you were away from all the noise and revellrey of Bourbon Street et. al. which for us, was perfect. Overall, we enjoyed our stay and would consider this chain again.

Reviews.Title: “Almost spoiled our trip to New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: JudithBarnett
Reviews.Content: We made reservations for a room with two beds through Priceline. When we arrived after an eight hour drive, the "very snooty" clerk advised me that they had no rooms with two beds and since we had made our reservations through a third party we had to take whatever they wanted to give us. I threatened to leave, and she came up with an "upgrade" to a room with a king bed and sofa bed. Thinking we had no choice except to find another hotel, I took it. When we got to the room, the sofa bed pull out was junk, not close to being something on which I would willingly sleep. I called Priceline, they called the hotel. By this time, a new clerk was working the desk. He offered to move us to a room with two beds, which we gladly accepted. The beds in the new rooms were more comfortable than the soft bed, but the room stank of urine and seemed like it had not been cleaned in weeks. We stayed because we had prepaid and because we were so tired and hungry by then that finding another room was just too much stress. When I told the desk about the smell, they gave me a can of air freshener. We were on a 20 day trip and made many reservations through Priceline. This was the only one that gave us problems. We had also stayed in Country Inn and Suites in other cities with no problems. However, after this experience, we will never stay in one again. To make matter worse, when we got home we discovered they had double charged us for the room. Still trying to resolve that problem. Note: Thanks to Frank, the clerk who tried to solve our problem, and for recommending a really good restaurant for our first meal in New Orleans. I have been looking forward to this trip to New Orleans for years, and only his action saved it from being a total bummer. Too bad all the employees at this hotel don't have his customer service skills.

Reviews.Title: “On the budget, but the best BED of my life”
Reviews.Author: siuska
Reviews.Content: At first, looks like nothing to be in love with: the ceilings are not perfect, far not: very high, and not to be impressed with. Small hall. However, the room was just what we needed. Kids were separated, had TV; bathroom (good size bath tub, all plumbing - perfect, many towels, all neat, fresh) - between us and them. We had no window, but it was kind of unique... and just right. we had no alarm, we slept like KINGS. Huge bed, nice bedding, and something fantastic about the matrass... Air was good, easy to change temperature. Kids went to the hot tub outside, but it was not really hot. A guy at the dest was helpful, sent us to Mother's. It is kind of a restaurant, but more like an eatery. However, tasty! Gumbo - nice, and Jambalaya. We enjoyed. Unexpensive, and still something to remember. CHeck their website for recepies. Mothers in New Orleans. It was not neat at all, not clean (the restaurant), but we wanted something fast and easy, but not McD... and we got the real food. The same guy lied to us once, but for to make business... so I forgive him and make the service rating to be 4 from 5. What the lie was about? About the taxi. They have fixed rates around the city (as airport to hotel and back, and from hotel to cruise). Some idiots think that only rich people can cruise. Wrong. We are on the budget, but we cruise (4 people for $2K, tax included, 7 nights cruise, NCL! check for offers). It is cheaper than to stay in a hotel and buy food. So, about taxi. They charge 11 dollars/ person... for the trip that less than 1 mile. Good that we check maps. We walked there with suitcases just 15 minutes... Saved close to 50 bucks. Keep in mind that hotels make money on taxi (regular price from there to the cruises is $7/person). Hope, it helps. Ah, we also had microwave, ref. It helps. And their breakfast was OUTSTANDING. Sausages, scramble eggs, pancakes (make yourself)! Amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, nice room”
Reviews.Author: 10withamop
Reviews.Content: This is your average corporate hotel. Nothing bad to say. Good, clean room that had a fridge and microwave. Nice place to stay in that it is only 2 blocks from the Quarter. Room was a tad small and the building it is located in is very old. Not much of a view from the window but, really in New Orleans how much time are you spending in your room anyway? It served its purpose and the concierge in front was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Judge A Book By It's Cover. Yuk!”
Reviews.Author: denverroadtrip
Reviews.Content: We were three guys looking for a suite with two beds and a sofabed. I looked everywhere and based on regularly being in the top 15 reviewed hotels in New Orleans on Tripadvisor (and after reading reviews on several other websites), plus it's location, I picked the Country Inn & Suites. The lobby is very pretty. Everyone at the front desk were professional and friendly. The breakfast buffet was slightly above average for a free hotel bkfst, but the staff tried to clear it before the closing time and seemed put off when anyone asked for something already put away. PROBLEMS: 1) This is a historic warehouse building. I was expecting a room with character, but got what looked like a typical budget hotel room. 2) The living room had no exterior window and the bedroom had a tiny window that didn't open so the room was dark. 3) While the beds were great, the sleeper sofa was terrible. 4) OK, how to say this? When any of us pooped, the toilet got stuffed. No matter how little nor if we even gave a courtesy flush. We called the front desk and someone would come up with a plunger or snake. THIS HAPPENED EVERY TIME!!!! THREE PEOPLE HAD TO LIVE IN A DARK ROOM THAT SMELLED LIKE FECES FOR DAYS!!!! They were going to move us after 2 days but maintenance said there was no need because he was going to snake the toilet while we were out. It didn't help and we twice had a stuffed toilet the last 24 hours. THAT'S GROSS!!! Finally, we tried to use the lobby toilet but it was also clogged at the time. We complained repeatedly and there was no offer of compensation and barely an apology. How can a hotel let there guests live this way? It's inexcusable! SHAME ON THE COUNTRY INN & SUITES.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: GrandmaMuffy
Reviews.Content: What a find! Thanks to all the reviewers who helped me select this hotel. Some very talented architects have taken a series of warehouses and created a delightful and charming hotel. As a solo senior citizen traveler on a budget, the price can absolutely not be beat. And, of course, I love old, charming and places with character. This has it all. The service has been excellent.My corner room was clean and well furnished. Though downtown, I was not at all bothered by the traffic noise. The complimentary breakfast included just about anything one might want, even including a big pot of Quaker oats. I have traveled extensively world-wide since retiring. This hotel ranks among my top favorites for all my travels meeting my major criteria: budget, safety, comfort and character. I can recommend without reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Highly recommend this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: WhitefishBay
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Country Inn & Suites New Orleans. We stayed three nights starting 12/11/10. It's a charming, historic New Orleans building - character has been fully maintained, but it's fully updated. Loved the "parlor" area w/ faux fireplace near the entrance. The staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful. Our needs didn't extend beyond the basics of check-in/out and a few questions about directions, but I felt they could have handled anything. Rooms are clean and updated. It's not a five star/luxury hotel, but it had everything we needed - modern bathroom, nice toiletries, comfy bed, tv, desk, reading area w/ chair/ottoman. We were on the first floor straight back from the entrance, so our view was nothing to write home about. I recommend asking for one of the upper floors. On Tuesday morning around 3 a.m. the garbage men were busy/loud clearing dumpsters. Lots of beeping from the trucks and yelling. I confirmed with a friend who's visits frequently that this is a regular occurrence. Two of the best things about this hotel are the free breakfast & free internet. Great spread of some hot items (eggs, sausage, french toast), and the basics like cereal, yogurt, bagels, muffins, etc. It was a great way to start the day. All rooms have free internet. We had free wireless in our room too, but that may have been because we were on the first floor. They advertise that the lobby is a wifi area, and we may have had it too just because of proximity of our first floor room. Location wise, this worked well for us. It's an easy walk to Canal Street and the French Quarter. Had it been warmer (was in the 40s and WINDY), I think we could have walked to most of our planned destinations. We skipped a lot given the bad weather. But it resulted in more time relaxing at the hotel, and that was okay too. Our three night stay totaled about $305. This was the deal of the century! I highly recommend this hotel if you're looking for something a stone's throw from the action.

Reviews.Title: “Far better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Albuquerque_NMGeezer
Reviews.Content: Third trip to NOLA-third hotel. Previously stayed at Bourbon Orleans and Hotel Le Cirque. This was at least 5-times nicer and 1/3 the price. Since we were there for Thanksgiving we had forgotten about the bayou Classic, one of the loudest drunken brawls in all of civilization. A lot of fun if you are involved but the opposite if you are not. That made us appreciate the location which was a convenient walk to the French Quarter, Restaurant August and Emerils but away from the worst of the brawl. Staff was great as was breakfast. Our Suite overlooking Magazine was fairly large. Rooms were pretty new and well maintained. I don't think I will even look anywhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: 1NCgal
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel for a mix of business and pleasure, and really enjoyed it. The hotel is clean, has excellent free wireless access, and great customer service. In addition, it has one of the best free breakfasts that I've experienced; it always included the usual items but also a hot item (sausage, eggs, etc) as well as yogurt and fruit and a Belgium waffle bar. I initially was concerned with this location since it is on a side street, but I felt very safe and convenient to my destinations (Riverwalk, casino, French Quarter). It was quiet, too. The bed was very comfortable, and the bath products were of good quality. The free cookies at the reservation desk in the afternoons were a nice find also. I would definitely stay here again if I am ever in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Suprisingly good hotel - a great value”
Reviews.Author: snirtanion
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Country Inn & Suites a number of times now when visiting New Orleans for work, and have been continually impressed with what you get for the money. Good location, agreeable staff, interesting rooms, with some history to the building. It's not likely to compete with the upscale hotels in terms of service, amenities, or overall quality, but it's far above what I would expect for a Country Inn or other hotel in this class. Since my last stay I've recommended it to a number of colleagues, all of whom have been happy. It's in a great spot,:across from Cuvee Restaurant, within walking distance of Bourbon Street but far enough away to be able to effectively escape the debauchery & noise. Rooms can sometimes be small, but I appreciate the unique character they've been able to bring to each one. Pool is very small; small enough to feel crowded if another family is in with you.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet, good location”
Reviews.Author: sophieboston
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for several days in November while at a conference. The hotel is as everyone says - quite nice, clean, good value, great location. It's not high end, but it's more than acceptable and has everything you need. It's new and the decor is in fine shape. Internet is free - a big plus. The breakfast is just okay, but that's to be expected. There are a few coffee shops in the area I'd recommend instead including Community Coffee House. Overall, it's a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “quick getaway, good location, comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: skreps99
Reviews.Content: We booked airline and hotel package for 3 nights through TripAdvisor and were very happy with the experience. The hotel is a couple blocks off Canal Street and from the edge of the French Quarter. It's convenient for walking to the French Quarter, Harrah's, the Convention Center, RiverWalk, the trolley lines, etc. I had hoped my walking would walk off the food, but NO SUCH LUCK! But, if you don't want to walk or can't I'd say it may not be the best location. Our room was "standard" and on the bottom floor with a non view of the parking lot and cars. It wasn't too big, but it had a really great bed, a desk, chair, suitcase stand and adequate bathroom. We had to keep the drapes closed for privacy, but since we weren't in our room often, it didn't matter. It was quiet. Our TV was not flat screen. They had wireless internet, but slow. The pool at the hotel is very small- heated I think, but more the size of a large soaking spa with no jets. It is in a small, lovely, charming courtyard with little chairs and tables. The free breakfast is good. There is a lounge area with a bar and tables, as well as a sitting room with fireplace. Very pleasant. Criticism: We arrived at 4:30pm- well after check in, and our room was not ready. They were very nice and asked us to wait 15-30 minutes, but not even a free drink at the bar!! I imagine there are better rooms than ours, but we did feel that we had a deal and again, didn't really care it was so small. New Orleans is a great place to visit, even if you don't want to imbibe. Little jazz shows, food, charming neighborhoods and moving stories about Katrina made it a memorable trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MSquared007
Reviews.Content: You really can't beat the location of this hotel. It's close enough to walk to the French Quarter, Harrah's, and the Superdome., yet far enough away from the noise. We were really quite pleased with this place and all of the staff were extremely friendly. We did return to our room one day at 3:30 p.m. to discover it had not been made up yet. I made a call to Robert at the front desk and he immediately alerted housekeeping......the room was ready in less than 30 minutes! Oh...I almost forgot to mention......the beds are incredibly comfortable!

Reviews.Title: “Great location & atmosphere for the price.”
Reviews.Author: Virginia_from_Vegas
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights here and were very satisfied with every aspect of the hotel and it's service, and it's location just two walkable blocks from Canal Street and the start of the French Quarter. The buildng is remodeled with an eye to it's history that makes it quite charming. The open ceiling in the lobby creates a great atrium feeling while maintaining the old beams. Our room was a decent size and kept very clean. The breakfasts were adequate, typical of most 'with breakfast' hotel rooms. Our only issue was one night when the openness of the lobby/atrium floated voices up to our room until late at night......but then this is a party town and it was Saturday night!

Reviews.Title: “Good Price. Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Tuxmiller
Reviews.Content: They've updated this old building for a cool floor to ceiling openness that is accentuated by old wooden beams. Desk personnel were much less friendly than the Hilton 2 blocks away. Ditto with the valet, concierge and others. The valet seemed more interested in the Monday night Saints game than hotel guests. Overall there was a certain laziness and indifference in the staff that I may not have ever noticed except I had just stayed at the Hilton so I was making comparisons. Barmen were sufficiently helpful and friendly. The room had a nice large King bed with just enough room to walk around; so the room was small. The bathrooms here are better than in the Hilton-St. Charles and the water pressure is better. My room here was smaller, though. There is a very small pool in an outdoor private area that is sufficient for a quick dip only. Breakfast is free, wi-fi is free and parking is cheaper than the Hilton. All 3 are the plus side when compared to Hilton St. Charles. Happy hour drinks are cheaper, too and there are free snacks. If you're looking for a clean, decent hotel at a value price, I got this room for $89 and I would recommend it at that rate.

Reviews.Title: “Cute hotel, really nice staff-housekeeping could be better.”
Reviews.Author: circleseeker
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at the Country Inn and Suites NOLA this past week. I would have to say the staff at the hotel are the best. Everyone I encountered from the young valets, front desk, bartenders, breakfast room lady and maintenance people were so friendly and hospitable. The hotel is really cute in the way it was done by combining the warehouses together. The little courtyard with the pool is really sweet, it is small but it is nice to have in NO at all. The water being available was nice as I just refilled my empty bottles and that saved me buying it all the time. The location is excellent. The breakfast is good for it being free. I don't go somewhere just to eat so having breakfast in the am provided is great. It saved me having to spend time and money getting fed in the am. I also took some apples and oranges for later. They always have free, home baked cookies at the front desk as well. I only had one once but they were good and a nice bonus. There are free USA Today everyday in the lounge. The bar is nice with drink specials in the evening. I would say the biggest negatives are the internet service is kind of useless. The connection is really hit or miss. I requested a room high up and away from the elevators which I was given-room 447. Every time I returned to the room tho it had a funny, sort of fume like smell. I don't know if it was the paint they used or a smell coming from the air conditioning but every time I opened the door I was hit with it. Lastly, I left a tip for the maids every day but it seems like they did the bare minimum in cleaning. I noticed the walls had quite a bit of dirt on them and also a kind of black handprint residue on the back of the bathroom door. I called and asked for the walls and door to be cleaned. It never was and I gave up on asking. I don't think they really vacuumed the room once while I was in it. I don't think they wipe down the furniture either as there were handprints on the glass table from previous people who stayed there. It was just overall a bit dusty and could have used a deeper clean. I also don't think any attempt was made to clean the toilet or sink basin once I was in the room. They did the tub, this I know since my dirty footprints were gone! But, the toilet could have used a clean et et. Overall the room was fine, it just would have been nice since I did leave tips for the maids to have put in a bit more effort. The bed is great tho, I slept very well. BTW, the hotel has a little convenience store attached to the front desk that is open 24/7. It was great as the prices were normal and it had some good items. All in all, for the price I think it was a good value for money and I would stay there again. I hope they read this tho and try and get the rooms a little bit more of a deep clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, 2 blocks from Canal Street”
Reviews.Author: fcsklabrie
Reviews.Content: Great quiet location very close to Canal Street and Bourbon (about 6 blocks). Very nice spacious and clean room, friendly and decent service, nice historic building, and great breakfast with lots of good options. In-room safe, free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “A great value”
Reviews.Author: beefnose
Reviews.Content: My kids and I stayed for 5 days prior to a cruise. We loved this hotel. It's very charming, great breakfast, close to everything and it's obscene how little it cost. It was clean, very well maintained and the staff gave us suggestions every night for dinner. The pool is very small and so is the exercise room, but we still used both and it was fine. I would definitely stay here again. There are free cookies at the front desk for the taking!

Reviews.Title: “check other hotels out before staying at c i s n o”
Reviews.Author: frank46550
Reviews.Content: hotel staff was pleasant room was sufficant for three night stay. cancellation policy of two days notice, never heard of before. Really insulting. Brealfast room didnt offer certain items as other C I,s Yourgart bannanas , ran out of milk, but sent someone to buy it. ran out of cold water fromcooler.................................Biggest problem valet parking damage to my car. Claims dept , claims damage was done prior to parking with valet. And too add more insult too injury fruadgently filled out valet ticket indicating damage in three sections. ................. Spoke to my lawer & awaiting valet adjuster too contact me after a week of constantly calling for claims dept to follow up. Very discusted.

Reviews.Title: “Not so good anymore”
Reviews.Author: FXTIP
Reviews.Content: I have stayed At CI & S four times in the past few years. The cleanliness of the hotel has declined. On my last visit I had to change rooms twice. The first room had bugs crawling on the walls. I reported this to front desk, housekeeping came and vacumed. I moved to another room. This room had spent matches and dead bugs behind the night stand. It was pretty gross. I will not be staying here anymore.

Reviews.Title: “Glad we chose to stay here - Exceeded our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: jad648
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on the reviews of fellow travelers and our expectations were exceeded. If you are looking for a clean comfortable room that includes a pretty decent breakfast, a friendly and helpful front desk and a good location very close to, but not in the middle of the French Quarter, this property won't disappoint you. This hotel does not offer luxury, but it's a top quality 3-star property. Although the hotel is fairly new and very well maintained, it is housed in an old warehouse building, so our room did not have a window. That didn't bother us because we spent most of our day out and about and the room lighting was pretty good. A nice breakfast is included in the room rate and can easily save you $8 to $12 per person each day if you were to order a similar breakfast at a nearby restaurant. They have two waffle makers, four juice choices, several cereals, bagels, two or three different types of bread plus eggs, sausage, bacon, etc. I recommend that you use the valet parking at the hotel. We got a special offer that included valet parking, but even at the regular cost of $25 per day, it's worth it because street parking is almost non-existent and parking garages in the area cost as much or more. The valet parking attendants did a good job of getting the cars there within a few minutes. The hotel is conveniently located just off Canal Street (shopping, restaurants, public transportation) and one block away from the west end of the French Quarter. Bourbon St is about four blocks away. The restaurants and attractions in the French Quarter are within walking distance. Pool is very small.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful First Time Stay!”
Reviews.Author: FountainRunner
Reviews.Content: We'd never stayed at this hotel before but we loved everything from the FREE valet parking to the free breakfast. It was just a very convenient hotel to stay at for the $$$. The room was spacious but the way they divided the living room off from the bedroom area made it feel a bit smaller. The bathroom area, mini fridge, sofa, TVs and everything were well kept. Really no complaint, except my family swears they heard a voice from the next room, I didn't hear anything and slept like a baby. If I had to make any suggestions for improvement it would have to do with the arrangement of the breakfast area. The way the kitchen has set up breakfast it's with all their foods along two long tables and what happens is everyone who wants waffles keeps the line at a standstill because the waffles take at least 2 to 3 minutes to cook. Not everyone wants waffles but no one wants to skip in line so they wait and wait for the line to move down to the rest of the food. What the hotel should do is make a separate waffle station off to the side or put the waffles at the very end. This way folks who do not want to wait can eat the other foods. A lot of guests were upset with the wait and just walked out, but we went early and enjoyed our breakfast. This is a great hotel for the money (much cheaper than other hotels in downtown) and we can't wait to go back again next year!

Reviews.Title: “I was not looking forward to staying here...but.....”
Reviews.Author: Moran43
Reviews.Content: I was a little nervous when I saw the price we would pay for our stay(3 nights)....It was a very good bargain. However It was a pleasant stay. This hotel is for someone who is planning to just sleep there since the hotel amenities are not spectacular (ex. pool is tiny). My husband and I enjoyed the fact that we could walk anywhere since everything was very close and the area was very well lit and (magazine st.) which made us feel say at night. The rooms are tiny because they are meant just for sleeping so if you are someone who has never lived in small house or apartment this is not the hotel for you. However if you are looking for a clean, calm, hotel that is within walking distance of everything than you will be pleased. As for the staff I found them accommodating when I requested a room change after the noise from the pool area got unbearable. We were Immediately (less than 5 minutes) given a brand new clean room in a higher floor. I would recommend this hotel to someone who is not looking for luxury just for a nice basic place to stay in without braking the bank. P.S. I WILL NEVER VISIT NEW ORLEANS IN AUGUST....EXTREMELY HOT!!!! EVEN FOR ME AND I AM FROM TEXAS!!!

Reviews.Title: “World Class Stay”
Reviews.Author: Levette
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because I have stayed in Country Inn & Suites in other locations numerous times and I have always had pleasant experiences. I was in New Orleans for the Delta Sigma Theta Sorority National Convention and my stay at the Country Inn was great. Cayada, who is one of the front desk workers was very nice. In addition, Aaron was also helpful. The entire staff was great. The room was also nice. We had the 2 queen bed executive room. The housekeeping staff was great and our room was always clean and quiet. It was overall a great stay and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: NYChrisF
Reviews.Content: You need a good reason to visit New Orleans in July! In our case it was the ACBLSummer Nationals Bridge Tournament, 7/23-7/30. My husband the bridge player wanted to try a hotel other than the one hosting the tournament (the Marriott on Canal St), which was sure to be packed, noisy, and devoid of New Orleans' unique character. The Country Inn hotel is a recently-renovated 5-story warehouse building only a short walk to Canal St. and the French Quarter For the same price as a single room in the Marriott, we got a one-bedroom suite with separate living room, desk area with free internet, refrigerator and microwave (Marriott charged extra for all). Also included is continental breakfast with a different special each morning, along with coffee, juice, fruit, bagels, muffins, waffles and pastries. Other amenities and personal likes: Courtyard with small pool, perfect for a quick dip after sightseeing in 90 degree heat; Beautiful lobby, sitting area and breakfast room; Happy hour offers yummy snacks; Rooms have good insulation from the outside noise and heat, and most importantly, great air-conditioning! Pet peeves (very minor): TVs in living room and bedroom are old-style CRTs, not flat-screen, although they worked well; Bath soaps are a bit lightweight for summer in New Orleans (luckily, the local CVS store on Canal is well-stocked in deodorant soap). Last but not least: We found the staff to be very friendly, helpful and professional. Extra-special thanks go out to Aaron and all the ladies at the front desk, and both concierges (male and female)!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, clean, great location”
Reviews.Author: merreh65
Reviews.Content: Reserved as part of a package, but was very pleased. Stayed on first floor, so don't know how it is on upper floors. Even though there were many teens in hotel as part of a convention it was very quiet and orderly. Location out of the French Quarter, but close, was a plus for us. Easy walk to trolleys and most central attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Housekeeping?”
Reviews.Author: sept2174
Reviews.Content: We really liked the hotel. Our room was small but clean and quiet. We were away from the lobby which has an open ceiling floor plan. Everyone was nice and helpful. Typical hotel breakfast. Clean and well supplied, lots of tables. Close to the FQ, the french market was 10 - 15 min away. We parked our car at a self-park for $15 a day and didn't touch it again until we left. My only problem was with housekeeping. The second day, we came back to our room around 3 and it wasn't done. No problem. We left again around 4 and housekeeping was outside in the hall. She asked us if we need anything, thinking she meant extra towels or whatever, we said no and she asked my husband to sign her worksheet. I told my husband he shouldn't have signed bcs she wasn't going to clean the room. Sure enough, room wasn't cleaned. Okay, we had enough towels and I didn't care about the unmade bed. The next morning, hubby decides to surprise me and brings me a cup of coffee in bed. I spilled some on the sheets. Not all of it but enough that if I were home I would have changed the sheets. I put the card that says "if you want your sheets changed, place on pillow" on my pillow. That night - no sheet change. I called front desk and the man said that some of their people don't read or write. They don't have to read the card, they should be taught that a card on the pillow means "change the sheets". I also complained about the housekeeper tricking us. He said that was a "misunderstanding" Otherwise, nice hotel - needs housekeeping/customer service training.

Reviews.Title: “hotel with character, pleasant staff, good location and not too expensive”
Reviews.Author: Nigelace
Reviews.Content: The hotel was as described on the packet; old converted buildings, comfortable rooms, good location close to the French Quarter and breakfast included. We didn't intend to spend too much time in our room so that was more than adequate. The price was good and the hotel location was good for exploring the city. The breakfast was basic but a good start to the day, the only problem was that it was very busy and made worse by people who seemed incapable of using a toaster or waffle maker so lines built up very quickly. Having said that I would definitely try this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE ANY INFO GIVEN BY FRONT DESK; FREE WIRELESS WORTHLESS; BREAKFAST YUCK!”
Reviews.Author: tschachler
Reviews.Content: The two experiences which angered me most at this hotel were the two pieces of errneous information I received from a woman working the front desk. The first time I was told that Rouse's Market was about five blocks from the hotel, when it was really six blocks past where the woman had marked it on the map. I had to walk back almost a mile with four bags of groceries. But the really eggregious event happened later that evening when I needed to have a prescription filled for my daughter. The same woman (I do not know her name) told me that the closest 24-hour pharmacy was a Walgreens in Metairie. When I got into the cab that night at 11 p.m. the cabdriver asked me why I was going all the way to Metairie since there was a 24-hour Walgreens seven blocks away on St. Charles Street. Needless to say, I was furious and frustrated. I spent $40 round trip cab fare getting this much-needed prescription for my daughter. When I told a manager about both these incidents on Thursday afternoon (again, I do not know his name), he took notes, told me how sorry he was, gave me a hug (which I thought was weird) and asked if there was anything I needed, like towels. He also said that "They would be talking about this." What I'd really like is my $40 back for a cab ride that I didn't need to take and an assurance that this staff member was spoken to. I thought there might be some mention of my terrible experience at checkout, but there was none. I did, however, have to point out to the front desk that the room charges for each night of my stay were $5/night more than what had been quoted to me. They did make the change, but this mistake, after my other experiences with the front desk, did not leave me with a overall good impression of that property. The free breakfast is pretty standard fare--nothing special or particularly nutritious. My daughter and I bought some high-fiver cereal, milk and fresh fruit after going to breakfast the first morning. One example of poor quality: The assorted fruit (grapes, melon, peaches) they put out was mushy and tasteless, as if it had come in a frozen package which had been left to defrost too long so that the fruit absorbed much of the water as it defrosted). Room location is key in this hotel. Our room was great--#501. But I had asked for a room on a high floor, away from the elevator, as I always do. We had no view, but I didn't care about that. Our one-bedroom suite was so, so quiet (at least the bedroom part). Part of the problem at this hotel is that the open lobby extends up all five floors, so if your room is off the long hallway over the open lobby, you're going to hear everything going on in the lobby. Ask for a room away from the open lobby. 501, for example, was at the very end of this long hallway, the bedroom was in the back of the room, off the living area. I would only recommend this hotel to others with grave cautions about the quality of information you may received from the front desk and disclaimer regarding room location, quality of breakfast and the stupid free wireless that didn't work for us!

Reviews.Title: “Never Let Them Give You Room #425”
Reviews.Author: chilliop
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was clean and quiet. Some of the front desk folks were rude. The toilet was very loud when it flushed. It was a NO FRILL hotel. I didn't see a pool or fitness center, no restaurant, or any information in the room letting you know about anything about the surrounding area or the hotel. The biggest issue was the size of the room. OMG it was so small. It was hard for 2 people to be in that room trying to get dressed. It is not a room to relax in. WHATEVER YOU DO DON'T LET THEM GIVE YOU ROOM #425

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with kids (most of the time)”
Reviews.Author: Lee4
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights with our 4 year old. We stayed here last year and liked it enough to return. Having the suite set up, with the bedroom separated from the living area and bathroom, is very handy with a child. The refrigerator is nice as well (there's also a microwave). The location is just 2 blocks or so off of Canal, and it's a quick, easy walk to the FQ. It's only a 10 minute walk to Cafe Du Monde! There's also a free breakfast each morning. The fare is typical hotel--muffins, bagels, cereals, eggs, sausage, oatmeal, juice, milk, coffee, tea, make your own waffles. The food was okay. We found the staff to be friendly and helpful. Housekeeping was nice as well, but they did not tend to our room until after 4:00 p.m. each day. The first day, the left us more towels and washcloths but didn't leave other things like tissue, toilet paper, clean glasses. The 2nd day, our child became very sick, so we could not leave when they came to clean. Instead, we just swapped out towels with them. They were very nice about this. The rooms are spacious by NO standards, but they are noisy. You can hear through the walls and ceilings, and sometimes, it sounded like a herd of elephants was about to fall through our ceiling. Luckily, we travel with a sound-machine, which provides white noise. This did help in the bedroom, but it was still loud above and around us. There is a small swimming pool that our son enjoyed quite a bit. It really is small--more than one family at a time would fill it up. Still, it's in a nice courtyard setting and is a nice treat on a hot day. We did use the valet parking and had no problems at all with this. They recommend calling 15 or 20 minutes before you'll be down to get the car, and our car was always waiting on us. This was easier (to us) than trying to self-park somewhere else in the area. Overall, we like staying here for the size of the rooms, type of rooms, and the location. It is noisy, so it helps to be prepared for that.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel near the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Vdoman
Reviews.Content: This place has some character. It was originally five old buildings that they retrofitted into one hotel. The rooms seemed clean and somewhat new. The place was very quiet. I would guess because it was actually five buildings and you can easily be up against a thick brick wall where you don't hear the occupants of the room next door. I wish they had made the elevators bigger or had some for the service people. In the morning, they are using them for their work, but this was a minor inconvenience. The "splash pool" is about 10' X 15'... we knew that going in. The breakfast is very good, but be there before 9:30am or they shut the door. Only one thing made me a little upset. We tried to book our two rooms for another day or two longer. I'm hearing this a lot lately... "Since you booked the rooms using a Third Party (Expedia) we cannot offer you the same price." We got the rooms for $77 with taxes on-line... and they said it would be $99 PLUS taxes if we wanted to extend our stay. This wasn't even over the weekend. So we left when scheduled. I'm glad business is good for them... I guess they didn't need our money.

Reviews.Title: “This place is so good I couldn't believe the price I paid for it”
Reviews.Author: johndsmiley
Reviews.Content: Stopped at this hotel on our cross country road trip. It's a right in the middle of the French Quarter in New Orleans---built into 5 historic old building. The place is beautiful. It was so nice that we had to check our Credit Card to be sure the price we were paying was correct---it was that much of a value. The room was huge (a suite). Quiet. Clean. Free Wifi. Bar in the hotel. Front desk attendants helpful and friendly. In fact, I accidentally left my personal pillow here by mistake, drove back an hour later to get it and it was waiting for me in the lost and found. Parking can be tough. I recommend the valet parking which is roughly $24 per day. Overall it was a great experience. Room: 501. A suite. Big. 2 TV's. Cool. Clean. Quiet. 2 beds and 1 sofa bed. Bathroom: Big. Room Locks: Has deadbolt. Airconditioning: Great. Refrigerator: Yes. Vending and Ice machines: Yes Laundry: I think so. WIFI: Yes. No password. Worked and connected fast. Fitness Center: Saw it. Looked fine. Pool: Small outdoor pool in the courtyard. Pretty--but small. Jogging possibilities: Yes, if you like running in the city. The riverfront is a few blocks away. Dogs/Pets: I doubt it. Staff: Very friendly and attentive. Parking valets and outside attendants are very nice. Breakfast: OK. The space for breakfast is a bit jammed for the number of guests in the hotel. There are outside seats near the bar and in the lobby, but getting to the coffee can be touch as the waffle line backs up into it. Complimentary Papers: I don't think so. Parking: Valet is easy. Not sure about anything else. Safety: Great. Looks like a safe place. The neighborhood looks fine. Brochures: Not sure.

Reviews.Title: “This place has everything”
Reviews.Author: kellyconn7997
Reviews.Content: We went to New Orleans for our anniversary. I did some research and finally choose the Country Inn and very happy I did. This place was perfect. It had so much charm - I just feel in love. This first reason I choose this hotel is because breakfast was included and not many hotels in the French Quarter have breakfast included. And the breakfast was different everyday and so good especially the fruit and make your own waffles!! Second there is also cookies included. So if you stumbling back from Bourbon Street nice to pick up a cookie before going to bed. Third - PERFECT LOCATION. Looking at the map it looks far but Bourbon Street was not a far walk at all. I brought sneakers because I thought I would be doing a lot of walking but I didnt even need to use them because everything was so close. And then you have the Riverwalk right across the street along with the streetcar -- it was perfect! The price was right too plus we got upgraded with a suite with even asking! Only bad thing is the pool was small bad it was open all night!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: BillyBobAce
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on location and price (low rate through Resorts Plus International). When we arrived, it was worth it! Nice clean hotel. Close to everything! Staff were nice and accomodating. We really enjoyed our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: SloveniaTravler
Reviews.Content: This was the best hotel I have stayed in for a long time. There was not a single thing missing: free internet, nice breakfast (included in the price), clean and spacious room and bathroom with all amnities, staff was incedibly helpful (they let me know that expedia mistakenly made two reservations:-), location is great, a few blocks from Bourbon Street, and it was all for $80... Didn't try the pool but who cares... Be back definitely. I rate them five stars in all categories ... and no - this is not one of those fake reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Great bargain-got more than I expected”
Reviews.Author: yasante
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I just went for a little 3-day getaway and I was more than pleased with the majority of our stay. The hotel really is in an excellent location as we were able to walk just a couple blocks to the Quarter and a few blocks to Bourbon St. We even hopped on the Canal St. Streetcar a couple blocks away! The hotel is centrally located and very convenient. I wasn't too impressed with the rooms, but there was nothing wrong with them. The TV signal wasn't all that great, but we didn't spend alot of time in the room! Breakfast was great as there were hot options and we had some different choices each day. I found the staff to be hospitable and I enjoyed the fact that they had some toiletries at no cost, such as mouthwash and other personal items at the front desk. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with a great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Deana79
Reviews.Content: Our hotel room was very clean but a bit small if you are staying with more than one person. The staff was friendly! Great Bartender!! Hotel is in walking distance of everything fun!! You do have to pay to park!

Reviews.Title: “Another nice stay”
Reviews.Author: RHF67
Reviews.Content: 4th time @ CIS, French Quarter and as always a pleasure. Check in wasn't great, but it went quickly. We got upgraded to a Queen suite so that was nice and the room, as always was clean and well prepared. Even the sleeper sofa, where my 11 year old daughter stayed during our 3 day stay got no complaints. Breakfast has been upgraded a bit. We had fresh French Toast the first day with bacon and the second eggs with sausage. The French toast was a welcome addition. I just wish they would add more options for those with gluten allergies. Fruit and meat were my son's only options, but it was free and fresh so we didn't complain (note the fruit salad was canned fruit cocktail, but my son liked it). Didn't use the pool this time. Did use the "concierge" service and we ended up on a nice swamp tour. First time we took a scheduled tour on one of our visits. She was very honest and nice, but obviously commissioned. Will stay again. Thus far our favorite hotel in NOLA.

Reviews.Title: “NOT THE GREATEST EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: Rina4720
Reviews.Content: We and I booked this hotel for 4 nights in NOLA. This was our second trip to the Crescent City, and we looked forward to this hotel based on the reviews. I have to say we were disappointed. There are elements of the building that are lovely - the architectural detail is just beautiful in the lobby area. But, we were not impressed with the front desk staff at all - my husband said that he thought the best word to use was "surly" and I would agree. They didn't even bother to make eye contact when we checked in, and were downright rude when we checked out. There was a charming bartender at the small lobby bar, and he was a breath of fresh air. The rooms are very very small - without the tall ceilings you would feel like you were in a closet - and we had a two room king suite! I can't imagine how small the hotel rooms felt. The valet parking staff has their work cut out for them, as there is construction going on at the front of the building (beware the noise on weekdays) but they also were indifferent to anything but what hand their tip was in. On the day of checkout we called down and asked if we could get a luggage rack and my husband was told "we don't have any right now" and the valet hung up. So my husband spent 20 minutes scouring the hallways for a rack. The televisions dated from the 1980's and the signal was dreadful. Come on people, this is 2010, get a decent TV hookup please. Finally, there was the noise issue. For three straight days we were awakened at 6:30 a.m. by a clock radio turned up full volume coming through either a wall or a hole in the ceilings where the historic beams created kind of a space into the floor above. We called down to the front desk for help all three mornings, but they claimed they could not find the source. Did they continue to look throughout the day? No. Did they offer to move us? No. Did they seem even the slightest bit interested? No. The radio managed to turn itself off via a timer each morning after about an hour of blaring music and advertisements, and of course not until it had ruined any chance we might have of sleeping in. Not the way to spend a romantic trip to NOLA....so I wish I could say we enjoyed our stay, but frankly we were happy to leave. We won't use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location to enjoy the city”
Reviews.Author: Soccermum21
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during the Rock & Roll 1/2 Marathon. We travelled to New Orleans for the race. The location was perfect...close enough to Bourbon St etc. But far enough to avoid the noise after hours. The room was clean and comfortable. Breakfast was included, but one had to get there early as some things were not replenished when finished. All staff that we encountered were courteous and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Second Stay - Top Notch Bargain in NoLa”
Reviews.Author: brngckn
Reviews.Content: I'm just back from my 2nd stay at this property. It is well-located and within walking distance of all the French Quarter attractions. Easy connections to streetcar lines, too. My AAA rate was a little under $100 with taxes. Parking is $25. Rate includes breakfast, free wifi, and is below the cost of similar level properties in the area. There is a small hotel bar and pool. The staff is friendly. The property and rooms are spotless. Rooms are a little small, but this is NoLa; you aren't going to be in the room much.

Reviews.Title: “very good experience - we recommend it”
Reviews.Author: fremell
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at the Country Inn French Quarter in NOLA during JAZZFEST. We had read mixed reviews and we were not too sure of how they would handle the high volume of customers during this special event week. First, we loved the loft-style decoration of the huge lobby and the charming patio (it's very small, but very cute and has a small pool). Also, the staff was very efficient. We arrived very early and had to leave our luggage in the morning before our day out. The storage room was huge and safe (locked at all times -and they put a tag on your luggage). We had requested a quiet room when we had booked on the internet two months before: and indeed, we were very happy with the room we had: far from the elevators/lobby/Magazine street, at the end of a corridor. The hotel AND the bedroom/bathroom were extremely clean. The maid service was excellent. Last but not least, the location was perfect: just a few blocks from Bourbon Street and the French quarter, still in a nice and charming area (BUT a quieter area)! What you should know though: we don't know if all the rooms are all the same but ours was pretty small (a bit too small when you have two huge suitcases) and the walls are thin. We were lucky enough to have quiet neighbors. The wireless internet was a bit slow (maybe because we were at the of a corridor) The breakfast was average, and their fruit/fruit salad were really not good (in short, only the rich food was good!) Overall, we were very happy with our stay. We couldn't have done better with the rates we got on the net.

Reviews.Title: “Best Deal In New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: rmsnickers
Reviews.Content: I won't waste much time since everyone has already said it in previous write ups...great hotel with a great location. I paid $375 per person for air and hotel for 5 nights from Seattle and couldn't have been happier. I chose this hotel over several 4 star hotels based on the reviews and I wasn't disappointed. Just outside the french quarter so it wasn't loud at night but easily accessible to everything. I spent 5 days and didn't need to use a car or a taxi. The only thing I would suggest for the hotel is to buy some umbrellas for guests. My girlfriend and I got caught in an afternoon downpour and I asked for an umbrella to run over to get food at Mother's (must go). The response was they didn't have any b/c guests never return them. It can't be that hard to get a name or room number when loaning out an umbrella and then charging for it if it isn't returned..... ****If you are older or have trouble walking several blocks then I would suggest another hotel if you want to spend time in the french quarter. It is 3-4 blocks across Canal and that may be difficult for some. Overall, I was very pleased with Country Inn and the staff were very nice. The two guys that worked the bar downstairs were exceptional. Oh yeah, free wireless that actually works is very much appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: billb55
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 3 nights. The staff was extremely helpful and the room was clean and comfortable. The hotel is one block off of the french Quarter. One tip. Dont park at the hotel. Its $ 28.00 a night and the car parkers are pushy. Park one block south on Magazine Street.in the public lot. Its $15.00 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the money, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: LoriPete
Reviews.Content: My 17-year-old daughter and I traveled to New Orleans for a family event at Loyola University. For $955, we had a Hotwire.com package for RT airfare from Dulles Intl. Airport and five nights at the hotel. Country Inn & Suites New Orleans is at the intersection of Canal and Magazine (where it turns into Decatur), so it is a very short walk to everything the French Quarter and Riverwalk areas have to offer. Plus, it is just one block to the St. Charles and Canal streetcars, and you can catch the Magazine St. bus to and from Audubon Zoo. The hotel is homey and clean; staff are very hospitable. There's a small bar and lounge in the lobby, free cookies, a concierge, a small pool, and a courtyard garden with a smoking area. There's complimentary hot coffee and breakfast every morning. Valet at the front door, luggage storage upon arrival or departure. Airport Shuttle offers exceptional, prompt door-to-door service for $40/person RT so you don't need a car. This is a great hotel for families and people who want convenience but don't want to spend hundreds a night. Be sure to visit the Aquarium, IMAX, and Insectarium, and Preservation Hall. The Creole Queen jazz dinner cruise was just so-so; fun to be on the boat, but the food and music were just average, plus the seating isn't intimate (you'll share a table with other parties) and the whole thing is on the expensive side ($60 per person). I'd recommend spending the money at a good restaurant and taking a cheaper river cruise earlier in the day. Mother's restaurant is just around the corner! Great po-boys and fun atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “For the price, very nice”
Reviews.Author: cyberwulf
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while attending a convention at the Hilton a few blocks away. Not much to say that hasn't already been lauded: hotel is situated in a set of restored buildings, so the lobby and room had a unique feel (high ceilings, exposed rafters, brick walls). The small bar in the back of the lobby has very reasonably priced food and drinks. Breakfast was of much higher quality than I've experienced at similar hotels -- in addition to the usual cereal, fruit salad, and pastries, there was a waffle station and a rotating selection of hot breakfast items.
