Staff seemed to do a good job of keeping the food stations well stocked. One complaint: My room was street-facing, on the third floor, and I could hear quite a bit of street noise. The street's not particularly busy, so it wasn't a major nuisance, but if such things bother you, you might consider a room away from the front of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: sglau828
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend is a native of New Orleans (I'm also a graduate of Loyola New Orleans); however, since I was traveling to New Orleans with a friend in December 2009, we decided to get a hotel instead of staying with said boyfriend's family since we were going to do "touristy" things and the family lives on the other side of the river. I found a fantastic deal on hotels.com for 50% off what its normal prices are for the weekend before Christmas. The thing I liked the most about the hotel was its location...it's two blocks away from Canal Street, so a walk into the French Quarter takes less than ten minutes. It's very accessible for anyone on foot. We thought the service at the hotel was good; the people at the reception desk were friendly with me and answered all questions. In the evenings on the weekend, there is someone at a small desk on hand to assist with questions on sights/restaurants. We did not have a car with us so I cannot comment on the parking, but what is nice is that there is an area to pick up a taxi right in front, which is what we did a few times. Continental breakfast is available as part of the price, but with New Orleans being a great food city, it's almost a shame to waste a meal on the hotel food! There is also a bar in the hotel, but again, with New Orleans being a great drinking city, we did not use the bar. The room itself was comfortable, clean, and spacious, including the bathroom. We had an issue with the door lock one day, but a repairman was sent to fix it immediately. We were on the fifth floor overlooking Magazine Street, and we did not hear any street noise on the weekend. Overall, it was a nice stay at the hotel, and if I were to go back to New Orleans again needing a hotel, I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Price”
Reviews.Author: tlmrg
Reviews.Content: Got internet special so place was great for the price, dont know if I would be as happy if I paid $150 a night. Right in between Bourbon St and Harrahs, 5 minute walk either way. Review about noise are correct, try and get off street and away from elevators. Rooms small but nice, hotel charming, pleasant experience. I wouldnt say it is 5 star service but who goes to NOLA and stays in their room anyways. You can valet for 30, or park yourself for 15 a day a block towards Poydras. John the bartender has good suggestions, try the cookies. Try Deanies for dinner, good price, great food, more casual atmosphere

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: weezee42
Reviews.Content: Great location, parked in a nearby lot for $15.00, no in and out privileges. Charming hotel, had reserved two queen beds, checked in, went up to my room, and I had a king. Front desk could not resolve it, and it put a damper on my short vacation. Breakast was good.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and central”
Reviews.Author: jezebel9bce
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. We did a lot of research as we wanted to stay in an affordable hotel near the French Quarter. This hotel turned out to be perfect! Round the corner was all the action, plus stores in case you needed anything late at night (which we did). The lobby is charming, breakfast is included and plentiful. The room was a good size and the bed was HUGE! The front desk helped me locate some really good eating joints (Deanies - LOVED IT, Messinas). There's no self-parking (although you can valet for about $26 per 24 hours with in and out privileges) or there is self-parking down the street (no in and out privileges).

Reviews.Title: “Non Existant SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: bubbles2660
Reviews.Content: $233 a night RIP-OFF My husband and I went to Mardi Gras for my 50th B'day. When we arrived at the hotel, no bellhop to help with the bags. It took about 20 minutes to check in. Then we had to carry our own bags up to our room. One of Our bags had to be delivered from the airport because the airline lost it. When it finally arrived about 5:00 pm, the desk clerk called our room and told my husband to come down & get it! The next morning we left the hotel at 10am for breakffast and to walk around the French Quarter. When we arrived back about 3:10 pm our room had not yet been cleaned. I called the front desk, The clerk told me that they were too busy with check-ins to do our room. She then said she would send someone up at about 3:30. I told her not until 630pm because I was going to take a nap & then get ready to go out. The cleaning girl showed up at 3:40. My husband told her not until 6:30; 20 minuts later she was back knocking on the door. She was sent away again. Finally we left the room at 6:10 to go for dinner, we told her that she could go and clean the toom. Her idea of cleaning our room was to pull the covers up on the bed and throw some clean towels on the chair in our sitting room and STEAL the silk red rose I had gotten for Valentine's Day that morning. A 4-year old could have done a better job! Service didn't get any better during the remaining time we were there, and OH, BY THE WAY NO BELL-HOP TO HELP TAKE THE LUUGAGE DOWN EITHER! The manager did give us 1 night refund, but, for all the aggravation, I don"t feel like it was nearly enough! For $233 a night it was the biggest rip off! It wasn't worth more $65.00 a night!

Reviews.Title: “It was a disappointment.”
Reviews.Author: LakeTahoe2000
Reviews.Content: Changed reservations to this hotel because of recommendations on the Trip Advisor website. Big mistake! Except for the hotel employee who registered us the desk staff were not particularly interested in helping people. Just for the fun of it I stood at the registration desk and decided to wait for the two women behind the desk to acknowledge me. Unfortunately I didn't have that much time and I had to interrupt their gossip session to get my question answered. Our actual hotel room was very small with just enough room to walk on either side of the bed. This was not the boutique hotel I was hoping for. The lobby and breakfast areas were freezing cold because of the automatic front doors that opened constantly and managed to stay open for way too long. That may not seem like much but it was very cold in February. I'm afraid this hotel was a big disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “unimpressed, better choices are available”
Reviews.Author: ibeeneverywhereman
Reviews.Content: Stayed in January 2010 and was not impressed for the price. Cons - front desk staff on the surly side, slow valet parking, dingy and dark room. Pros - location, good breakfast, fitness room was ok.

Reviews.Title: “A Fabulous Find!”
Reviews.Author: BlondieBMaryland
Reviews.Content: Lovely and unique place with great amenities. Each room is a little different due to the buildings they purchased and refurbished to create the hotel. The location is central to everything - trolley to the Garden District, RiverWalk, 2 blocks from Bourbon Street, just off Canal Street. The breakfast is substantial and changed every day. Not a muffins & juice continental. Always a couple hot items to choose, plus make your own waffles every day. The front desk and concierge were extremely helpful. All the staff were very friendly. They even have a washer & dryer, which came in handy since we were stranded due to snowstorms in Maryland. The complimentary computer & internet were very helpful. Be sure to visit Commerce Restaurant (just around the corner) for their gumbo. Tell Cassandra the snowed in girls from Maryland sent you!

Reviews.Title: “Best combination of price, quality, location, and history”
Reviews.Author: Keystone_Traveler
Reviews.Content: I believe this property offers travelers extremely high value compared to the prices of other hotels in the area. One block south from the corner of Decatur and Canal, the location is close to many restaurants and destinations frequented by travelers. Depending on day of the week and hotel demand, you can get a great price for a room. The hotel has kept the historical character alive by keeping brick walls and wooden beams exposed in both the rooms and common areas. The walk from the front door straight back to the rear of the building feels very historical and authentic to the city. There is a beautifully decorated sitting area/lounge directly to the right as one walks into the building. Room windows are floor to ceiling; old style. I had a first floor room so there is no view as I needed to have the curtains drawn at all times since the windows looked out on an alley. But if you're out all day, a room with a view is not critical. Future guests, be warned. Those staying in lower level rooms facing the rear of the hotel will probably be awakened every morning by either a garbage truck or delivery truck at approx. 5:00 am. I luckily am able to fall back asleep easily. For those who cannot, get a room that faces another direction or higher up. I thoroughly enjoyed staying here. All the room amenities were above average; no complaints at all. Hotel personnel were friendly and attentive. I didn't care much for the free breakfast; mediocre (but expected) at best.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: dragonboatSF_Ca
Reviews.Content: Arrived during Mardi Gras. So pleased with its location. Just a few blocks from the Quarters. Everyone of the staff was friendly and helpful. Room was very clean. Only thing is the sleeper sofa. Cushion & mattress is very thin. Should be replaced, however we didn't need to use it. The continental breakfast was ok. I didn not expect a lot of food there, besides, you can go to Mothers around the corner if you want a large breakfast. The buffet room was great for a small snack before heading out. Of course if you arrive during peak time, it will be busy. The concierge (Frank) was very helpful and always friendly. The price was reasonable for a suite. I have stayed at Country Inns before and am very pleased with their rooms and service. Now I'm going to nit pik. Wish they would deliver the newspaper to my door.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, staff & breakfast - great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: trevtnyc
Reviews.Content: I stayed here the weekend of 1/15-1/19 for a birthday weekend getaway. Upon arrival we were greeted by the Manager (Sherina) who was very nice and welcoming. She saw I had noted we were in New Orleans for my birthday and she upgraded me to a suite which was more than wonderful. The suite we had had a nice street view but we heard little street noise for a lower floor (301). The suite itself had 15 to 20 foot high ceilings in the living room and bedroom (window was that high in the bedroom - very impressive) and had a small but very nicely appointed bathroom, also a nice wetbar with microwave and fridge and a nice big closet with safe. The room itself was a little dated, TV and furniture was older but in good shape, sofa sleeper in the living room. The bed was extremely comfortable and they have very nice bath products. The housekeeper kept our suite clean the entire stay. Free Wifi or wired internet which worked well and the free breakfast was more than what people were talking about in earlier posts (eggs, sausage, waffles, etc) but that might have been because there was a convention and a Saints game that weekend. They also have a really nice outdoor patio space with a small pool and fitness center which is clean and very well kept. I don't understand how people would complain about the distance to French Quarter, Burbon Street or businesses, everything is within a 5 minute walk or less from the hotel, restaurants and shops as well. I agree Harrah's lunch buffet at $9.95 all you can eat is the best value and it's great, if you want a special occassion dinner my all time favorite will always be NOLA (Emeril Lagasse's first restaurant). They also serve a great lunch and brunch as well. I do agree that we could hear our neighbors once in awhile but not to the point where it was warrenting a noise complaint. It was a Saints game weekend and New Orleans is a party town, you do have to take that into some consideration when you stay there, especially anywhere near the Casino or Quarter. This hotel will be added to my list of favorites and will be considered next time I come to New Orleans. There aren't any cons worth writing about, it's a gem!

Reviews.Title: “Historic, clean; rate trumped drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: papertravel
Reviews.Content: 1800s buildings beautifully redesigned into one stylish hotel; our squeaky clean, super comfy room had great window and original brick. Would stay there again but only for same great online rate of $67 weeknights, $115 Fri. Cons: (1) Drinks not discounted 5-7 p.m. like fliers say (bartender a peach though). (2) Free breakfast lags behind 6 a.m. â€œstartâ€� time, everything not out till 7 or 8, carb-heavy food, super awkward and crammed food layout, traffic-flow nightmare. (3) Dumpsters emptied beneath our window 3:30 a.m. sounded like long series of explosions. (4) Pricey valet service once took 45 minutes to get vehicle, made husband late to class. Wasnâ€™t because we didnâ€™t tip (and well) but donâ€™t think the valets are used to tips, some of them acted shocked or even refused tips. (5) Cranky wireless Internet. (6) Staffers not friendly (but not openly unfriendly). Also note, like at many hotels, people will steer you to tourist-trap restaurants so do your Internet homework (our fave was West African place Bennachin's, well worth short cab ride or finding parking.) Visited Audubon Zoo but being winter, many exhibits closed. Ogden Museum of Southern Art has free admission on Thursdays (next to WWII museum), great exhibits but paranoid staffers.

Reviews.Title: “Cute little gem”
Reviews.Author: RainToronto
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for Thanksgiving weekend and had a wonderful time, Hotel was very clean with spacious rooms, I liked the open lofty feel of the hotel. From the outside it does not look as nice, but upon entering a nice surprise. Excellent location , so close to everything. Try the buffet at Harrahs casino for lunch. Very good food and very inexpensive

Reviews.Title: “Great to use as base camp, but paper thin walls don't help sleeping”
Reviews.Author: Vagrunt
Reviews.Content: They need to adjust their room diagrams or add more Sheetrock between rooms. I'm a sound sleeper, but heard neighboring conversations day and night. Definitely a no-go for biz travelers and consideration even for those looking to walk to nearby Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “I thought this was a hidden gem, but....”
Reviews.Author: WorldtravelingDoc
Reviews.Content: In September, we stayed in this hotel after a 2-week long international trip when we decided not to drive another 3-hour home after we arrived at the New Orleans airport. We booked it on the same day: we were basically just looking for a clean hotel room to rest for the night. We only paid $50 and we were pleasantly surprised by the cleanliness and comfort of the room along with the complimentary internet access. It is three blocks west of Canal St, so it is still within walking distance of the French Quarter in good weather. So I recommended it to my friends. However, I stayed in this hotel for the second time in December for two nights. Reality struck and we were disappointed. The hotel was fully booked for the weekend and the service was a big disappointment. It was raining, so we had to take cabs to the French Quarter or anywhere else we wanted to go. No one was designated to hail a cab. Rather, the front desk would call a cab, but would not give any indication of how long it would take, so we wound up just standing out in the rain to hail a cab ourselves. In addition, we had to make all our requests twice, and it took a long time for them to be fulfilled. We asked for extra blankets and when they did not show up, we had to call back and it took 30 minutes to get them. We asked for an extra roll-away bed, and they didn't even call to request it until our second request. Finally, the valet parking this time was very bad. We called 20-30 min prior (as they instruct you to do) and came out to the door on time (within 20 minutes) to find that our car was there, but the valet with the key was not there and no one at the front desk could be bothered to help us. So we waited for the valet for an additional 15-20 minutes, only to find out that he had left the key at the front desk and not told the other valet attendants and no one at the front desk seemed to know that the key was there. (Note that the valet parking service seems to be contracted out to Central Parking System, but the front desk does not seem to be able to interact with them effectively). It appears that while it is a good value for spending a night there to sleep, do not expect the quality service of some of the comparably-priced hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “REALLY GRREAT place to stay & the right price too!”
Reviews.Author: Groucho2
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough good about the Country Inn and Suites French Quarter. Everyone is nice and all staff seem to work as a team. We were so comfortable and surely enjoyed the included breakfast, especially the Danish. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: DemiButler
Reviews.Content: You cannot go by the reviews everyone have different expectations. Check-in and check-out was very smooth. The front desk clerks were very polite and helpful. The room was great and very clean I would highly recommend this hotel. Parking was not an issue for us because most of the streets had signs stating you could not park, it was a big event and they have to make their money. Each time we come to NO we expect to pay for the pricey valet parking it was worth it!! Also, the bartender is so very nice we ordered the meat pies and they were so good!!! I highly recommend this hotel and for the price on priceline it was so worth it!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value on a Better than Average Hotel Near French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: American_Bureaucrat
Reviews.Content: Father in his 70s and three sons in their 40s stayed in two rooms in mid-November for $71 per night per room. Rooms were spacious with comfortable bed. Exposed bricks and high ceilings in this converted warehouse were nice touches. Free Internet and a breakfast that was better than your typical continental breakfast. This was nothing to write home about but this value-conscious traveler would recommend this property again. Gave only middling rating for the staff as I didn't make much demand on the staff except for the front desk, which didn't seem to have enough staff to handle but one customer at a time. Valet parking is a little steep at about $25 per day. Hotel is about as far a walk from Bourbon Street (about 3/4 mile) as I'd feel comfortable making. One of our rooms lacked a window; the other looked in on an office about 20 feet outside our window. In general, we were quite please and thought this represented a great value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location, and very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Froggie33
Reviews.Content: I read the previous reviews and decided to book this hotel mostly because of the location and value. I was not disappointed. We could walk safely to anywhere we needed or catch the trolley car. The French Quarter is close as well as the Riverwalk and the World War II Museum. The breakfast was well supplied. Aaron was very friendly and gave us great suggestions for places to eat. Very quiet for sleeping at night. The only reason I gave the rooms a 4 is because there wasn't a lot of room to move around our king size bed. It didn't matter much as we spent all day out of our room.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel at luxury price”
Reviews.Author: LaLaRN
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Country Inn and Suites for 2 nights. We had paid the internet advance price, which was over $100 a night when you averaged the nights. We wondered aloud if we were given the smallest room possible because we paid the internet price - literally, the king bed in this "regular king room" was jammed into a nook, and you couldn't get through on the side near the windows - it was too close. The other side had maybe an 18" space. So if you are claustrophobic, this would not be your room. When we got to our room, we noticed there was no shampoo - we went back to the desk to get some, but they didn't have any. We requested some be brought the next morning. It never was. The bed was comfortable - with three pillows, for some reason. I guess you can trade with your partner who gets 2 pillows. The air conditioning worked well, which is very important. It is a neat building, with open beams and lots of "charm" that comes with old buildings. The floors are not level, for instance - we walked up a slant to get into the very small bathroom. The bathroom door opened in - which made it even smaller when you needed to be in there. The furnishings were sparse, at best. Overall, for what they charge for rooms, I expected more. I am used to staying at Marriott's, though - with comperable prices, and much more attention to detail. The "pool", as they call it, is not much bigger than a large jacuzzi. The patio it is on is charming. AKA small. This is my second experience with Country Inn and Suites - and both of them were negative. Positives: The location is great - you can pretty much walk anywhere you want to go in just a few minutes. They also have valet parking - at $23 a day, which is pretty much average for NOLA. The front desk staff was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “very comfortable and homely enviornment”
Reviews.Author: vaishaliNewDelhi
Reviews.Content: Iam adoctor working in India and went toNew orleans for a conference. Iam writing this as Ifeel sharinga goodexperience is must. Country inn and suites by carlson group a good hotel nice and clean. very hospitablestaff. You get good breakfast, 24 hour coffee and one feels just like home.I really liked it and woluld like to recomend to anyone visiting New orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable room in a great location”
Reviews.Author: MicKel09
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Country Inn & Suites over Halloween weekend. The hotel was in a great location, close enough to walk to all kinds of restaurants, attractions, etc. but was quiet at night. I loved the exposed brick in the room and the free wi-fi. The continental breakfast was nothing extraordinary but easy to grab a bagel or yogurt before heading out. The front desk staff and concierge were helpful. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Nursejilly
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night when we went to a concert at the new orleans arena. We arrived at 11am and were happy they could check us in early.We got free valet parking with our room rate. I had requested a room on the 2nd floor which they honored but when we got into that room, it had no window in the bedroom area and felt very small and stuffy. I immediately called and requested a different room. Our 2nd room was on the 4th floor and it was awesome! It was a corner room with lots of windows and was very roomy. Loved the layout of this room so much! And to make it even better, we heard no noise from neighbors AT ALL!! So peaceful. The staff was very accomodating and friendly. There was a tour information person stationed in the lobby and he gladly gave us a map of the area and told us what areas to avoid. He answered all of our questions. We didn't use the pool but it looked great. The location of this hotel is prime. We were able to walk to the french quarter and always felt very safe. We even ended up walking back to the hotel after the concert and this was a longer walk but it worked for us. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Overbearing Smokey Rooms”
Reviews.Author: rstank
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is very convenient. The common areas are nice enough. The staff was, on a hole, accomodating. Unfortunately, we pre-paid for a non-smoking room. The room smelled like someone had just completed smoking a pack of cigarettes. After bringing this to the attention of the management, we were told the hotel was full and there were no other rooms available. I was forced to limit my time in the room, and I woke up ill each morning.

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel 2 blocks from French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: FloridaZowie
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Country Inn and Suites New Orleans for 4 nights and could not have picked a better hotel for the price and location. Great looking lobby with bricks and beams, and a nice room with gas fireplace. The breakfast room was well done as was the food. The hotel even had a small bar in the lobby. All the rooms are different. We ask for an upgrade to a king suite with mircowave and fridge. The bedroom did not have a window so we asked for another room. The front desk clerk took care of it and we got a very nice room overlooking the pool courtyard (Rm #327) that had two windows. The hotel was in a very nice location two blocks to Harrahs casino and two blocks to canal street. Walking around was very easy from this location.

Reviews.Title: “The right hotel at the right price.”
Reviews.Author: boqueron1225
Reviews.Content: Everything positive that we had read in Trip Advisor, was for real. Good location,walk to all the good spots in New Orleans and then come back to a more quite part of the town. Clean rooms, good staff, better than average breakfast and the architectural look of the hotel makes a very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, courteous staff, impressive lobby”
Reviews.Author: Samihaha
Reviews.Content: The hotel is only a couple of blocks from Canal Street and the French Quarter so it's great for tourists who are in town for the touristiest place in the city. I was here for a conference and the convention center, though look close, is about a 20 minute walk. It's far away enough from all the hectic affairs and close enough to walk. It's nestled in a quieter corner in the district and perfect for those who seek serene relaxation after a day of conference or something else. The staff was also exceptional. I wanted to make a photocopy of something and asked for the direction to Fedex (two locations nearby). The staff volunteered to help me make copies with their own copy machine. Overall, just very pleasant and always wear a smile. The lobby while nothing like that of Bellagio in Las Vegas, is surprising distinct and stylish, different from the hospital lobby you seen in larger hotels. The exposed wood beams on the raised ceilings feels a little bit like a wood cabin resort, but the tiled floor gave a modern and urban sophistication. The room that I stayed in is not huge but has a king size bed. Strong airconditioning. No view. Most importantly, it was clean and felt recently renovated and no weird stodgy carpet smell common in other hotels. The only area of improvement is probably the dining options. The complimentary breakfast was very simple. Cerals, bagels. I don't recall seeing anything hot but I can be mistaken. There's no restaurant and only a bar for late night drinks at the lobby. Plenty of arm chairs in the lobby for lounging and casual meetings.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, location and staff”
Reviews.Author: alfredale
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two years during Jazzfest. The rooms have bee clean, quite and weel cared for. The breakfast was good for a help yourself breakfast. They have their own shuttle bus to Jazzfest or you can walk to the shuttle at the Sheraton (both cost). The pool is not large enough to swim in.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Experience”
Reviews.Author: KSweeneyMobile_AL
Reviews.Content: This hotel has everything you'll want in your stay. The hotel has a unique charm in the decor. The room is spacious, clean and updated. Breakfast is very nice. The staff is very courteous and helpful. It's close enough for the excitement of the french quarter but far enough that you don't get the noise. K. Sweeney

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Our Stay”
Reviews.Author: lmr1121
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be clean and the staff to be competent and polite. It was ideally located for us - we didn't have a car and this was a quick walk to the French Quarter, many restaurants and the river. It was also near the trolley line which we used several times.

Reviews.Title: “Valet not trustworthy”
Reviews.Author: travelgeek09PR
Reviews.Content: I had a large group and two passenger vans. The rooms and service was fine. Breakfast was enjoyable. But if using the hotel valet DON'T. They will park your car in the corner parking lot for $32.00, meanwhile if you park it yourself, in the SAME location, you will pay only $15.00. I asked the valet if there was another option besides using the valet and they said the only other option was trying to find parking on the streets...not true. Also, not trustworthy. I left my My $2000 video camera by mistake in my vehicle and it was stolen from my vehicle while under the valet's care. f Will NEVER stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: HelenPreston
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from holiday, and this was our final hotel stop in New Orleans. We loved almost everything about this hotel from the staff to the little extras (free hot drinks and cookies). Breakfast was extremely adequate and the little heated pool, a gem. My one and only small complaint was that we did have some creepy crawlies in our room. Apparently, they our numerous at this time of year, and the bear brickwork in the rooms, although gives character, also has a lot of nooks and cranies, whereby my husband spent time the first night plugging up the crevices. Putting this aside, this was one of my favourite stays, and an extremely good location.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: katmac53
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our stay at the Country Inn and Suites in New Orleans. The hotel was great as was our room. The staff is very pleasant and always willing to help. The hotel is within walking distance to the French Quarters and to Bourbon Street. Although it did rain most days it was only for short periods and then the sun was out. Mothers was a good place to eat. The only thing I didn't like was that you had to find a seat and you might have to sit with other people. Food was generous in portion. The French Market was a good place to buy souvenirs. It was like a flea market and was quite huge. The free breakfast at the hotel was good. You had a variety of things to eat. It was the same everyday but you can switch up as to what you want to eat. The hotel was very clean and towels for the room are always in ample supply. All in all I would go back to this hotel. Everyday there were free cookies set up at the front desk. Was a great little treat. I took one every time I left the hotel!!!! We took a swamp tour while we were there and it was a good tour. Our guide's name was Mike and even though it had rained shortly before we went on the tour and we didn't get to see alot of wildlife (we did see many alligators) Mike made our tour fun. He was funny and was a local guy so he had a lot of stories. Again it was a great place to stay....

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: BornToTravel79
Reviews.Content: Hotel is conveniently located within walking distance to the French Quarter and Bourbon Street. Also close are the Riverwalk Shops and boat tours, Jackson Square (Cafe Du Monde) and Canal Street Shops (movie theater). Very clean and quiet accommodations. Buffet breakfast is also a nice bonus. Pool is very small - just big enough for a quick dip to cool off. Fitness center consists of 4 cardio machines, but with all the walking available in this city it's not even worth walking in place on a treadmill!

Reviews.Title: “Great location - ticks all the boxes”
Reviews.Author: biggles81
Reviews.Content: Spent a great couple of nights right near the French Quarter. Close to Bourbon Street jazz clubs and city attractions. Hotel has been converted from seven historic buildings with loads of old world charm and original features. Rooms are very clean and comfortable and surprisingly quiet for inner city location. Breakfast buffet was more than adequate, though very busy on both days. Free internet in lobby. Valet parking was an added expense. Well worth a try. Will be back here again next time.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best staffs in a hotel, it was a wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: flynfit
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel during the french quarter jazz festival this spring. I used trip advisors reviews to find the best place I could and boy did we find it! Our room was wonderful, with a huge window and view of the courtyard. (some of the rooms because of the way the hotel is, it is 3 old warehouses put together) do not have windows. The location was perfect, our room was clean and nice, and the bed so comfortable! The breakfast was a plus and we would sit in the beautiful entry and have coffee and fruit every morning. The very best thing about the hotel was the staff, every single one and mean every single person was helpful, professional, friendly and did i say helpful?? Our bartender was the best of the best and we even put a picture of him up at our bar at home for our "New Orleans" party, after he gave us his secret recipe to swamp water. WE will BE THERE AGAIN NEXT YEAR, SAME PLACE.

Reviews.Title: “Staff was Terrific.”
Reviews.Author: kdirt2
Reviews.Content: Arrived a bit early, Room wasn't ready, But was offered two complimentary cocktails.and a room upgrade. Room was clean, quiet and breakfast was the best continental breakfast We've had in the last dozen or so hotels we've stayed at. Location is great. Will return again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: one30eight
Reviews.Content: Booked a spur of the moment trip to New Orleans with two friends who had not been before. It was definately going to be a guys weekend and I wanted a hotel in a safe area near the French Quarter. After looking at rates, area and online reviews, photos I settled on The Country Inn and Suites on Magazine. First off, the hotel is beautiful with the exposed brick and wooden beams. It is really easy to get around the hotel (which is great for those late night, drunken adventures back to the room.) I never used the pool or the workout facility, but it looked decent enough. The breakfast was great and beyond your normal hotel free breakfast. The staff was also great. We usually came stumbling in really late and always stopped by the front desk to talk with Frank. He is a great guy with a lot of knowledge of the area. He continually exceeded our expectations of hotel service. The area of the hotel could not be better. You are 2 minutes to Canal and 5 minutes from Bourbon. If you go the other way you are 5 minutes from Harrah's and the Miss river. We never took a cab and hoofed it everywhere we went. All in all I had a wonderful experience. There were some problems that was not exactly the hotels fault, but they are being taken care of. I would recommend this hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I really like enjoyed my stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: JLFTraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel July 15-19 and was more than satisfied with accomodation. I have nothing but positive things to say about this hotel. For the price, you cant beat this hotel. You get breakfast, workout room (all cardio-no weights), small pool, and free internet. The room was clean. The service was great. The continental breakfast was the best: eggs, sausage, juices, HOT WAFFLES, milk, oatmeals, fruit, etc. It even has a small full service bar. The hotel is in perfect location. Its no more than a 5-7 walk to Burbor street. Its near shopping and the French Quarter. The area was pretty safe. This is my second time staying at a Country Inn & Suites Hotel and will not be my last.

Reviews.Title: “Whole Family Loved It - Will Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: rwethereyet850
Reviews.Content: Lodging in New Orleans close to the French Quarter is always a crap shoot but we rolled the dice on this hotel based on TripAdvisor and really won big! The staff was not overly outgoing but would do what they could to accomodate any requests. The bartender was an exception as he is a real character! We asked for a quiet room and were given one that faced the inside atrium, so we got the hotel foot traffic but nothing from outside. The hotel posts a sign in the late evening asking all entering guests to consider that guests are sleeping, and it seemed to work well when we were there. Housekeeping was a tad forgetful (took towels and didn't replace), but a visit to the front desk got that corrected immediately (and a request for extra pilllows granted). Beds were really comfy and high ceilings in the room made it seem really big - we had a 2Q room and didn't want for space. The pool is 4 ft max depth, so good for smaller kids to frolic in but not much for adults - they should make it an oversize hot tub. Wife and daughter said the hotel breakfast was really yummy (no doughnuts though) although I waited and had beignets at Cafe Du Monde. Perhaps most importantly, we were within really easy walking distance to the Quarter, the Trolley and the Aquarium and always felt safe walking to/from this hotel. This weekend getaway was a real bargain as we got the room and valet parking INCLUDED for $95/night.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: AmazonKat
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was prime and within walking distance to canal and burbon streets. Far enough for rowdy nights but easy to get to. The rooms were disappointing to say the least. Sheets had stains at check in. We were giving a handicap room although reservations were made at least two months in advance directly thorough ther website. Bathroom was not cleaned during the entire stay. Cleaning person would just change towels and washcloths but not wipe down sink or clean tub/shower area. Room smelled of smoke although it was sold as a non smoking room. I had a blast in New Orleans and wish to visit again. I will NOT be staying at this location, nor will I stay at this chain in any other area.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place, but hate to let the "secret" out.”
Reviews.Author: GLA45
Reviews.Content: We live just a couple of hours west of New Orleans, so we go there often, but in 20 years I've never found a place I liked EVERY time we visited. The Country Inn & Suites is the exception. It's small and friendly -- from the reception desk to the housekeepers, everyone is helpful and smiling. It's in an old remodeled newspaper building and lots of the original ambiance is preserved, while the rooms themselves are clean and modern. The bartender at the tiny bar in the lobby area makes the best Cosmopolitan I've ever had and, like everyone else, is welcoming and friendly. The location can't be beat -- walking distance to the French Quarter, the Warehouse District, the river, and the Casino (if you're so inclined) -- and it's surrounded by superb restaurants within blocks on all sides. The last time we stayed (in April), we didn't like the room we got (it had no windows to the outside, just to an inside corridor with skylights). I asked if we could be moved and was immediately accommodated with a suite on the front of the building. This is my favorite place in New Orleans, but I've also stayed at other Country Inn & Suites facilities in other cities and they are all excellent so far.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Emmi2
Reviews.Content: During our annual "girl trip" we needed two queen beds and the older, smaller, pricier hotels in the FQ don't offer those. This hotel had lots of character. Our room was a good size, quiet, had great internet connections, and was close to the elevator. Country Inn and Suites was so close to the FQ that we walked everywhere, We did not rent a car but took a taxi to and from the airports, rode the street cars and took a NO tour in a van. The staff was great, friendly, knowledgeable and efficient. The breakfast was so-so, (although the breakfast room attendants were very friendly and helpful), but enough to get our day started. If I ever get a chance to visit NO again, I believe I would stay here; the price was decent compared to other accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Good price, easy walk”
Reviews.Author: UICHIEF
Reviews.Content: We stayed here and had a nice time. The staff were friendly and offered everything we needed. Breakfast area is a bit crowded and the pool is very small. We were in two different rooms because we requested a move and both vents were in major need of a cleaning, but otherwise the hotel was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Everything Nearby yet Quiet!”
Reviews.Author: Guestess
Reviews.Content: We booked for 2 nights but I could have stayed longer. The staff was really helpful upon check-in and even had our room ready before noon! The room was on the smallish side but extremely clean and well maintained. We took the first set of elevators to our room which was a mistake because you had to walk down then back up stairs in the hallway to get through. The consierge pointed us to the streetcar line to the Garden District which was around the corner. After checking out the park by the Zoo, Magazine St., Lafayette Cemetary and Commander's Palace for drinks, it was back to the hotel for a break. The pool- if you want to call it that, was refreshing for a little cool-down, but if you want to seriously swim or sun; forget that thought. The only chairs and benches were strictly for sitting. The French Quarter was 2 or so blocks away. After dinner and navigating through huge crowds it was a pleasure walking back to the hotel where it was nice and quiet. There were just enough people around to keep you from feeling as though you're walking in an unsafe area. The breakfast which was included was far from the typical continental. There were sausages, eggs, make your own waffles. Cookies were provided at all times. Check out was a breeze, but - "ouch!"- the bill for parking was $51.00 for 2 days!

Reviews.Title: “stay here!”
Reviews.Author: kittenkiss
Reviews.Content: We Stayed At The COUNTRY INN AND SUITES For One Night On Our Way To Florida. It Was In A Great Location, A Short Walk To BOURBON ST and JACKSON SQUARE. The Staff Was Wonderful. The Bartender Was Great, Bringing Us Drinks While We Were In The Pool. It Was Quaintly Decorated, WithThat "NEW ORLEANS" Feel. The Room Was Clean And The Bed Was Comfortable. It Was A Good Deal For The Price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Value”
Reviews.Author: Alwayselegant1
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because of the great reviews and great rate we found ($60 on hotels.com). We were not disappointed. The free breakfast was okay...sausage, belgian waffles, pastries, etc. In room fridge was unexpected. Did I mention the FREE Wifi?! The only drawback is parking...$24. We were lucky to find a free spot on the street but those are rare.

Reviews.Title: “Good location; good value; I would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: BabsFranck
Reviews.Content: Nothing fancy, but very clean and comfortable and very near to Bourbon St., Canal St. streetcar, Harrah's and Riverwalk. I barely had to take any cabs. Very walkable part of town. Continental breakfast was very basic, but served my purposes nicely. I was thrilled at how well the air conditioning worked; and it was quiet. I especially enjoyed the walking tours with Historic Walking Tours. Well informed guides. Swamp tour (Louisianna Tour Co.) was highlight of my trip...how often do you get to hold a baby alligator in the swamp? Restaurant food was disappointing. Best meal I had was at the New Orleans School of Cooking. Very fun class. I loved New Orleans & hope to go back again some day. Oak Alley Plantation was another highlight. The trees were amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Value”
Reviews.Author: sbbci
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a Memorial Day weekend stay at the hotel. This was exactly what we were looking for in a hotel, one with a lot of character as one of the other reviews states. It's a beautiful hotel and is close to many of the tourist attractions. We walked to everything we interested in seeing. The only drawback was the noise in the mornings as we were located close to the elevators and just up from the breakfast area on the second floor. Other than that, we loved our stay here and would definitely return! The staff were very helpful each time we asked for anything!

Reviews.Title: “Always wonderful”
Reviews.Author: lmstearns
Reviews.Content: This hotel is always my favorite when travelling with friends and family to NOLA. I've stayed here 5-6 times over the past 3 years. Thetwo room suites have an actual door that separates the fold out couch/tv room and the bedroom so there is a lot of room and privacy. Rooms on the street are loud due to traffic and birds. Rooms near the elevator are loud too. The location is fantastic-very close to parade routes, Canal Street, and the French Quarter. The lobby is huge with a cute sitting area, fantastic little bar (ask for a Swamp Water), free cookies in the evening, and a restaurant. Breakfast in the morning is well stocked and clean (cook your own waffles along with the fruit, yogurt, toast, Enlish muffins, cereal, etc) I've only eaten dessert at the restaurant once and it was so-so. The front desk is always super nice and very accomodating. I explained to them how I LOVE their hotel but I had trouble with the noise of the elevators and traffic so they worked very hard to find me a nice quiet room. This hotel is worth the price if you're looking for lots of room with some privacy, an interesting building, and a fantastic location.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, full of character”
Reviews.Author: langlish
Reviews.Content: This is a beautifull place to stay - this is a hotel with something other than just you standard square boring unfriendly rooms. The room had character, was well sized and clean. The hotel lobby is also really nice. The staff are extremely friendly and helpfull. The whole hotel is very clean, the breakfast was OK, however there is nothing hot. The location is very good, I would say a five min walk max to Bourbon street and the French Quarter. Definatly recommend this hotel to anyone!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, just off the beaten path”
Reviews.Author: TxAggieGirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the Country Inn & Suites in early April as a weekend getaway. It's located just 2.5 blocks off Canal street, which will get you anywhere in the French Quarter you want to go. We literally handed our keys to the valet when we arrived on Friday afternoon and walked everywhere until we checked out on Sunday morning. Check-in was easy and the lobby area is nice and bright. You pass the bar and little breakfast eating area on the way to the elevators, making it convenient. (Free breakfast in the mornings, which would be great if you were pinching pennies or with a family. We chose to eat out both mornings, so I can't speak to the quality of the food.) There's also a small courtyard just off this area with tables and chairs and a small plunge pool. From what they told us, the hotel is made up of several old warehouse buildings renovated to make one big CI&S -- which made it a tad confusing to find our room, but the cleaning lady pointed us in the right direction. The rooms, although not overly large, were perfect for our needs (and clean!) -- just a place to leave our suitcases, shower and sleep. We were on the back side of the hotel so our room looked out over the valet lot and some apartment buildings, but when you're in the middle of the city, you can't expect much more than that. The bathroom was just fine as well. We booked our room for $120 a night, which was a good deal for the quality of the overall hotel and the rooms, especially being so close to the Quarter. Everything in the Quarter that I saw was much more expensive. This hotel is a great choice if you're not dead-set on being in the Quarter and you need something affordable. We'd definitely stay here again on a trip back.

Reviews.Title: “Very charming with a great value & location!”
Reviews.Author: sarahnolan29
Reviews.Content: We chose this place to stay in / near the French Quarter after reading some great reviews on it and we can't help but agree with them! We ended up staying there for less than $99 per night for 3 days before we left on a cruise. At the end of our trip, we -without a doubt- thought our 3 days in New Orleans was the best part!! This hotel is not technically in the French Quarter, but is only a block or so away. We walked EVERYWHERE, and being a self-proclaimed complainer, I'm telling you it wasn't bad at all =) Unfortunately we did not have the opportunity to utilize much of the hotel's amenities, but the services we did use were great (very cleanly, complimentary breakfast was ok, front desk was very accommodating in our room requests, they serve cookies upon your check-in). Overall, this hotel is very charming and highly recommended (especially for the price!) in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Sensational!”
Reviews.Author: dmidmi54
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly enjoyed this hotel. It was right off the main street and still quiet enough to enjoy a good nights rest. The staff was extremely helpful with reservations for local tours. The place was clean and the breakfast was more than what was expected. Fresh and hot. I would go back again and again!

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel last July and Going back this June.”
Reviews.Author: TopekaTravelers
Reviews.Content: Wife was in New Orleans last May for a conference and wanted me to go see it. Friends were going in July 2009 so we made arrangements to meet them for half of the week they were there. Booked this hotel for a good price and seemed near Bourbon Street. It was quite simply perfect for us ... a couple blocks to Canal Street and a couple more to Bourbon all in a livele and safe walking area. We also walked to the river and casion comfortably. Great breakfast bar/buffet included in the hotel price and good to soak up the prior nights alcohol. Service was wonderful and the littel hotel bar was nice. It was very relaxing to come back to after a loud night on Bourbon Street. The price for the quality can not be beat. You can pay a lot more to stay on Bourbon Street but why? We had options of where to stay on Canal (Marriot or Sheraton) for my wife's conference in June this year and thankfully knew that this littel gem of a hotel was right around the corner from those two conference hotels .... paid a bunch less and know exactly what a great deal we will be getting.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, convenient and affordable...bon temps”
Reviews.Author: Snausage7
Reviews.Content: My friends and I were doing a "go right back" trip to NO after first visiting in 2008 and loving it. We were coming back for the food (yeah crawfish Po-Boys at Johnny's Hole in the Wall) and the music (yes, go to The Funky Pirate). Oh and we wanted to catch a bit of Jazzfest. We chose the Country Inn and Suites for convenient access to everything...walking to the French Q; Mother's right around the street; St. Charles Street Car right there...Harrah's two blocks out the door. We had a lovely week. The suite was generous and the beds were pillow-topped and comfy. We were on ground floor on Magazine Street so there was some street noise but not as much as you'd expect. The little courtyard with pool was an oasis. I enjoyed seeing the lizards darting amongst the potted palm and azalea plants. It was great to have coffee and waffles and yogurt and sweetrolls and all this stuff available early in the am that you couldn't really ingest realistically after a night on Bourbon Street. But that's the convenience part. All in all highly recommended. I look forward to our return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: andrez
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Country Inn and Suites for 6 nights. The hotel is located within walking distance to the French Quarter, the WWII museum, and the Aquarium. When we went out at night, we never felt unsafe in the Magazine St. neighbourhood. The hotel offers a decent complimentary continental breakfast from 6 am to 9 am. It even has a small bar in the lobby which offers happy hour drinks from 5 pm to 7 pm. We were also able to utilize their small, but adequate fitness centre. As for cleanliness, no complaints whatsoever. The hotel lobby and elevators were always clean. Our room was cleaned on a daily basis. The room that we got was a standard room with a double bed and it was perfect for two people. The rooms even have cable tv! I highly recommend this hotel and when I come back to New Orleans, I will definitely be staying at the Country Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: grafixgirl1664
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about this hotel. The staff was friendly, the room was nice and it was within walking distance of everything we wanted to see in the French Quarter. The staff helped us with directions and tours and there were complimentary cookies at the front desk. Yummy! The room was clean and very nice AND there were ceramic coffee mugs next to the coffee pot in our room. This was especially nice. I hate those little styrofoam cups. This hotel believes in going green and I really appreciate that.

Reviews.Title: “Great People, great service.”
Reviews.Author: WhackaWhacka
Reviews.Content: We stayed at County Inn and Suites before a six a.m. flight. The staff was wonderful. They gave us suggestions for our last night in New Orleans. They checked to make sure we had everything we needed. The room was quiet and clean. Our shuttle driver was fun and prompt,, which is pretty amazing at 4:30 a.m. We will definitely stay here the next time we visit New Orleans. We expected a functional stay, but felt welcomed and at home.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: susan096
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my daughter on a 7 day vacation. Excellent location. Continental breakfast was plentiful. Staff on the front desk could have been more friendly. Room was fine but could have been cleaned better. Found a pair of children's shoes under my bed on our last day, wonder how long they had been there, if they had cleaned under the bed regularly they would have found them. Poor TV reception on several channels. If your room overlooks an ally turn it down as the rubbish bins get emptied between 4 - 5 am each day and the noise wakes you up. Would stay at this hotel if in New Orleans again but would ask for an interior room which would be more quite.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: tempetraveler31
Reviews.Content: The Country Inn on Magazine Street in New Orleans is a great spot for the budget traveler. It's very nice, small room, but great service and in the best location. This hotel is within minutes of the French Quarter and all the action. They have a nice little gym and even a small bar with happy hour specials every day. We stayed there before going on a cruise and it really was the perfect location. They have a concierge on site that can assist you in getting to the cruise terminal and around New Orleans. We ate at Acme which was great, not sure it was as great as all the hype says, but well-priced. We also ate at Deanie's which was excellent! The service was impeccable and gumbo was great. If you plan on riding the trolley's anywhere, be sure you have exact change or you can't get on. Definitely go to Cafe du Monde for a beignet! There is A LOT to see so be sure to bring your walking shoes.

Reviews.Title: “Wow - what a quaint, spectacular gem in the midst of New Orleans!”
Reviews.Author: nola030709
Reviews.Content: I recently blocked and filled 15 rooms at the Country Inn and Suites for our March 7, 2009 wedding in New Orleans and all I can say is "wow" and "thank you thank you thank you" to Lisa and the entire staff there! I booked this hotel based on convenience, but what I got was much more than I anticipated, from my locals that stayed there as to not drive home after the wedding to out of towners, I received nothing but rave after rave! The rooms were spacious, had that wonderful "Old New Orleans" charm, high ceilings, comfortable beds, great staff, a charming pool area and very very reasonably priced, walking distance to all the great downtown and french quarter attractions, too! More guests, even locals, had never even considered this hotel previously but now plan to return and stay there again and again. Several local guests commented they would choose to go there just for a quick weekend getaway from home. I can't thank everyone there enough for impressing me and our wedding guests to this extent!! (my little niece especially loved the front library area and the cookies, too!!)

Reviews.Title: “Second stay as good as the first....”
Reviews.Author: chillinfool
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last June and was satisfied. I booked another hotel for my recent trip but decided to go back to Country Inn when the room rates dropped, saving me $50 a night from the other hotel I had booked. Country Inn is clean and comfortable, located on well lit Magazine St. just 2 blocks from the FQ. The rooms are a bit small compared to modern hotels, but you have to consider the hotel is located in 100 year old warehouses, so they had to work within the confines of the walls. Breakfast is basic, but good for a quick bite on your way out to explore the city. Overall a very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location during Mardi Gras!”
Reviews.Author: Lori009
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Country Inn and Suites in New Orleans for 2 weeks over Mardi Gras 2009. This hotel was everything the reviews said: clean, good value for the money, adequate continental breakfast, friendly staff, great location! We loved the character of the hotel that was built combining old brick warehouse buildings. It was only a short walk to the French Quarter, Mississippi River, the streetcare, Harrah's Casino and the Mardi Gras parade routes. We never had to rent a car until we decided to leave the city. Sal, the concierge, was a great help in booking tours and never led us astray. The only bad part was the weight we probably gained eating the delicous cookies at the front desk! We would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location at a good value.”
Reviews.Author: gymratspok
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel after much searching on the web and were actually advised by a friend to stay closer in the French Quarter. However we went with this hotel based on its #5 rating on trip advisor and reviews on the site. The hotel is an easy walk to pretty much everywhere downtown. The price was good, the breakfast is pretty carb heavy, but there was yogurt and fresh fruit every morning. Upon arrival we mentioned it was our wedding anniversary and they upgraded us to a suite. The staff was friendly and helpful, the place was clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Always_Globetrotting
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 5 night (Feb.15-20th) girlsâ€™ getaway in New Orleans. I chose Country Inn and Suites because of the reviews on this site. I was very happy with my choice. This hotel doesnâ€™t feel like a chain. The old warehouses have been restored to create a beautiful atmosphere. Room: I booked a standard double queen room through Travelocity. We actually only stayed in that room for one night (room 326). The room was sufficient. Beds were comfortable. The noise from the garbage truck did wake up my two friends early the first morning. I had a pair of earplugs in and heard nothing. The next day we were upgraded to a queen suite (room 302), free of charge. The front desk was concerned about heavy rains (which never came) and a possible leak in our room. We were very happy to upgrade to the bigger room. Our new room was spacious with separate living room w/microwave and mini-fridge. Again the beds were comfy and the noise was minimal. My only complaint was that not all the channels in the bedroom TV set came in clear. They were grainy and the color was distorted on a few channels. The living room TV was fine. I appreciated the free wi-fi, though it is common in most hotels. Staff: The people who we dealt with at check-in/out were very helpful and friendly. When we called down for some extra blankets and towels the staff was quick to respond. Both the bartender and the concierge were very friendly. I also spoke with Karen in the reservation dept. prior to our arrival. She was kind enough to fix an error that was made when booking through Travelocity. Everyone at this hotel was very friendly and went out of their way to make sure we had a great stay. Food/Drink: Breakfast was standard, but enough. There were some eggs and make your own waffles. There were also danishes, English muffins, bagels, oatmeal, cereal, etc. The coffee machine was accessible 24 hrs. a day. It was nice to be able to sit outside in the pool area or at extended lobby area at breakfast. Though, the pool area seemed to be a place were all the smokers seemed to congregate. The bar served light snacks and a variety of beer and cocktails. The bar had 4 happy hour specials, none of which were vegetarian. Location: The three of us were extremely happy with the location of the hotel. . The neighborhood felt very safe. We were within 2-3-block walk of the French Quarter, 2 blocks of Harrahâ€™s and the Riverwalk. We were only about a 15-minute walk to Bourbon Street and 5-7 minute walk to the streetcar stops. The location was also ideal during our stay for the beginning of Mardi Gras. We were able to see a bunch of parades and the hotel was only a 1-2 block walk to the route. Overall: We were extremely happy with the choice in hotels. I would not hesitate to book this hotel again on another trip to New Orleans. I would recommend this hotel highly to anyone looking for a convenient location and good service without paying an arm and a leg.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Viajero Del Mundo
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on the good review on Tripadvisor and we were not disappointed. The hotel is great, we stayed on the fourth floor near the elevator. The hotel is quite sound proof as we didn't hear anyone. There suites were nice and very roomy. There was a small fridge, coffee maker and microwave in the room. This was very nice as we had leftovers to take back to the hotels after the large meals. It was great to have access to water, drinks etc as well. The bedroom had a huge king bed which was very comfotable. One thing I did have a problem with was waking up with bloodshot red eyes every morning?!?!? I do have allergies. My husband thought perhaps problems with mold after flooding. We went to Mothers for dinner one night and food was delicious but I unfortunately ended up with food poisoning and lost a day of my short vacation as I had to spend it in the hotel room. Close enough to walk everywhere, the French Quarter and Riverwalk. We were worried about safety when we read about New Orleans but we felt quite safe staying here and walking around. Although it is definitely not very busy on the streets around the hotel at night.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DylanMichigan
Reviews.Content: My husband & I booked a short trip to New Orleans to get away from the Michigan cold & snow for a few days. Having liked the CI&S chain elsewhere and having stayed in a hotel in a restored canal house in Amsterdam last summer, the idea of staying at a motel in a restored historic building was appealing. We loved this place!! The exposed historic brick walls in the lobby area, the interior courtyard with the small pool and the pretty living room sitting area were wonderful. Having the breakfast as part of the price saved us a lot of money and contained plenty of options: yogurt, cereal, bagels, English muffins, do-it-yourself waffles, toast, cold boiled eggs, juice, coffee, tea, etc. Our room, 232, was in an excellent location near the elevator and seemed spacious to us. There were 2 queen beds, a lounge chair, a desk & chair. The beds were comfortable. Bathroom was attractive and clean. Closet was adequate size. I'd guess it was about 3.5 feet long. Does any traveler need more? There was a safe in the closet. Also, it had a hairdryer, iron, & ironing board. Everyone on the staff was very friendly and helpful. The hotel is in a great location -- 2.5 blocks away from the French Quarter. Decatur St. in the French Quarter is called Magazine St. once it crosses Canal St. We walked or took streetcars to every place we went, except for the airport. Lunch at Mothers is 1.5 blocks away, too. Wonderful time; we'll stay here anytime we go to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for value, convenience and safety”
Reviews.Author: JasonNH
Reviews.Content: As you consider a trip to New Orleans, you will undoubtedly be trying to ensure that the hotel you choose is in a safe area. My wife and I felt very safe in this hotel and we walked to and from the French Quarter several times a day. There were always folks out and about and the area is well lit. You may encounter an occasional beggar/homeless person, disheveled cook out for a smoke or a youth in baggy shorts trying to look mean and cool, but you'll find those folks in any big city and in the French Quarter anyway, so not to worry. Another big advantage of this hotel is that you can walk to the French Quarter very easily and we even walked down to the WWII museum. Not to worry -- you will not go hungry or thirsty at this hotel. There are plenty of bars and restaurants all within walking distance (or a cheap cab ride) Plus, the streetcar and bus are also nearby, so you really don't need a car if you stay at this hotel and simply want to explore the tourist areas of New Orleans. Avoid room 231 -- it's next to the housekeeping closet. Do however try to get a suite. It's worth the price to upgrade for the extra space as the standard rooms are quite small. The "Everything" store on the corner is expensive, but they do in fact have most everything you may need or have forgotten. Definitely visit the Suave Bar and Grill across the street and go to Mother's for breakfast which is around the corner. I agree with the other posts: the standard rooms are small, the breakfast is average but a nice perk and the pool is small, but it's there. This hotel has been in and around the top 10 on Trip Advisor for a while now and while I can't say it will blow you away, it's the right combo of value, convenience and safety that most travelers will be looking for in this market.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Staff!”
Reviews.Author: JoAnn113
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a Convention I was attending. My husband & I booked this hotel because of its close proximity to Canal St. Trolley and Convention site. The hotel had a charming mix of yesterday's architecture late 1800's- with original brick walls and old wheel compartments of an old elevator in the lobby. The maintenance engineer told us that the hotel contained some 8 original buildings to make up the current space. There was a lovely courtyard with a fountain and dipping pool; with lovely blooming vegetation, however, every time I wanted to go in and enjoy the scenery-there were smokers hanging out- so we avoided it... We upgraded our room to "Exec. Suite". This room had a separate bedroom with King, and separate living room with sofa/TV. The suite was the whole corner of the 4th floor. Beautiful floor to ceiling (12ft) windows! Very clean. Bed was very comfortable. The furniture was not especially fancy, but for the price it was fine. The only suggestion I would make to the hotel would be to upgrade the paper products used in the bathroom- both facial & toilet paper were a bit scratchy. Towels could have been a bit softer. The free Continental breakfast was typical- make your own waffles, breads, bagels, pastry, fruit, etc. I really liked the Mocha in the Coffee machine- they also had Latte and Cappuccino. The toiletries provided "Asira Botanicals" were very nice. When I mentioned to the front desk that the body lotion was very nice- she offered to send additional bottles to my room. When we returned later that day, there were 3 extra bottles there waiting for me in our room! I call that SERVICE! The front desk staff was extremely cordial & friendly! Every staff member we encountered was very friendly and said hello with a smile. (Very unusual for theses days) The housekeeping staff was efficient and friendly. At the Bar, they had "Happy Hour "specials on beer. The local beer is "Abita" gold & amber. Very good. They also had pizzas and meat pies at a very small price. The bartender John, was especially friendly, and recommended some local restaurants that were very good and inexpensive. We definitely enjoyed our stay here, and will recommend to anyone going to New Orleans- French Qtr.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location--Rooms Okay”
Reviews.Author: ksakmorris
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week long trip for a convention. We spent the first half at the Country Inn. I think most of the review are pretty accurate. The thing I like best about the hotel was the 5 story atrium with exposed beams, it really helped give the location character and charm. It was an especially nice place to sit in the morning for breakfast instead of in the somewhat cramped breakfast room. Contrary to the previous poster, we didn't hear any noise from the atrium area when we were sleeping. They do post signs in the evening asking people to be quiet as guests are sleeping, but I believe in all the rooms on the atrium the "sitting area" is closest to the door with the bedroom at the back part of the room. I would think it would be very difficult to hear noise from the lobby if you are in the bedroom, especially if you close the bedroom door. If you book a one bedroom suite, be warned that you will have two options. The first is a room where there is no window in the bedroom. Great if you want to sleep in, not so great if you are at all claustrophobic, which we discovered we are! The front desk was absolutely great about moving us into another suite, with a window on the street. You will definitely hear street noise from there, but it wasn't too bad for us since we were getting up so early for work. It would have been nice to have a white noise machine in the room or the offer of ear plugs though. Never heard any noise from the lobby. The bathroom is a small, typical hotel bathroom but with nice updates such as granite counters. Much too small for the two of us to both get ready in the morning. The mini bar area had a mirror, but not good enough lighting for putting on make up. Housekeeping was not exactly great, only seeming to make the bed and empty the trash. Mini bar counter wasn't wiped down, half empty cups were left, etc. Other than that, the staff was very friendly and helpful. We got a pretty good deal through bookit, so we were pretty pleased overall, but would have been less so if we hadn't gotten the deal.

Reviews.Title: “Could be better”
Reviews.Author: MLinMA
Reviews.Content: I moved over to this hotel from another in the city for financial reasons and the Country Inn & Suites certainly suffered by comparison. Our room (with 2 Queen beds) was very cramped, with little room to place luggage. The worst thing was that our room--like many others at this hotel--overlooked the lobby/eating area for the hotel, which has a tile floor. As a result, we heard all sorts of noise in our room from below as people walked through or ate their meals, which was particularly unpleasant at 5:30 in the morning. We were also under the impression that there was free parking and there was not. The location was good, but so is the location of many other hotels in NOLA.

Reviews.Title: “over rated”
Reviews.Author: Chicano_explorer
Reviews.Content: We stood for a week. The hotel is ok, but nothing to write home about. The room decor was avg, but the beds are very comfortable. The walls are thin so you can hear the people in the next room. Also, stay away from the back of the hotel. Garbage pickup is at 3am and they are not quiet. Staff sometimes had attitude when you asked for directions and refused to call the airport shuttle. Cleaning staff did not vacume the room for 4 days. You mus request staff to vacume otherwise they will just make your bed and provide fresh towels. Overall location and price was good compared to other hotels. I was just surprised that it ranked so high in tripadvisor, for avg accommodations. I have stayed at other high ranking tripadvisor hotels and they reflected the feedback. Basically you pay for what you get, so do not expect them to go above the basics/

Reviews.Title: “The Best Value In New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: dailywalk
Reviews.Content: We went to New Orleans for the weekend to attend a concert. We had not been to the city in five years, although we have stayed countless times in the French Quarter over the years. This was by far the best value we have ever found. We walked to the Quarter but also walked to the Superdome for our concert. The warehouse decor of the hotel is wonderful, our room with high ceilings gave it a plush feel, the staff was friendly and helpful, the breakfast was ample with make-your-own waffles (which saved us the expense of a restaurant meal), Mothers is around the corner (a great place to eat), and the price of the room was a great value. The valet parking is $23, which sounds pricey but is in line with other hotels There is a parking lot on the corner with overnight parking for $15. (Keep in mind, though, that if you move your car, you pay another $15, whereas valet allows you to come and go.) The streets surrounding the hotel are well-lit and we felt safe walking at night, although we were careful and on guard as any smart person is in a city.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel For The Money!”
Reviews.Author: ParadiseOklahoma
Reviews.Content: It had been awhile since we had visited New Orlean's so we decided to spend a couple night's there before we left on a cruise. I alway's do some research on tripadvisor before booking a hotel room. Country Inn and Suites was rated #1 on trip advisor at the time. I booked directly through the website and got a decent price on their suites. I figured since we were traveling with family it would be nice to have a two room suite to congregate in at the end of the day. Even though I booked in advance and directly through their website we were still given room's far away from each other. I will give you some pro's and con's of staying here. Pro's: Yes, it is in a decent location. But in my opinion, their were several good hotel's close to the main attraction's and Bourban street. We walked almost everywhere. Alway's felt safe. The police were out in full force during our stay. The hotel is set-up different than most hotel's. It consist's of several wharehouses grouped together. Had a lot of charm. Check-in was very fast. Had a decent breakfast selection, but was very crowded with limited seating. Yes, the bar area is very small but there is plenty of seating at tables nearby. The bartender was friendly and made some great drink's. My husband got hooked on the so-called swamp water special. Was actually a very tasty mixed drink.Had beer special's as well during happy hour. Con's; The suites were not all that nice. Room's needed a fresh coat of paint and the bed's were just average. I had read where the bed's were supposed to be really comfortable. Was disappointed to figure this out at the end of a long day. That is one of the main thing's I alway's look for at a hotel. The friendlyness of the staff and housekeeping was hit and miss. Alway's had to request extra washclothes and towel's. Would have been nice to have had room service. Most of the restaurant's near the hotel were closed by 10:00. Our room was near an exit, which became very annoying first thing in the morning when housekeeping was in and out talking and slamming the exit door. You would have thought that the suites would have been in a better location. Overall, this was a decent hotel for the money. We will be staying at the Intercontinental at the end of our cruise. I will write a review about my experience there on that hotel review site.

Reviews.Title: “False advertisement”
Reviews.Author: braunhy
Reviews.Content: Make sure if you are not happy do complain!! I will to the Better Business Bureau I think a reviewer kellianne17 from Philadelphia maybe right. They probably will put you in their worse room if you don't book through their own website. I did at first. Country Inn also advertise "they guarantee the lowest online booking rate" . I found one lower rate on other website - easyclicktravel.com I sent them the quote, but Country Inn refuse to honor their claim. They said that they found no information available. But I book via easyclicktravel.com for cheaper price. After reading kellianne17's review, I have no doubt that the County Inn will put guests in their worse rooms if rooms are not booked via their own website.Bbecause on their own website, they actually charge higher prices.

Reviews.Title: “A great find”
Reviews.Author: Shumtie
Reviews.Content: This was a real surprise - despite being part of a chain the hotel feels boutiquey and individual. Although the facilities aren't amazing, the room was spacious, very clean, and comfortable. Breakfast was a bonus, and the general ambiance is friendly and welcoming. So much better than some of the big chain hotels that are just around the corner. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - negligible housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: Jamaicanyardie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Country inn for 12 nights and agreed with other comments that the location is great. You are away from the crush of the French Quarter but it is an easy walk to get there and transport is easy by bus or trolley. It is good value for money since the hotel is pleasant and the rooms are fine. We asked for and received a larger room with a view and were happy with the additional space for our extended stay. We were disappointed with housekeeping however because the room was never properly cleaned and towards the end of our stay we were having to do our own inspection every evening and call to request towels or soap. Despite this we enjoyed the stay but had a nasty shock on the morning we checked out since we had been charged a $50 miscellaneous fee for damage to the room - damage that had been there when we checked in and was not repaired until a few days before we left. When we complained the manager removed the charge but it still left an unpleasant taste in our mouths since they did not even have the courtesy to advise us ahead of time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: musky100
Reviews.Content: My wife and myself stayed here for 4 nights between Christmas and New Years. The hotel is great. Great Location - just outside of the French Quarter, close to the casino, waterfront, shopping, the Superdome and restaruants. All are within about a 4 to 5 minute walk.
