The Superdome is about a 20 minute walk. Very quiet at night. We had a room facing the inner pool area so street noises were not a concern. Very nice room for the prices. Remember that this hotel is not a 5 star. The price is great for what you get. The hotel itself is what I would consider a botique type of hotel. A hotel made out of an old building with lots of character. Hotel staff were always friendly and would say hello. The little bar is nice for a relaxing drink after a day of touring around. The pool is small but fits the ambiance of the hotel. It is really a large hot tub but without the jets. Nice just to unwind before going to bed. The worst thing about this hotel is the breakfast buffet is always crowded. The food was really good for a breakfast buffet. Cereal, oatmeal, toast, pastries, bagels, coffee, juice, milk and everyones favorite, waffles. The problem was that it was always too crowded. Not that the hotel can do anything about that. A victim of its own success. One of the hotel staff who works the breakfast room was always helpful and had a smile despite some rather rude people who were in there demanding things right away and making more of a mess than was needed. He handled it WAY better than I would have. But hey you are in the Big Easy, go for a cafe au lait and some beignets at the Cafe du Monde.

Reviews.Title: “Best Over All Hotel in 15 Years of Attending Jazz Fest”
Reviews.Author: OklaLibraLady
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in hotels in Metairie, Kenner, the French Quarter, the Warehouse District, the Garden District, on Canal and on Bourbon Street and even in LaPlace one year when I waited too long to make reservations--you name it. Country Inn is a safe place for a single female traveler that doesn't cost $400 a night during Jazz Fest. New Orleans is not a safe place for a single female walking alone, and this hotel is near enough Canal Street that even at night and with the other tourists coming and going to the hotels in the area of this one, a single female is safe going out to dinner after dark. There has been many a night when I got a bargain room in NO but was terrified to leave it alone after dark--ordered pizza in. The hotel is new--none of the mold/mildew problems you see in some of the older, more expensive hotels. The breakfast is ok with me. They have fresh fruit, bagels, and coffee, along with the waffles, so I was happy. The staff is friendly. The bartender was a great guy. I never one time felt afraid, and I have seen people mugged right in front of me when exiting other hotels in NO, so I know of what I speak. The Jazz Festival is absolutely addictive--every year of the 15 I have gone I have never once been disappointed. This is a great city with great food and great people--just pay attention and stay safe.

Reviews.Title: “On The Run from Gustav”
Reviews.Author: psrogers01
Reviews.Content: Warnings?? What warnings?!? My friends and I decided we'd beat the odds this year and enjoy Southern Decadence in New Orleans for our first time in four years (the year before Katrina). Our plane landed and we grabbed the first available cab. As it arrived at the front of the hotel, I immediately was pleased with the location....not exactly in the middle of the French Qtr but definitely within walking distance (5 blocks tops). The front desk staff was sufficiently helpful (nothing special but why would they be - a hurricane's coming) and the room was just right. Many have complained about the pool and it is kinda small but I thought it fit the hotel perfectly. However, if you are looking for a pool to make your trip, this one is not it. We were soon out of the hotel and made our way next door to Hurrahs Casino and from there to Bourbon. Our trip, as you may know, was cut short as the city was evacuated 24 hours after we arrived. The hotel staff was very instrumental in getting us on the first cab to the airport where we scored standby tickets on the first plane home. So, was having to leave the Big Easy a little early a bummer? Sure. But we now have our own Amazing Race story to tell and the hotel compliments its nicely.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel, but definitely not the best New Orleans has to offer...”
Reviews.Author: babyblueSF
Reviews.Content: After looking at reviews for hotels in New Orleans on TripAdvisor, my friends and I were very excited to be staying at the Country Inn and Suites. It was one of the highest ranking hotels, in a great location, and affordable! Plus, people raved about the hotel. Don't get me wrong; this hotel is decent. But that's about all it is. With all the cute hotels with lots of character and/or the fancy hotels with gorgeous chandeliers or modern design, when we walked into the Country Inn and Suites, we were unimpressed. I like exposed wood beams, but the hotel just doesn't have a lot of character. Our hotel room had two queen beds, and the size was decent. The beds were averagely comfortable, though one of my pillows was synthetic and the other one seemed to be down-like. Neither was terribly comfortable. The bathroom was clean but not immaculate. And the water in the shower had two option: scalding hot or lukewarm. The service, however, was great. The people at the front desk were friendly and informative. The continental breakfast was also above average, since they had waffles in addition to the typical cereal/oatmeal/fruit/yogurt standards. But all in all, as I said previously, our stay at this hotel was unimpressive. I wouldn't avoid staying at this hotel, but considering all the other choices New Orleans has to offer, I doubt I'll be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chenky
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly liked this hotel. The location is excellent. It's just off Canal Street, and is close enough to the French Quarter that you can take a break from wandering around to return to the hotel for a mid-morning "pit-stop". The hotel entrance area is large and spacious. It has a good sized reception area, with comfy chairs, bookshelves and a fireplace. It has a really nice and welcoming ambience. The included buffet breakfast is fine, reception were great and concierge was helpful to a fault - so many trips and activities to consider! We had a room with a view over, well, a derelict courtyard. I guess that could have been better, but the peace and quiet suited us just fine. The room was clean and decently sized, as was the bathroom. The bed was excellent and everything worked, including the hotel Wifi. I'm struggling for something negative to say to balance my review. The shower in the room wasn't all that great, and the cookies at reception were disgustingly sweet is about the best I can come up with.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the Money”
Reviews.Author: ATLAS313
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in Mid November. Hotel pluses: value is great, free cookies, free decent breakfast, quiet rooms and great location close to the French Quarter etc. No real negatives other than maybe they could have more of a bar instead of 3 stools at a counter but I quibble. I would try to get a room not on the street as we switched rooms after one night.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with Country Inn and Suites!”
Reviews.Author: sharper1
Reviews.Content: Country Inn and Suites was in a great location, and staff (esp. at breakfast) was excellent. Had a two room suite, living area a bit small and small window in bedroom but very clean and comfy beds. Used laptops both wired and wireless with no problems. Guy in next room came in at 4am and turned tv on LOUD, waking us up. I called front desk and they called him immediately and he turned down the volume. Tiny complaint was that brochure for hotel says they have sausage at complimentary breakfast, but they did not. I didn't care but I had told men in the family that hotel had meat at breakfast and they were a little annoyed at its absence. Would definitely stay at this location again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel & Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie99
Reviews.Content: The Country Inn & Suits Hotel in New Orleans was excellent for the low price that I paid. First of all, the hotel facilities and the actual hotel room itself were both immaculately clean, which is always a plus in my book. The rooms are not huge, but spacious enough for a comfortable stay. The bed was also super comfortable, which helps after a long night of partying on Bourbon Street. On top of the general aesthetic and comfort of the hotel, the staff is both friendly and helpful. I checked-in and out of the hotel with ease and received prompt service when I had any questions or requests. The location of this hotel is quite ideal as well since it is right in the central business district and just a stones throw (i.e. 5 - 10 minute walk) from the French Quarter and excitement of Bourbon Street. You are close enough to experience the party and easily walk home, but far enough away where you get some peace, quiet and relaxation. I also found that the hotel was located a convenient distance from most other attractions and only a few blocks away from the St. Charles Street car.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Aveadora
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 2 nights, had to switch rooms because they booked the suite we were in for someone else on the 2nd night and got transferred to a regular room. That was kind of annoying but we dealt with it. Rooms were clean and nice, the beds were comfortable, the rooms are nice though there's no "good views" really. Valet parking is worth paying for, they were very nice and even ran to get items for us that we forgot in the car(the hotel parking deck is 2 blocks away). The breakfast is basic but good, good for grabbing a small bite to eat before going out. The pool is outdoors and tiny, was not impressed with that in the slightest. For the money and being so close to the French Quarter it's worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Yes, this is the place you should stay”
Reviews.Author: MNDC
Reviews.Content: Especially nice features: + Location near, but not in, the French Quarter + Adaptation of interesting old architecture to new purposes + Helpful, friendly staff + Good wireless + Comfortable, clean, tastefully decorated rooms + Quiet garden space + Affordable

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: F0xyCle0
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel. The lay out is a little different, but this is due to it being converted from a couple of old warehouses. It adds to the charm. The room was sufficient, and quiet. The bed was wonderful and slept very good. It was nice to be away from all of the noise on Bourbon street, but still be in close proximity to everything. We walked through another chain type hotel (larger one) and didn't seem as warm and inviting as this one did. We were glad we chose Country Inn. Breakfast was standard and good. Pool was very small. Enough to take a quick dip in, however don't count on doing laps or laying out. Not that type of pool....more like a very large tub. As another reviewer mentioned, there is no problem with the air conditioning working. Our room was a little stuffy when we first got there, however quickly cooled down and in fact we even had to turn off the air one night, because it got so cold in the room. Pre-pay price on the website was a great deal. Would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great For The Price”
Reviews.Author: CenCal
Reviews.Content: We stayed five nights here before Halloween. The service was good, the continental breakfast was good, the small pool was good. The room and bathroom were clean. Walking distance to the French Quarter was a plus. Overall, great room for the price. Definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location!”
Reviews.Author: Craazylulu
Reviews.Content: This is not your typical chain hotel. The front desk lady said it has been renovated from a few warehouses put together. And very perfect for staying to check out the French Quarter, it's all walking distance. And you KNOW after a few of those hurrianes you shouldn't be driving anywhere anyway! This hotel is in a high traffic area so you feel safe walking places because there are people and cars all over. The rooms are clean (but pretty small), the staff is helpful, free internet, and there is a continental breakfast in the am and happy hour drink specials in the pm if you are going the super-budget route. The only downside I found was that you can hear everything that goes on in the halls outside your room, kids running & screaming etc. But well worth staying in, perfect for a weekend getaway! BONUS: our room had a 2007 Zagat Guide for us to read to further research all the yummy places to go eat!

Reviews.Title: “Huge king suit”
Reviews.Author: SLICKYINC
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay. huge king suits, and very clean. Within walking distance of the french quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Impressively charming and classy”
Reviews.Author: CMarcos
Reviews.Content: Made month-long reservations for a business trip and had no idea how great my stay would be. I actually had a chance to move to the Hilton after 2 weeks but decided to stay at CI&S. This is the BEST hotel when looking for elegance, comfort and affordability. EXTERIOR: Designed to blend with historic surroundings of old warehouse style neighborhood - TOTALLY adds to the charm. ATRIUM: Amazing 5 story area of brick and exposed beams. STAFF: Helpful and courteous, from front desk personnel to the maintenance guys. VALETS: Friendly, fun, and professional even during crunch time a.k.a. check out. LOBBY: Offers free internet/printing, and small but respectful library of reading material. SITTING/LOUNGE AREAS: Plentiful and cozy. COURTYARD: CHARMING! Allows hotel to claim New Orleans roots without screaming â€œrecently renovatedâ€�. POOL: Small â€“ more like a large spa sans the jets. 4ft depth may be found boring for swimmers but great for a refreshing dip or evening hang out. POOLSIDE BATHROOM/CHANGING ROOM: Nice, roomy and private. WORKOUT ROOM: Good variety of machines with fresh towels available in both pool and workout areas. DÃ‰COR: Elegant mix of traditional, classic and serene throughout hotel and guest rooms. Be sure to grab a home baked cookie at the front desk on your way to the lobby bar and have a drink and a chat with John the bartender. I found all the room amenities listed on the website accurate. 2 room suites along Natchez (bedroom and living room) seemed more like a small apartment than hotel room. The King beds are high, soft and sleep inducing. Housekeeping was GREAT, consistent, thorough, patient and friendly. The dining room was always clean and neat. Breakfast offers an incredible variety, even for continental. If you walk away hungry then its your fault. Take the other comments seriously about CI&S being conveniently located. You can see Canal Street from the front door but donâ€™t have to suffer hearing the late night nightlife on most nights (after all, this is New Orleans). Less than 20 minute walk to the river, mall, aquarium, Dragoâ€™s at the Hilton and into the French Quarter. Negatives (sorry!): Room air conditioning units work almost too good, noisy garbage trucks collects between 3-5am - request an inside room if this will affect your stay, though there are plenty of sitting areas, the hotel isnâ€™t huge and when large groups stay it seems like they are â€œtaking overâ€� the entire hotel. I almost forgot I wasnâ€™t staying in a place that Zagatâ€™s doesnâ€™t classify as a luxury hotel. CI&S offers the same services but with a personable staff, cozy atmosphere and affordable rates. Forget the fact you canâ€™t afford a room somewhere else or there wasnâ€™t any availability. CI&Sâ€™s sophisticated charm will make you forget you wanted to stay elsewhere. This is truly New Orleans best kept hotel secret, which is why I hesitate to write a good review, though well deserved. I have no idea how they stay in business, being such a great hotel of extremely high quality and service, at such a low price. Other luxury hotels may be high class but this hotel has more class and charm than any of them!

Reviews.Title: “Just Gorgeous”
Reviews.Author: oznorms
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just great especially for the price. We stayed here for 3 nights in August with 3 children (5, 8, 10). The room was great - plenty of room, extremely clean and bed very comfortable. The staff were quiet but very helpful and friendly. Loved the cookies at the front desk (kids did too!). The internet access in reception was fantastic for us as we could pop down anytime to quickly check emails etc. The pool is tiny but after walking around New Orleans in the heat is was a welcome relief for the kids. The hotel is in a really great location close to everything we needed. Went to Mothers for dinner - fantastic experience! Breakfast was good but everywhere we went in the US they used plastic crockery and cutlery which is environmentally really sad and does cheapen the experience a little. All in all loved it and would be back any time.

Reviews.Title: “country inn N.O”
Reviews.Author: paulhScotland
Reviews.Content: we stayed here 3 nights, clean and comfortable room & free wi fi in room. Breakfast inc- basic but good- have a shot of the waffle machine. The building is a converted warehouse, looks good in the hallway where you can see the original exposed beams. There is a free access PC and Printer in the Lobby Magazine st, is just off the French Q, worth staying as its abit less noisy, if heading for Bourbon st , recommend going along one the streets parrallel with it and up onto the st instead of gonig up Canal st, its quite edgy at night. If i make it back to NO i would be staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for a city trip!”
Reviews.Author: Dutchees
Reviews.Content: with an impulsive mind we decided to visit New orleans for two days. So through Hotwire we booked our stay at this hotel. It was a wonderful hotel with an amazing entrance! Really pretty. Room was a normal hotel room with all the facilities needed (bathroom, internet, tv, and a nice comfy bed). Great stay if you want to explore New Orleans. Also great is that its not really downtown the French Quarter so you can sleep at night (no noise from outside). But with a few steps you are at the harbor and the quarter! Really nice stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Rate...Great Bed”
Reviews.Author: grlbrandy
Reviews.Content: I could not have asked for a better stay at this hotel. Not only was the rate fantastic, the bed was extremely comfortable, the entire property was clean, the breakfast was more than adequate, and the staff never failed to smile and ask how our vacation was going. Not only that, but the hotel was within walking distance of everything and far enough away from the noise that can be New Orleans. My husband and I will be staying here during our next trip to New Orleans. (By the way, there is a GREAT restaurant--Mother's--right around the corner that I would recommend.)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Bargain!”
Reviews.Author: Princeton_Man
Reviews.Content: Just returned from dropping off our daughter at Tulane University. This hotel is just a block from Canal Street and the St Charles Ave street car and the French Quarter -- a perfect location. It is also across the street from Cuvee, one of the top French restaurants in the city. The room was very clean and modern. The staff was very friendly and helpful (a great concierge). The free breakfast was excellent. We got a $66 per night rate online. There is also an overnight parking lot a block west on Magazine St, so we avoided the valet parking fee, which is rather steep. The neighborhood has some abandoned buildings and broken sidewalks-- reminders of Katrina's fury. But all in all, this hotel was one of the highlights of our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good...”
Reviews.Author: VSU_Mom
Reviews.Content: My family (my husband, two teenagers, and I) stayed here for four nights in July. The hotel lobby was lovely and our room was large. I would highly recommend NOT getting a room on the street level. We checked in early and they asked if we would mind, and we said okay, but it was a mistake. Very early in the morning (around 6 a.m.), every morning, we heard some sort of truck outside. Not sure if it was trash pick-up or some sort of construction, but it was impossible to sleep through. Also, you must keep your curtains closed because people on the street tend to look right in. The hotel location was okay. We didn't want to be on Bourbon St. because of noise, but it was a bit farther than I thought it would be from the Market and the heart of the French Quarter. However, it is close to the Aquarium and Harrah's if you're planning to go to either of those places. The hotel concierge was nice and helpful, and the front desk staff was okay, depending on the day. The Cuban restaurant next door is excellent, but there are no other places to eat very close by that we could find. The breakfast buffet at the hotel was quite good, considering that it was free. Parking was $25 a day, but that's standard for NOLA. The pool was TINY--really not a pool at all. Since there was a family and their child there everyday when we visited, we couldn't get in, but that wasn't their fault. They were hot just like we were. If you're not a smoker, you might want to stay away from the pool area anyway, since that is a smoking area and the smell was horrible and we couldn't stay out there because it is very small and people were smoking. Overall it was just okay. The room was clean, the housekeeping staff was nice and accomodating, and the bartender is very cool. I don't think I'd go back mostly because of the location, but it was a good deal for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: kenpeterson
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night in New Orleans at this hotel. I would give the hotel 5 stars, but the front desk staff was less than competent and less than friendly. I have heard that since Katrina the service industry has had problems finding and keeping good people and it shows. I had problems on this trip with waitstaff and hotel staff. At the CI&S my card key wouldn't work and it took me trudging back to the desk all the way from my room three times and starting to get very angry before they got it right. Anyway, an exception is the bartender John; a great guy, full of tips and advice and pours a mean tequila. I will stay there again just to drink at his bar. The room is small but clean, the location is great. The price is more than reasonable at $75 per night, but is kind of misleading, as you will pay another $25 per night to park. I will stay there again due to the location, price and great barstaff.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!!”
Reviews.Author: DoubleE
Reviews.Content: We had a great time in New Orleans, and the Country Inn & Suites only added to the trip. Staff was very nice, and helped with any info we needed. The cookies at the front desk are great, just the thing for a snack between meals. My wife and I came to N.O. by train. We had no problems getting to hotel ( about $12 taxi fare). Transportation around the city is easy. A muni pass for $5 allows you to ride any public trans all day. Central Grocery has great muffulettas. Other good eats were Acme Oyster House, Deanies, & Gumbo Shop. We had read the breakfast at Mothers Rest. was good, but we did not think so. This hotel is just south of the French Qtr, but not too far away to walk. I would stay here again & plan to on my next trip to N.O.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Lindahdhw1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Country Inn & Suites, 315 Magazine St. New Orleans, LA the last week of July 2008. What a wonderful hotel! This property is charming and cozy and also has a cute little swimming pool. My room was lovely, the small bar very friendly, front desk staff very helpful and Minette, the concierge, was great. Included in the room price is a very nice breakfast . The location is very handy to the French Quarter, Riverwalk and many restaurants. We felt comfortable walking outside all of the time. It was a terrific experience and I look forward to returning to this hotel the next time I'm in New Orleans. I paid the unbelievable price of $70 per night.

Reviews.Title: “For the price...”
Reviews.Author: scg128
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 6 nights based on the great reviews on Trip Advisor, my favorite source of information. Unfortunately, I hardly think it deserves the high ratings it has received aside from the price factor. Certainly the hotel is a real bargain - we paid in advance on the hotelâ€™s Web site and nabbed an average nightly rate of $76 + tax - hard to beat that! Had to laugh when I saw the rate posted on the door in our room of $339 + tax - I wouldnâ€™t pay that for this hotel under ANY circumstances, but at the rate we got it was fine. The hotel is a nicely done renovation of old warehouse buildings so you donâ€™t feel as if youâ€™re in a boxy cookie-cutter. It is very clean and very attractive. We had a standard room with a king bed. Slightly small, but adequate. Specifically requested a room facing the front with windows based on recommendation here. I donâ€™t know how I would have felt not having windows, but the truth is our drapes were always closed to keep the sun & heat out. Our toilet wasnâ€™t fixed to the bathroom floor & was wobbling. It was fixed immediately, but not level - worked fine, but looked silly. Very small bath tub. Someone had written the A/C was cold. Iâ€™d say itâ€™s adequate. It feels nice and cold when you come in from the street, but we were sweating during the night even with the thermostat at its lowest setting. The biggest problem we had was with the bed. They have good quality, thick, pillow-top mattresses, but the sheets do not have deep enough pockets to fit the bed. Every morning weâ€™d wake up with the bottom sheet Â½ way down the bed - very uncomfortable & annoying. Also, the bottom sheet was put on the bed inside out. Three complaints to the front desk staff did nothing, though one day the chamber maid tried to pull the sheet a little lower - she never did turn it right-side in. Generally, the front desk staff have an attitude as if theyâ€™re doing you a favor. Day time staff were indifferent and unwelcoming. Night staff much better - helpful & friendly. The concierge girls were helpful & pleasant. The cookies are a nice touch (no one offered them to us & I wouldnâ€™t have noticed them if I hadnâ€™t read about them here), but they are WAY too sweet. The included breakfast was bearable. The counter set-up in the breakfast room in inadequate - too small a space for the number of people. Bagels, English muffins, mini-muffins, cold cereals, yogurts and fruits - canâ€™t do anything wrong with them. Coffee was ok - not terrible as some had written. Iâ€™m not into waffles, but they were a big hit with the crowd, and I do mean big crowds hoping for a chance to make a waffle. The eggs & sausages were absolutely revolting. Give me those runny, dehydrated eggs any day over these dry, cardboard, imitation omelets - disgusting. Sausages looked too disgusting to even try. The courtyardâ€™s very pleasant & the mini-pool a life-saver after the broiling heat of the city. They need to empty the courtyard trash and ashtrays more often. This is the only smoking area of the hotel (they only have 3 smoking rooms) and itâ€™s uncovered so smokers (me) have no place to go out of the rain. And lastly, the location. We didnâ€™t mind the location and yes, it is less than 3 blocks to the Quarter, but thatâ€™s to the EDGE of the Quarter, not its center. If you have any walking/disability issues this is not the place for you. Would I stay here again? probably not unless I was on an incredibly tight budgetâ€¦.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay near French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: overman129
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Country Inn and Suites French Quarter for a brief weekend getaway. Could not have been more satisfied. Not only was the hotel beautiful and an excellent place for a quiet stay, it was also within short walking distance of the French Quarter, Riverwalk, Harrah's, and the Aquarium. Parking is available through the hotel, as well as a public overnight lot one block away provided you arrive early enough. Also, we strongly recommend the Cuban restaurant just next door. I cannot say enough with regard to this hotel, we will definitely be coming back any time we travel to NO.

Reviews.Title: “aribre”
Reviews.Author: ariaydlysme
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here July 5-8 2008 for the Essence Festival. I chose this hotel after reading all of the great reviews and those were accurate! The hotel was very nice, the rooms were very clean and comfortable. The bathroom was nice and looked very new/remodeled. We were only in the room to change and sleep for a few hours. The hotel is in safe walking distance to just about all there is too do in New Orleans. French quarter was about a block away. Oharra's is very close buy to for you gamblers (we didn't gamble but we did go and attempt to and they offer free drinks if you are doing so). The riverwalk was a short 10 min walk away as well. We are considering going back to next year and this will be our hotel of choice. Oh...the staff were all friendly ...we were there during a really busy time but they were very helpful whenever we had questions. Mother's restaurant is around the corner and I had the food was great...was a long wait tho :( but worth it all!

Reviews.Title: “Not much shut eye in Nola”
Reviews.Author: rtussin
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after reading reviews here for what seemed a family orientated hotel ( ie suite accomodation). The rooms and staff:all good- in service and size but oh the NOISE - I don't know if it was just bad luck but we stayed during a period when two groups of 60-100 teenagers were there, and the noise they made at night carried right up to the rooms making sleep impossible. It wasn't entirely their fault, the design of the hotel ( with it's lobby without ceilings) while beautiful means there's no ceilings to dampen even the slightest noise. I would have though management would put families in a quieter part of the hotel- but ours wasnt the only family suffering. Bottom line... if you want to sleep before 12am, DON'T get a room that lies off the reception/lobby area.

Reviews.Title: “Okay for the price”
Reviews.Author: precious_gurl
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I spent the week of July 4th at this hotel in New Orleans. When we arrived we were struck by the beauty of the hotel, especially the lobby area. It has an old world charm appeal. We checked in and even though we were very early we got a room. Unfortuantely it was on the 4th floor and the noise from the AC unit on the roof was unbearable. The front desk graciously allowed us to check out other rooms and we decided on one on the 3rd floor. Much better! The good news: the free breakfast has a good amount of options. There is a computer with high speed internet in the lobby where you can also print. On the downside, if someone is using it you'll have to wait. We found the concierge to be very helpful and informative. The room was small but comfortable. Now for the bad news and there's a lot of it: There were no sheers on the windows in the room, so either the shades had to be open or the room had to be cloaked in darkness. The TV is in an awkward position which makes it difficult to see from the bed. Our iron leaked black stuff on my boyfriends pants. We requested a new iron and it never came. We told the front desk about the stained pants and they agreed to pay for the cleaning. However, when we went to retrieve the pants they were sitting in a bag on the floor because the front desk forgot to give it to the dry cleaner. This happened the day we were leaving so the manager (thank God for Karen, probably the only professional acting person I met there) said we could mail in the cleaning receipt to get reimbursed.; The cleaning person took my personal soap from the bathroom. I don't know how you can mistake a large bar of soap for the dinky bars they give you. One day we forgot to request room service so we asked for some sheets and towels. The front desk told us they could not access the sheets but could send up towels. How can a hotel not be able to access its own sheets?! So we called back a few hours later and lo and behold they brought up sheets. On the whole I found the front desk staff to be unprofessional and downright rude at times. If we approached the desk and they were already helping someone else they would not even look at us to say, "i'll be with you shortly." In fact they avoided all eye contact and acted as though we were not there. Also, when we entered the hotel after being out all day the front desk staff would barely acknowledge us. They were too busy joking and talking with one another. Overall, the hotel was fine since we did not spend too much time there. There is just too much to see and do in New Orleans. I loved the location of the hotel though because it's not directly in the French Quarter but it's close enough to walk there. I probably won't stay here again because I found the service lacking. If that's not important to you, it probably is a good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel; Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: wanderlust333
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for about five nights in December. Travelling to New Orleans is a very affordable vacation and December is part of their off-season and the weather is still nice that time of year! We chose this hotel beacause of the tripadvisor reviews. And boy, was everyone right on! I am a little late writing this review as a result of a very poor experience that I had at a Country Inn & Suites in Wytheville, VA. So, I just wanted to give this hotel in New Orleans their well deserved praise. This hotel is situated right on the edge of the french quarter, and close to the warehouse district. It was an ideal location, but still off the beaten path a little. Check in was easy and the staff was friendly. We stopped at the little bar in the lobby during happy hour. That's where we met John, the bartender. He was great, just as other reviewers mentioned. He was very helpful with suggestions on places to go and the Swamp Water was yummy! The rooms were very clean, quiet and comfortable. The room was small, but the ceilings were high so it made up for the fact. The only downfall about the room was the TV- it was a tiny outdated model. Maybe they upgraded since we last visited. The fitness room was pretty nice and the pool, although small, was very nice and private in the courtyard. A nice touch were the fresh baked cookies they had at the front desk. The complimentary breakfast was sufficient and you could sneak in the room throughout the day for coffee. I would definitely recommend this hotel. It was very afforadable, clean, a great location, and the staff was very pleasant. A+ to the Country Inn & Suites in New Orleans!

Reviews.Title: “Great service at Country Inn and Suites”
Reviews.Author: MickiKaye
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Country Inn & Suites while in New Orleans for the Essence Music Festival. The staff was great -- very responsive, agreeable, and eager to please. I loved the airiness and decor of the hotel lobby and common areas. The daily continental breakfast was adequate. My only problems with the hotel were how paper-thin the walls were: I could hear everything going on with my next door neighbors, from conversations, to using the toilet, to simply walking through the room! It was unbelievable how thin the walls must be. The bathrooms need an exhaust fan. Those are my only two complaints. Overall, we had a great experience, and I'd stay there again...armed with my earplugs.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in NO”
Reviews.Author: molletts
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights from 31st May. At first we were a little disappointed that we weren't right in the heart of the French Quarter but after our first walk through there at night we were glad we were just out of it as it is a very noisy area. It is only a couple of blocks of safe walking, even at night. The hotel itself is charming and very good value for money. Our room was huge and very comfortable. Two friends travelling with us thought they had booked a room with two beds but they were given a double bed. A request for two beds was met with no fuss. The concierge was very helpful in helping to arrange an alligator tour. The breakfast, included in the price is very good and there is a guest laundry which we found useful. There is also free internet access. In all a very nice hotel which I would have no hesitation is recommending.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Suzmich
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night at the Country Inn and Suites, but were impressed by the friendliness of the staff, the look of the hotel and rooms and the great price. The warm cookies at the front desk were a nice touch. The breakfast was good. The rooms were clean and attractive and it was only a short walk to the French Quarter and other attractions.The only complaint we had was the $24.00 valet parking and the dumpster pick up at 4:00 am in the alley outside our window. The noise from the truck emptying the dumpster wasn't terrible, but it did wake me, also perhaps because I was expecting it after reading another review of this hotel. Overall, we enjoyed our stay and would definitely stay again if we're ever back in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Really neat hotel”
Reviews.Author: HOaKIE
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night on a business trip at the Country Inn & Suites near the French Quarter. A really neat hotel. Renovated from historic buildings, you can still see the old structures that are weaved into this new hotel. My room had 12'+ ceiling height and the walls were thick block walls. The lobby shows the old beams from the warehouses that used to occupy the site. The staff was friendly and efficient. The bartender was a great host. My party walked several blocks to Emeril's restaurant to eat dinner (excellent place to eat). The area was safe. We didn't venture into the heart of the French Quarter but it wasn't that far to walk. I would definitely stay at this hotel again in I return to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great price”
Reviews.Author: Arlo89
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights and really enjoyed our visit. The location was wonderful, as it was an easy walk to the French Quarter. Or, you can take the trolley by the aquarium (a really easy walk) and ride to the end of the line, which lets you off at the French Market. Our room had two queen beds and a sofa sleeper in the living room, and all were comfortable. Our room faced the street, so it was a little noisy, but I imagine rooms in the back were quieter. The breakfast was really handy, although I have to wonder why they bunched up all the food on one table instead of making a longer "buffet" style breakfast. Or else they could've placed different types of food on various tables around the room, so guests could get what they wanted without having to stand in the massive line for waffles. There were several youth groups there, and it took quite awhile to get through the line. The food was good, though. The downside is the $24/day for valet parking, but since we only paid $98/night, we can't complain too much. We also used the washer and dryer, which were ancient and took forever. We would definitely stay here again -- it was a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms vary greatly”
Reviews.Author: travelin_Aisha
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel after reading reviews on Trip Advisor. First room we were given had stains on the carpet, dirty bedding, and was poorly lit. We asked to transfer rooms. Our request was honored without a question. The next room was great with a wall of floor to ceiling windows, 12 foot ceilings, and was clean. Breakfast was good each day. Extremely short walk to French Quater. Paid about $60per night. EXCELLENT VALUE for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms”
Reviews.Author: kbq
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 4 Days in New Orleans. This hotel is fairly new with great rooms and a wonderful complimentry breakfast. Our only problem was with the Valet Parking - which charges $24.00 a day! On the second day we noticed my daughters ipod was missing from the car. When we confronted the valet manager he said their was nothing he could do about it.. We also spoke to the Hotel manager and they said they were not connected to the Valet Parking. It's a shame that you can't trust anyone anymore especially in city that is trying to rebuild its tourism. We definitely won't go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Tremendous value near the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Pushcart
Reviews.Content: I just spent a long weekend at the Country Inn and Suites with some friends last weekend, and I was highly impressed. I admit I was a bit skeptical at first since I got a rate that was a steal considering some of the properties a short distance away and their overinflated room rates. The front desk staff was very polite and helpful at check-in, and they definitely made me and my friends feel welcome. I booked a room with a king bed for myself, and while it was a little small with a view of a parking lot (with a small SUV less than two feet from my window), the room itself was actually very comfortable. The free breakfast wasn't too bad, although it seemed to take forever to heat the little cheese omelettes and breakfast sausages that were available. Honestly though, if I'm in New Orleans, I'm looking for beignets for breakfast anyway. Check-out was just as easy as the check-in, and the front desk staff was more than happy to call for a cab to the airport. I think it's a safe bet that I'll be staying here on my next trip to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “great location!”
Reviews.Author: lexjax
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the end of May...good location and quiet, which is important to us. I thought the cappucino out of the coffee machine was fine! the staff was helpful and friendly...we spent most of our time out in the city, so the hotel had all we needed to be comfortable. we would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it again!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: denedayle
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last June and had a great time and left a great review. We returned again this year as my daughter graduated and as her gift I took her to a concert at House of Blues. This hotel in the past year has not changed. It is still wonderful, everyone was very nice and loved the breakfast. Will stay here again if we decide to come back in July. I do agree with a past poster though that they need to go back to the old coffee machine. The coffee from the new machine was horrible. Oh well, I went to my room and made it in the pot they have in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Very god choice”
Reviews.Author: Christian75
Reviews.Content: We had a very good experience with this hotel and their staff. The only problem we had was the flushing system of the toilet in our room number 431. It didn't get fixed entirely, so the "heavy load" got flushed away once but the next flush filled the bowl and it took a while to drain off. After reporting it to the front desk, they took care immediately. It's quite busy during breakfast time, but not a real problem. The food is good, our room was clean and quiet. The hotel itself is in a very good shape. It's not just the lobby that looks nice, also the rooms are in good shape and decent size. There was s no fridge or microwave or coffeemaker in our room, but in NO you tend to need a place to sleep only. The hotel is in walking distance to the French Quarter, the Street Car Stops on Canal and also St. Charles Street and a couple of restaurants. It's not too close to noisy Bourbon Street but also in walking distance. What's nice after a few cocktails. This area appears to be safe to walk even at night. We did it every night and there was not a single issue.

Reviews.Title: “loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: nancyd93
Reviews.Content: Well first let me tell you that we were orginally booked for the the St. Christopher hotel which a Best Western and it was about a block from this one and we walked by and were glad we booked here. We have stayed at Country Inns before and this was just as good. The staff was fabulous and more than willing to give us assistance and suggestions. I arrived off a very early morning flight and they were able to accomodate me with a room at Noon on a saturday. It was extremely clean and well kept. I loved the exposed beams and the brick walls that were also exposed. We were in room 332 which is on the back side no view except another building but not what I was worried about. The breakfast was FABULOUS!!!! The pool area really an oasis. Couldnt have asked for better in the $100 range of hotels. Glad we swithched from our other choice just before our trip. Oh and the AC works like a champ since it was hotter than the face of the sun when we were there!! Just kidding well maybe not!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: SkyeLights
Reviews.Content: Clean, beautifully decorated hotel with a friendly, helpful staff and comfortable room. Perfect location and even better than we'd hoped for at an extremely reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay, only one issue, but it's a biggie...”
Reviews.Author: sberhard
Reviews.Content: I'll just reconfirm everything the other reviewers have said; nice place! Recently remodeled and well done, several buildings that have been combined into a large hotel. I stayed in room 449, if you don't like long walks from the front door to your room, avoid the rooms in this side of the hotel, it's quite a hike! My big beef, the coffee. They have an espresso/ coffee/ latte machine that looks impressive, but the coffee quality is not good. After the first day, we took breakfast elsewhere (there is a Starbucks in The Sheraton a few blocks away). C'mon guys, with everything else so nice, let's bring the coffee quality up!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!!”
Reviews.Author: TomSarasota
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in May and so happy we did. Great location and friendly staff. Our room and the common areas were very clean and refreshing. The front desk staff were always very pleasant and willing to help with questions. John, the bar tender, was also very friendly and gave us tips on dining and things to do. We travel quite a bit and are somewhat "picky" about clean and quiet rooms. This one was great. Would stay here again the next time in town.

Reviews.Title: “Jazz Fest”
Reviews.Author: Hotmama499
Reviews.Content: We attended the first weekend of Jazz Fest 2008 and stayed at the Country Inn and Suites based on the outstanding reviews. The hotel is very much like the pictures posted. We found that the loctaion was incredible as was the staff-they bent over backward to accomodate requests. For example, our first room was very small and located over some sort of generator or air conditioning unit. My husband likened it to sleeping in a two prop plane. He called the front desk at 6:00 am and we were moved later that day to a great room overlooking the street. The breakfast that they offered in the morning was good for a hotel continental breakfast and would be a money saver to people on a tight budget. They had two a waffle irons, eggs, sausage, pastries, cereal, etc. It's a short walk to the Quarter-which we found convinient. The location is awesome in relation to several restaurants in the CBD(we came to New Orleans to eat!). Cuvee is across the street, Bon Ton on the same block, with Emeril's, Cochon and August an easy walk away. Another review said that the pool was a glorified hot tub and it was, but we didn't care as there were too many other things to do. Overall the hotel is a good value in a great location. It is very, very clean, safe and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Great way to start a cruise”
Reviews.Author: frg1995
Reviews.Content: We arrived early in the afternoon and was unable to get the room suite we had booked but they were quick to find a king room available. Rooms are small but the atmosphere of the lodging is unique. The lobby shows like online with courtyard setting. I thought the swimming pool was extremely tiny and not inviting but we was not intending to use anyway but for those who were it is not something you could do laps. We did get a cup of coffee from the breakfast area and sit out by the pool and read. The fitness center can be gotten to by outside by the pool. Breakfast was typical waffles, yogurt, cereal, etc. Area was clean and continued to be replenished. Did request a wake up call and they were late by 20 minutes but I had already woke. But might stress that when calling down if it would be a problem with you or not. Location was further for walking than I thought but there again that was not a problem for us, enjoyed and the music festival was ongoing at the time. I was aware of parking charge but the taxes applied on to the charge brings daily parking close to $30.00. Staff was friendly when encountered. Was close to cruise termnal and walking to French Quarter, Riverwalk and terminal is available for those who can walk distant.

Reviews.Title: “Good location,O.K. Hotel”
Reviews.Author: harleybonz
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very close to the French Quarter and Harrahs but I don't really think it's all that.The price is right ,and I only know a few hotels that are nicer for that price.But during the summer months some very nice hotels run the hot summer nights specials, for around $100.All these people writing these great reviews ,I don't think tried the number 2 and 3 hotels on the tripadvisor list.They are nicer..in my opion.Don't get me wrong this hotel is o.k.,and it's a pretty good location.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value For Money and Great Location To Boot!”
Reviews.Author: FogElf
Reviews.Content: What can I say - I think this place is amazing! In my opinion, New Orleans is an absolute must-see, and this hotel is the place to stay while you're seeing it. It really is just a five minute (safe!) walk to all the action in the French Quarter, which means it's also just far away enough to get a good night's sleep (don't know how anyone gets any sleep in those hotels on Bourbon Street!). I've stayed in loads of big chain-type hotels, and this one beats them all. 1) This hotel is FANTASTIC value for money (it cost us about 40GPB for a double room per night - not each, but for the room!) 2) Breakfast is included! 3) The outdoor pool is small, but was never busy when we were there (had it to ourselves most of the time we used it) and is heated! Great for a dip after sightseeing to refresh you before your night out! 4) Our room was not like the bog-standard rooms that adorn most chain-type hotels - it had character, with exposed brickwork and unique furnishings. The bed was the most comfortable I had stayed in for a long time! 5) The fitness room was good. 6) Free cookies - nice touch! Overall, an excellent place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Christmas in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: ozcookie1
Reviews.Content: We were staying in New Orleans for Xmas and so therefore put considerable effort into ensuring a decent property for our three night stay. We decided on the Country Inn and Suites after much deliberation and in hindsight we made a fabulous choice. The reception staff were extremely helpful (although the fresh coookies disappeared quickly). The suite we stayed in fronted the street, was extremely large and had so many channels on the TV we couldn't sample them all. The decor and atmosphere within the hotel were unique and the exposed beams added to this. Breakfast was excellent (loved the cook your own waffles). Our only negative was that the bar was closed for a full week over Xmas but we didn't have to walk to far to find somewhere to drink. No restaurant in the hotel but plenty close by so this is not an issue. We went to the Excellent Cafe Adelaide at Loews for Christmas lunch and this was barely a 5 minute walk. For the price the one bedroom suites are great value and in our six week trip were easily the largest rooms we stayed in. We needed to send some things back to Australia and the maid was very helpful when we made the unusual request for a box. She appeared minutes later with a box from the kitchen. We loved out stay here and walked to the French quarter each night. Harrahs is also staggering distance away which was handy. We would love to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Big, clean rooms, lovely foyer and breakfast 'courtyard'”
Reviews.Author: sheoli
Reviews.Content: Loved the big, clean rooms (ditto the bathroom) and charming paved courtyardy five storey high foyer and breakfast spaces with glass ceiling. Great service, a little 'library' to borrow books, lovely lounge with sofas and fireplace...and a copy of the New Orleans Zagat in each room.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: princessebird
Reviews.Content: This hotel was quite lovely. I was in town for a conference and opted for the Country Inn and Suites based on its location to the convention center and to the French Quarter, and it turned out to be an easy walk to both. The room itself was much larger than I anticipated with high ceilings and huge windows. The bathroom was also much larger than the typical hotel bathroom. The front desk folks were always wishing me well on my way out the door and on the way back in. The high-speed internet was free and fast and the breakfast was okay (waffles, yogurt, pastries, toast, etc) but free. One word of warning: I stayed on the 4th floor at the back of the hotel, and while it was lovely 23.5 hours of the day, the trash was picked up both mornings at 4:30am. It was loud enough to wake me up on the 4th floor, so I am certain it was VERY loud on the 2nd or 3rd floor. (Why couldn't they do that at 8am or 10am!) It would not prevent me from coming back, though I would specifically ask not to be put in that location.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Trinisis803
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Country Inn and Suites from March 17 to 21. Great location within adequte walking distance of the French Quarter including the famed Bourbon St. Check-in was easy. Hotel is situated in a safe area of the city. Room was cleaned and towels changed daily. Hotel is pretty new with a sort of a rustic look. Pool area is relaxing but pool is small. The free breakfast is okay. Good value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “A great value right next to the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: D from MO
Reviews.Content: I needed an alternate hotel near the Sheraton on Canal, where I was attending a conference. I found the Country Inn & Suites on Magazine Street to be reasonably priced, clean and convenient in location to my conference and to the French Quarter. The rooms are small, but the building is architecturally interesting as a combination of three older buildings that were remodeled into a hotel. The free breakfast buffet has a good selection as well. Overall, a good buy!

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Stay at the Country Inn and Suites!”
Reviews.Author: Sarahste
Reviews.Content: The reviews were correct -- the Country Inn and Suites in New Orleans is a delightful gem; a great room in a lovely little hotel that is priced reasonably and located well. We spent three nights in February at this hotel for a combination business/pleasure trip, just before our four-night stay at the Royal Sonesta in the French Quarter. Although this hotel is not luxurious, it is comfortable and interesting. I loved the architecture--the exposed beams and atrium--and even found the small courtyard and (very) small pool charming. (Hey, my kids enjoyed the pool and that is good enough for me!) The front desk staff was friendly and helpful, and we had no trouble using valet parking for our rental car. As for the location, well, don't be fooled that this place is actually *in* the French Quarter, because it is not. It is technically in the CBD (Central Business District). However, it is conveniently located *near* the Quarter. I lived in New Orleans for 10 years, and I knew just where this hotel was located. It was a great location for us--walking distance to the Convention Center and Children's Museum, as well as the Aquarium. The breakfast was fine for what it was. My kids are always happy to get a warm waffle and I'm happy if I can get them a piece of fruit. We liked our room, the Internet worked, and we were comfortable. And of course, the price was right, which always make the stay more enjoyable! : ) I will stay here again ... absolutely!

Reviews.Title: “Gem of accommodation”
Reviews.Author: teachum2read
Reviews.Content: My company recently sent me to New Orleans for a convention. I found that my accommodations were favorable to most of the others, which cost more than mine. I stayed at the Country Inn and Suites on Magazine St. in New Orleans. It is centrally located between the tourist fun of the French Quarter and the work location of the Convention Center. From this location, I could walk to either place in about 10-12 minutes. I found this preferable over staying at the pricey French Quarter hotels which would have meant double the walk time to the Convention Center for the work part of my trip. Also, they provide a lovely continental breakfast which many of the other hotels did not - My friends asked every morning why I arrived with a bagel and coffee, and their hotel had nothing. Also, the staff was very friendly and helpful, especially the great bartender John who recommended great restaurants with moderate prices to us. Also, there's a constant supply of fresh baked cookies in the lobby! The decor does not have the glitz of several close by hotels, however it is quaint, rustic decor that fits perfectly in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Just as described”
Reviews.Author: suzannsm
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a one-night pre-cruise stay for about $150. It is charming with exposed bricks and beams. The service was good and the breakfast adequate. The bar, pool, and courtyard are nice but tiny. We walked comfortably (with children) to the waterfront and Bourbon street. There is alot of construction on other properties on the street and it will probably be a very nice street in a few more months.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem!”
Reviews.Author: Ted Fry
Reviews.Content: It's vanishingly rare nowadays to find a place that is reasonably priced, instantly comfortable, close to everything a tourist would want to see, and keeps every promise. The Country Inn & Suites New Orleans excels on each of these points. Travelers of all types -- singles, families, seniors -- will appreciate the responsive, helpful staff; the comfort and quietude of the large rooms; the imaginative renovations which incorporate every modern convenience into a series of 19th-century warehouses, and the unbeatable location just outside the French Quarter (wise travelers seldom stay IN the Quarter: lodgings there are virtually always overpriced, undersized, and too close to the noise). Outstanding breakfast room, too, whose chicory coffee alone is worth the stay. My only tiny quibbles were the occasional slowness of the elevators and the somewhat dim bathroom lighting. Otherwise, one cannot go wrong here. A serious suggestion: every visitor should take the disaster tour. While the Quarter and downtown have been almost completely restored, much of the rest of the city still lays in abject ruin. Every American needs to see this -- and to ask himself what would happen if his hometown was similarly unfortunate.

Reviews.Title: “terrible customer service”
Reviews.Author: pumpkinOH
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was nice, and the location was good, but the service was terrible. The breakfast buffet was horrible and with the exception of one member, the staff was not friendly. The worst part of the whole experience was the valet parking. Since it was a busy time, a letter was left to ask you to call down for your car about 30 mins beforehand, which I did. However, after an hour of waiting (and watching cars clog up the whole street and never moving), i finally asked about my car. Over the course of the next 45-60 minutes i was told: your car is on the way, your car is at a different lot, your car is stuck in traffic, and what kind of car did you have. All this while people who have called down after are getting their cars. After all of this, I received a letter in the mail postmarked 2-25-08 for a $40 fine for a traffic citation from 1-7-08. I was supposed to respond in by the hearing date of 1-22-08 to contest it, but of course i couldn't since i didn't know about it. So now I owe $80 w/ the late fee. The valet must have just removed the ticket, threw it away, and never told anyone. I have written to the New Orleans violation bureau, so we'll see if anything is done.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Capitol_Explorer
Reviews.Content: I took a family trip to New Orleans and stayed at the Country Inn and Suites. All things considered, this hotel can not be beat. The price is very reasonable, it is amazing to me how inexpensive this place is compared to how nice it is. It is architecturally interesting -- the hotel is made up of 5 renovated buildings and features very tall ceilings, exposed bricks and beams. The rooms are very large (we opted for an upgrade to a suite for $20 more a night). The beds were very comfortable and everything was very clean. It was clear that the employees care about their hotel. At the hotel desk, they keep a constant supply of freshly baked cookies and they are wonderful. The continental breakfast in the morning is certainly above average and features freshly made waffles. The hotel also has a small shop where you can purchase convience items at normal prices (e.g. a package of tylenol for 75 cents and a water for $1). This is a nice convenience to have. The bar was small, but more than adequate. It also featured good happy hour specials. Same could be said for the pool, small but nice and more than adequate. The hotel is located about a 5-10 minute walk to all of the areas of the French District you would want, including Bourbon St, Cafe DuMonde, the Central Grocery, the river front. It is also around the corner from Mother's Restaurant (which is a must). In the opposite direction is Emmeril's resaurant NOLA. The area in and around the hotel is very safe and I never once questioned my safety. Actually, I was very pleasantly surprised how nice everything was in and around the hotel. Certainly very few traces of Hurricane Katrina here. (However, I do suggest a Katrina tour to see how much other parts of the city still need significant amounts of recovery). Anyone thinking of heading down to New Orleans should definitely go. In many of the main areas a tourist would want to go, the only thing missing were the tourists. Help the city out with its recovery and take the trip!

Reviews.Title: “Reviews are correct”
Reviews.Author: LilyOhio
Reviews.Content: We stayed only 1 night after a cruise with Carnival. The hotel is great. It is very clean and yet has the rustic appeal of the old business it used to be. Many of the buildings in the French Quarter are very run down do to their age. But this hotel was completely renovated in 2004 and remains well maintained. We had a room facing Magazine street which had 18ft ceilings and windows to match - beautiful. We were very close to the French Quarter but in quiet area. We also felt very safe. We ate at Cafe du Monde, Johnny Poboys, and Mothers. All very good - only don't expect to be waited on . These are old time diners which have become famous for their food. Cleanliness is not a priority in this area - so go with that in mind. Very glad we experienced New Orleans. New Orleans is a must for every American.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice!”
Reviews.Author: buckeyenation
Reviews.Content: The reviews are correct. Its in a great location...about 10 minute walk to the French Quarter, the Aquarium, Harrahs, and about 20 minute walk to the Superdome. We stayed in a suite which was very clean and very big. We loved the 2 story ceilings in the master bedroom and living room. Our room faced Magazine st and wasnt noisy at all. The courtyard and pool are very small but its a nice quaint little area. The fitness room was also adequate as my wife and I did cardio each day. The breakfast is good and we even had scrambled eggs offered every morning along with the yummy waffles you can make. The staff was EXTREMELY helpful and friendly. Be sure to talk with the bartender at the hotel bar..His name is John and he'll tell you everything you need to know bout NOLA. Tell him Brian and Stephanie from Ohio say Hi ! Mothers is right around the corner and Bon Tons is right next door.. both delicious. Also went to Nolas and Mr Bs Bistro...EXCELLENT! Dont forget to go to Frenchman St (take a taxi) and enjoy the JAZZ. The locals we met were very nice and greatful we're there to help New Orleans economy. IMPORTANT! we kept hearing how the city was so crime ridden and dangerous. NEVER did my wife and I ever feel in danger. There were lots of police in the area (as there is in any large city) and whereever we walked we felt safe! Just dont go walking down the proverbial "dark alley" We are so glad we went down to watch the National Championship game. We never would have experienced NOLA otherwise and we will DEFINITELY go back and stay at the Country Inn and Suites

Reviews.Title: “Solid, Quality Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tracker400
Reviews.Content: I stayed here based on reviews from this website. I was there for Mardi Gras. Reviewing any hotel during Carnival season in New Orleans is difficult because the city if so crowded and the hotel is so crowded. Each morning the breakfast room was filled with hung over people in sweats and ball caps. With that being said, I would recommend this hotel. The location is close enough to the French Quarter. The service at the hotel, what little I had, was excellent and the room was very clean. There was nothing fancy about this hotel and the "work out" room only had cardio equipment. I was able to check in early and did not have a complaint. The tub drained slowly and it was fixed within 30 minutes. You won't go wrong with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Afordable and Clean”
Reviews.Author: leenabeena
Reviews.Content: I was in town for the BCS Championship and room prices were insane. I stayed here for about $200 a night. Its much cheaper when there is no event. Its a nice hotel. has a small pool and a gym. Also offers free continental breakfast. I would recommend staying here during event when other rooms are way too expensive or unavailable. Personally I prefer a hotel with room service and pay-per-view which this hotel doesnt have. But the rooms are nice (a little small) and clean. I had a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “What a great get away trip!”
Reviews.Author: foodie01720
Reviews.Content: What a great trip - travelled with another couple. The hotel was fabulous. It took 30 minutes to get there by cab from the airport. The lobby was warm and welcoming. Check-in/Check out - speedy with no problems at all. Our room was lovely and comfortable and clean. Breakfast was your tradtional fare, make your own waffles, sausage and biscuits, cereal, ygurt, bagels, toast, etc. I thought it was very thoughtful that one of the employees brought toys and coloring pages to one of the families during breakfast. The pool is very small - but had it been warmer during our stay, we would have been in it everynight - outdoor and heated. The work out room is sufficient. The location of the hotel is the best two blocks from Canal Street one of the main drags that runs perpendicular to Bourbon Street. It was nice to stay in a hotel away from all the noise found off of Bourbon Street. But a nice walk as well.

Reviews.Title: “charming”
Reviews.Author: AlanandHarriet
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading the other reviews. Service was with a smile and was wonderful. Location is an easy walk to wherever you wish to go. Currently there is nothing to see or do around the hotel so it's very quiet. Others have written hotel descriptions with which we agree. This is not a large hotel but has plenty of rooms, good "breakfast items" and is very clean! Price is very reasonable at least this time of year, under $100 per night. Since I am claustrophopic, I was concerned about a comment someone else had, but I had no problem. Our King bed was in a space about 175 sq ft (small) and had a nice, large bathroom and closet on the otherside of a 3/4 wall. This is a charming place.

Reviews.Title: “Laissez les bons temps rouler--let the good times roll!!”
Reviews.Author: onoman
Reviews.Content: Had the good fortune to stay at the Country Inn and Suites. Located about three blocks outside of French Quarter. Practically next door, they are doing some construction work--some debris on street, but amazingly enough, did not find construction noise an issue--guess they start work late. There is not anything else on this block of Magazine street, other than another hotel across the street. Hotel looks new and they made good use of an older building. Lobby is well lit and extends to the sky lights in the ceiling, 5 floors up. Staff was very accommodating. Helped us find a a 24 hour pharmacy to get some prescription medication for one of my kids. New Orleans is still getting back on its feet and there are not many 24 hour pharmacies available. Had to take a taxi to this one at 6 AM. No problems calling for taxis at hotel--we did not rent a car. Happy to not have a car, most places can be reached by foot and the street cars on Canal street are only about a block away. Parking available at hotel for a fee. As we were there around time of Sugar Bowl and BCS bowl, traffic flow was restricted in the French Quarter. Suite room had two TV, wall safe, small frig, microwave and two queen beds and a full sized pull out sofa bed. Slept our family of 5 very comfortably. Internet is free, requires a cable in room, but wireless available in lobby. They also have a computer with printer available to print boarding passes--nice touch. Small pool and bar also available, but did not use either one. Breakfast was OK--hard boiled eggs, frozen patty sausage, pastries, bagels, toast, cereal and beverages. Sugar cookies all the time at front desk and a copy of USA today available in the morning. Fortunately, the rest of our meals were outside. We had coffee and beignets at Cafe du Monde, muffulotta sandwiches at Central Grocery and two very good dinners at Bayona and Isabelle's. Ate way too many praline candies. Still trying to work off the calories. Had a good time in New Orleans--wandered around the French Quarter, listened to jazz at Preservation Hall and shopped for gifts on Royal street. Took a tour with Tours by Isabelle--specialized in small tours--ours was 10 people and we went to see two plantations and the Cajun swamp country. This was a great tour with very good guides and I would highly recommend it to see what else there is outside of New Orleans. Saw areas still waiting to be rebuilt post Katrina. I would recommend this hotel if you do not want to be in the middle of the French Quarter and the craziness of Bourbon Street. Close enough to walk there, but far enough away to get some peace and quiet. Very family friendly and a great staff. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Real Gem”
Reviews.Author: lschmidt
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Country Inn and Suites four nights for the BCS Championship Game and couldn't have been happier with this property. Actually, it is seven historic buildings connected as one and has the historic charm, but yet up-to-date. It's a block and a half to the French Quarter, close to the Superdome, and easy walking to the Riverwalk, Aquarium, I-Max and Convention Center. We drove to NOLA, but never used our car while we were there. Parking does run about $25 a night, but most other hotels in the area charge much more. The cable car is easy to catch on Canal St. (a block and a half away). The staff is exceptionally friendly and respond quickly to problems. Our heat went out one night and they promptly sent someone to fix it. There was also an elevator problem, but it was quickly remedied. Beds are very comfortable and room service was excellent. The bar is small and closes at 11:00. The pool is a very small outdoor pool, but is surrounded by a nice patio area with tables and chairs. The lobby is good sized with plenty of seating. There is only one computer, but it was easily accesible. Breakfast was good for a continental breakfast - eggs (scrambled and boiled), sausage, rolls, toast, waffles, cereals, etc. We had a deluxe king room which faced the front and was a big sized room. Noise was only a problem one night - after the game- but it was noisy everywhere. I did see some interior rooms that were much smaller however. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place to stay for Jazz Fest”
Reviews.Author: houstongv
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a reasonably priced (and decent) place to stay for a long weekend during Jazz Fest. We wanted to stay in walking distance to most everything in NOLA too. We searched several hotels in the French Quarter, most of which were either overpriced or booked due to the event - Though we were a little unsure about staying in this type of chain hotel, we chose the Country Inn & Suites because the website stated that it was in a historic building, and they offered some good deals for the weekend. The location is really nice, and the building's charm really adds to the character of the hotel. The staff was really wonderful and gracious (as were all the locals in NOLA). The room was spacious enough for the 3 of us, and very comfortable and clean. The only drawback was our lack of a view from the room, but since we had a busy agenda, we didn't mind too much - in fact it ended up being a big joke on the trip, but if this is a concern, ask for a room facing the front of the property. The layout of the hotel is really convenient - with the lobby, pool, courtyard, bar, and restaurant all in one area. They even have books you can check out and a nice lounge area to curl up and read. The location was perfect - we didn't take the car out the entire time we were there. The Jazz Fest shuttle picked us up just outside, and we were able to purchase tickets for everything in the lobby. The street was quiet and didn't have too much car traffic, and we were still able to walk to Bourbon St. and the French Quarter, Jackson Square, Harrah's, Canal Place within minutes and felt very comfortable and safe wandering around. The area is still undergoing quite a bit of construction, but that can only be a good sign for the neighborhood. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “I liked it.”
Reviews.Author: thompstone
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the night before a cruise (Carnival Fantasy). I liked this place for it's ambiance more than anything. It's in an old building and the layout is interesting. Big old windows in the room.The place was clean and the staff was very nice. The bar was tiny, as was the swimming pool. I think I could've stretched from one end to the other (pool or bar). The breakfast buffet was good, waffles, cereal, etc. The hotel is fairly close to the cruise terminal, maybe 15 minutes walking if your luggage isn't too bulky, but longer if the Riverwalk is closed, as in the morning hours. A cab to the cruise terminal is $7/person. It's a 5 minute walk to the French Quarter, which offers much to keep you busy. The airport is about 20 minutes by cab barring a traffic jam. I had a good driver (15 minutes). I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great option for an overnight stay but next time, will stay IN the Quarter”
Reviews.Author: yesmamjulie
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to New Orleans since Katrina, and it was somewhat spontaneous as we were in Baton Rouge doing a college visit at LSU. We were quite pleased with the accomodations, service, and staff at the Country Inn & Suites. Cost was reasonable too. However, it really isn't in the French Quarter. It is a block or two west of Canal Street. But the Country Inn & Suites had much of the charm as any 'authentic' French Quarter inn, sans balconies. I'd still want to stay 'where the action is' if and when I return, but this was better than average by a long shot!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Siss
Reviews.Content: We just returned after a six night stay at the Country Inn and Suites and were very impressed! Even though it is a chain, they've done a great job with the feel of the hotel. It really didn't feel like a chain. The staff were all great - very accommodating and friendly. Our room, though small, was quite comfortable. The high ceilings gave a more spacious feel and I liked the counter space in the bathroom. The room was immaculate and the temperature was easy to control. John, at the small bar, was such a nice person and the front desk and housekeeping staff would always return our greetings and had smiles on their faces. The breakfast was quite good for the usual buffet - always kept clean and well stocked. Never had the same breakfast twice - good variety for a free meal. The cookies at the front desk became a little addictive, but I guess that's a good thing. The courtyard/pool area was very nice. Didn't use the pool, but a few afternoons I took my book to the courtyard and really enjoyed it - nice little rest for the feet. The only complaint we had was that the hallway was kept at a deep freeze temperature, so we would practically run down the hall to get into the room! Location for us was perfect. We always walk, walk, walk in NO and this was a good location for us since we explore different areas of the city. We really enjoyed everything at the hotel and the price was great. It's not an old NO hotel and it's not in the quarter (but close) but it was perfect for us!

Reviews.Title: “Great option to be near the action, but not IN it!”
Reviews.Author: iowaamy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great choice for visitors to NOLA that want to be within walking distance of the French Quarter but would prefer better pricing, better parking and a little less of the party crowd. The hotel is clean and comfortable. We had a king suite (#413) which is across from the elevator, it does not have an exterior window. We were not bothered by noise, the bedroom is toward the back and has a door which we kept closed. The staff was outstanding and the breakfast room offered good choices and was clean and neat. A walk to Bourbon St. takes maybe 10 minutes. Valet parking available. Free cookies in the lobby. Stayed at the Hilton for the first part of our trip. For $229 a night: -- poor shower head -- no breakfast -- farther from French Quarter -- long waits for valet to get car -- no in-room safe -- no fridge or microwave -- smaller room -- about 15 channels All of the above were fixed when we moved three blocks and paid $50 less per night. This is a FANTASTIC choice for families and young couples looking to save a little money but still have a great vacation experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BoNry
