Reviews.Content: I was really pleased with this hotel. The staff were great, the hotel was very nice and clean and the rooms were serviced well. There was free internet in the rooms and breakfast was included and was a good breakfast. There was some noise from the pool late at night and my room's window was above the pool but when the staff were approached they were very polite and moved the people indoors (since it was 1am) straight away which was great. I was very happy with this hotel and would strongly recommend it - particularly for business trips (as it is next to the French quarter but not right in it) but for my business trip it was located perfectly. Excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the money”
Reviews.Author: AllieKY
Reviews.Content: We spent many hours searching for a good place and great rate for our one night in NO. I thought most rates were out of sight compared with other cities. This hotel was clean and at a great location. We wanted to go to Harrah's, Jackson Square, Riverwalk, Cafe Du Monde, and the French Quarter in general. We walked to all of those locations easily. The valet cost $23, but as we searched for hotels that is a comparable rate. We upgraded to a suite for just a few dollars more. We asked for a street side room, but none were available. Our room opened up to the inside which meant our BR was in the back with no window. Our room was quiet and dark. Both good things for sleeping well. I would stay here again and would recommend this to family and friends. Don't spend time seaching the net for a place to stay. This is the best deal in NO for the money!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: halifaxns
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Country Inn and Suites for 3 nights in late September. The hotel is exceptionally clean and well maintained. Staff was very friendly and helpful with directions and suggestions. It's conveniently located about a 5 minute walk from the corner of Bourbon and Canal which makes it very easy to get to where all of the fun is in the evenings, but also gives you a quiet place to sleep and rest. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been happier about the Country Inn & Suites”
Reviews.Author: RandBrad
Reviews.Content: Got a great combined rate on airfare and this hotel from Orbitz. I was a bit leary about this chain's name (sounds so highway interchange), but the TripAdvisor reviews were so good. And they were right! The architecture of the place is very interesting and inviting. My room was spotless, and the entire hotel is maintained impeccably. The staff are all very friendly and helpful. I enjoyed the fitness room (just 2 treadmills, and eliptical machine, bike and situp machine) and the pool/courtyard (small but lovely). The breakfast was more than adequate, and if you need something more than that, there is plenty in the neighborhood. Lots of other great restaurants within walking distance as well. I don't walk alone in New Orleans at night, but anytime I had the desk call a cab it was there in minutes. You can't go wrong with this place.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with our stay at Country Inn and Suites!”
Reviews.Author: crew928
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nights at the Country Inn and Suites in New Orleans. Everything was great! The staff was VERY friendly and helpful - every one of them had a smile on their face. Makes a guest feel welcome. Our room was nice. We had a suite that was on the fourth floor in the front of the building. We had huge windows in our bedroom that looked out onto the city. Beautiful at night. There was a seperate area with a couch, desk and t.v. The hotel was very clean. No complaints at all. We had looked at a lot of hotels ane finally decided on this one. We wanted something that wasn't too fancy, close to the French Quarter, and clean. I was a little worried about the location of the hotel to the French Quarter but is only a couple of blocks away. We felt very safe walking back to the hotel after a late dinner. Great location. As mentioned before, the pool is really small. We didn't use it at all so wasn't a problem for us. Breakfast was o.k. - waffles, fruit, yogurt, cereal, bagels, ... My only wish was that the coffee was stronger! When we visit New Orleans again we will definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Country Inn and Suites!!”
Reviews.Author: Jeanie
Reviews.Content: This weekend in New Orleans was an anniversary gift for my husband, and I found a nice rate on the Country Inn through Quikbook. The location is fantastic, close to the French Quarter and Harrah's! Yes, the pool is small, but beautiful and the setting in the courtyard is peaceful. With so much fantastic dining surrounding you, there really is no need for a restaurant in the hotel. We parked at a lot down the block for $30 for the whole weekend (2 nights) which we considered a great price. The area is very safe, well-lit and convenient for walking to all attractions and the nightlife. I highly recommend the Country Inn by Carlson for anyone planning to visit New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value - CLEAN!”
Reviews.Author: hoopjnky
Reviews.Content: Great location, great price, good service, CLEAN rooms - none of the mustiness and dirt you find in so many of the 2 and 3 star hotels in New Orleans. Carved from old manufacturing and storage areas that sit two blocks from Canal Street, the hotel has a historic feeling without sacrificing modern amenities. Good breakfast, good internet connection, just a few blocks from the Quarters and downtown, on the MAgazine bus route - can't beat it.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Surprised”
Reviews.Author: CarrieGPMom
Reviews.Content: My hotel reservations were made the day I would leave to travel. I didn't expect to arrive to such a great location and a very nice atmosphere. There were three guest to the 2 queen bedroom, however, the living room has a sofa bed and the bedroom was seperated from the living room. Both the living room and bedroom had their own televisions, so everyone had their privacy. Great location to stay, park, walk, and never drive your entire stay. Great rooms for a wonderful price and we never had to call the front desk for any problems. When we left for the day our return was back to a clean room and there were absolutely no complaints. On the way to the hotel, I called for directions and the front desk attendant was very happy to assist me. There is only one small complaint, the window for viewing the outdoors in the bedroom is very small so the guest that sleeps in the living room will never know what time of the day it maybe which I would think is okay if you partied really hard on Bourbon the night before! I would be happy to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed with Country Inn & Suites”
Reviews.Author: WashingtonDCDiva
Reviews.Content: Our church brought more than 100 volunteers to New Orleans in June, 2007 and took a large block of rooms at CI&S, including their large meeting room. The staff and management were unfailingly friendly and helpful -- from the valets, to the front desk to the management. They even opened the breakfast room early to accomodate our schedule. Everything was very clean and seemed new. There is a bit of room for improvement in the timing of the room cleaning, which was sometimes rather late in the day. Yes, the pool is small, but our pre-teens enjoyed it none-the-less. We also appreciated the self-service washer and dryer ($1.25/load each) and free WiFi. The location felt safe and was convenient to the French Quarter and several good CBD restaurants (Mother's, Bon Ton, Cuvee all within a couple of blocks). Country Inn & Suites far exceeded my expectations for a hotel at this price point.

Reviews.Title: “Great, but still a Country Inn and Suites”
Reviews.Author: Texasbart
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent 3 nights here while I was at a convention. It is a wonderful budget option that allowed us to spend more on meals - a trade off that I would make again! Positives: (1) Location. - Very good restaurants close by - really liked Bon Ton. - easy walk to Harrahs and shopping - about 15 min walk to convention center (2) Lobby - very cool interior, felt expensive - pool is more of a hot tub size, but outside area was nice, with a lobby bar close by - cookies were a nice touch (3) Service was great (4) Relatively new (5) Price - can't be beat in New Orleans and still feel safe (6) Free internet Negatives (1) It is still a Country Inn and Suites, so towels are thin, bedding is OK, breakfast is norm for these places and coffee was terrible. (2) Regular rooms are small (3) Air conditioning blew on the bed - very cold

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: JWestShuh
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Country Inn and Suites for 2 nights in June. This was such a pleasant experience. This hotel is a converted warehouse and it makes for beautiful spaces. Exposed beams, floor to ceiling windows, all personal touches. We initially received a room with windows leading to the hallway, and asked to switch to a room with windows facing the outside. Our room was changed with no problem and the result was fantastic. 3 large floor to ceiling windows in a suite. Exposed brick really added to the ambiance of the room. The breakfast in the morning is a nice touch. The pool is a bit small, but the patio area where the pool is located is lush and a perfect place to relax with a good book. The valet service was fantastic. It never took over 10 minutes to receive our car. Locate was great as well. A 2 minute walk to Harrah's, 4 minutes to the riverwalk, 5 minutes or less to the French Quarter. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a light, clean, comfortable hotel and a VERY affordable price. Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect! Well almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: planningzone
Reviews.Content: I am in New Orleans to help build houses of Habitat for Humanity and this hotel was on their list. I checked Trip Adviser and it got a very good review. I TOTALLY AGREE! This is a wonderful place! There are some negatives, but they were totally out of the hotels control. But you do need to be aware of them. The rooms are small and the general manager sends a letter (e-mail) to customers explaining that the hotel is a historic site, so every room is a bit different. My room, while very small had a 20 foot high ceiling with exposed beams (very cool). The hotel is VERY clean, including the rooms/ lobby/ etc. Breakfast is free. No fruit, but you can get yogurt, breads, cereal, or make a waffle. The Coffee was HORRIBLE! NOW THE BAD. If you are unlucky enough to get a room in the back of the hotel, it is on an alley. The trash (or somebody.... Delivery?) comes at around 5 AM!!!!! If you are coming from the west coast you will be TOTALLY IRRITATED waking up so early. Like I said, out of the hotel's control. I am sure many hotels in the city have the same problem. Last time in New Orleans I stayed at the French Quarter Courtyard By Marriott. This hotel is MUCH nicer, Cleaner, rooms are better..... Etc, Etc. I would stay here in a heartbeat! TIP: Great sandwich place one block down Poydras St. called mothers. There is always a line of locals!

Reviews.Title: “More than pleased !”
Reviews.Author: Anitable
Reviews.Content: My husband was scheduled to attend a conference at the New Orleans Marriott on Canal St. Since his employer decided not to pay the lodging expenses, we looked for a nearby hotel that was more affordable. How delighted we were to discover that Country Inn and Suites offered much better rates and more and better ammenities to serve our needs, and it was only a block from Canal S. ! . Not only was the suite larger and more comfortable than the rooms his collegues had at the Marriott, but the expanded continental breakfast saved us time and money every morning. The in-room refrigerator and microwave enabled us to keep our special dietary items and snacks. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful and seemed proud of their hotel. The smaller size of the hotel was more desireable than the tall high rise. Although the C.I.& S had good elevators, we opted to use the stairs more often because it was not too much effort for just one floor or two floors. We did not use the small pool or the fitness facility which looked clean and well-maintained. One of the best restaurants for Louisiana cooking, the historic Bon Ton Cafe, is just a half block from the hotel. A well-established Cuban restaurant with a good reputation is next door to the hotel. There are many fine restaurants and stores and malls within easy walking distance. The French Quarter, the Riverfront walk, the canal street ferry, the aquarium and the casino are all close enough to walk to. We plan to stay at Country Inn and Suites the next time we visit New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: thsammons
Reviews.Content: the location was just right. It was only a few blocks from Bourbon St. and there were tons of great restaurants close by. My fiance and I reserved a King and were upgraded to a Suite which was more than enough room. Service was about average, but the belgian waffle at breakfast and the cookies at night were delicious. We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice; great value”
Reviews.Author: alex030
Reviews.Content: Booked a suite through their website for 5 nights during Jazzfest - very good rate given it was during Jazzfest (booked well in advance though). Overall experience was excellent. Two-three blocks from French Quarter - across Canal St. - so away from all the noise. Can't speak for regular rooms , but suite was perfect. Was initially concerned it would be noisy as entrance was off large atrium/lobby, but bedroom was at back of suite with its own door and was very quiet. Very clean, staff very helpful. Fast, free internet service. Overall ambience very nice - a quiet, cool refuge from the French Quarter. Would definitely stay again. (Incidentally, though we didn't have children with us, it also seemed family friendly).

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: iblaurajc
Reviews.Content: This was a huge winner. Came with 2 teenage boys to do Katrina reconstruction work. Brand new hotel (2 years). Very charming. We got a one bedroom suite for $129, including breakfast. The suite had a large bedroom with two queen beds and a sitting room with pullout sofa. Big TVs in both rooms. Absolutely loved (and I am picky). Great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny Standard Room”
Reviews.Author: RedHeadGo
Reviews.Content: The Country Inn and Suites is located on Magazine St. about two blocks or so from Canal St. (away from the French Quarter). It is an older property with very unique architecture including exposed beams and brick. Check-in/Other Painless and easy. All requests that had been made prior were accommodated. Free cookies at all times was a hit! The lobby area was light and airy with wooden beams (and really the whole ceiling exposed). There were a few tables available for those who wanted to conduct business and plenty of chairs. There is one computer in the lobby that has a printer attached, but someone was always on it. It was bitterly cold in the lobby and interior of the hotel, they need to tone it down a bit. Courtyard was pretty, but there was a lot of algae/moss on the walls that just made it seem unclean. They should probably power wash it a bit. The valet is about $24/day, but we paid it on the company dime. If you are on your own, might want to find a garage. There is a small fitness center that had two treadmills, a bike and I think an elliptical, which lead out to the outdoor spa. There is also a small outdoor pool that appeared to be heated. Breakfast was in a room near the lobby, had mostly continental fare (muffins, Danish, cereal, juice), but also waffles. My colleagues said that coffee was the pits. Rooms Had a room facing the courtyard and was not real impressed, especially for the money we paid. However, you want to face the courtyard, as my colleagues were on the 1st floor street level and said it was noisy. The view was to a building that had not been restored and had a lot of kicked out windows, wooden panels over windows, etc. The very small room starts with a closet that had ample hangers and a clean iron and ironing board. The bathroom was normal sized with decent room for your toiletries. They only give you very basic shampoo, conditioner and soap, so youâ€™ll need to get the other items from downstairs or bring your own. Water pressure was not very firm. Bathroom was moderately clean. As you walk in the room the desk and chair are immediate with your wired internet access (which did not work until I called Tech Support and they manually logged me in, had to do this both nights, this happened to everyone in my party). The bed is about 2â€™ behind the desk and chair and was decently comfortable. However, they only had feather pillows. When I called to get foam, they brought me a pillow that said it was cotton, but was obviously feather. I called again and was told they had no foam pillows. For the money we paid, was pretty angry about that. Think Iâ€™m going to have to buy an inflatableâ€¦ The TV is on an odd spot to the right of the bed on top of the dresser. Had adequate channels but poor reception a lot of the time. The bed sat in front of a white exposed brick wall that really needed some work. I think I even saw a piece of gum on the wall. Was supposed to be historic looking, but just looked like it has been painted so many times it was not a pretty site. The pictures they hung on the wall were pretty and provided a good cover-up. Room noise was so-so. I did hear a TV blaring somewhere, wasnâ€™t sure where it was coming from. I didnâ€™t really hear a lot of walking around or anything like that and outside noise was nothing thanks to facing the courtyard. Location About a 15 minute walk to the heart of the French Quarter. Was only a 5 or so minute walk to the Casino. There wasnâ€™t a whole lot of food options in feet, there was a diner and a Cuban restaurant within a block and the Everything Shop, which did sell almost everything was about 2 blocks. Overall This is a good hotel if you only have one person in your party. The room was just really small by my standards that I wouldnâ€™t have been comfortable with anyone else in the room. If you plan on just using the room to sleep, youâ€™ll be fine. If you like to be able to relax in the room, I would suggest a suite style room or another hotel in general. Was just shocked that the Hampton Inn where I stayed last time, had rooms that were 2 to 3 times the size of this one. In reading other peoples reviews here, they all had suites. I had a regular room, that seems to be a big factor in why my stay wasnâ€™t as pleasant as theirs. For the rate we paid ($250/night), Iâ€™m kind of upset they stuck us with regular roomsâ€¦

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location!”
Reviews.Author: rickanddeborah
Reviews.Content: We really loved this place. We got a great rate of $129 for a 1 bedroom suite and it was well spent. If you are going to be in NO more than a day or two, get this room. Very well layed out with a separate area with a sofabed, tv & microwave and fridge. Large bathroom and closet and a very good sized bedroom. Nicely decorated. Had 10-12 foot ceilings with floor to ceiling windows. Loved that! Everyone we came in contact with at the hotel was very helpful and nice. Lovely areas in the lobby for just hanging out and a computer with a printer for use in the main area that comes in very handy. Small but lovely pool area and workout room (who cares, you came to Louisiana to eat ,not workout!). Happy hour drinks in the lobby and bar area from 5-7. Breakfast is included. And the location is so perfect. Across the street is Cuvee restaurant. A few doors down is the Bon Ton Cafe. A couple of blocks over is August, Emeril's and best of all, Cochon!! The French Quarter is 2 blocks the other way. Great shopping and transport onto Magazine Street and the Garden district. If you are cabbing it, it is very central. Parking is $25 additional. In all, a terrific choice for NO. We had stayed previously at the Monaco in one of the suites and really enjoyed it but for less than 1/3 to 1/2 the price this was just as good. Go to New Orleans and all of Louisiana! Everyone we came in contact with was so happy that people were coming back and so appreciative of it. What remains to be done there is horrifying and an outrage that every citizen of this country should be aware of and angered by. Just not acceptable that our fellow citizens are still embroiled in this nightmare 19 months later...Go and love it and the people and eat yourselves sick! Don't miss Parkway Bakery and their po boys. Spread your money around. Roulez les bon temps...again...

Reviews.Title: “A good choice when staying in the Big Easy”
Reviews.Author: Blye
Reviews.Content: We had planned to stay at the Country Inn and Suites for two nights, March 2nd and 3rd precruise but mother Nature intervened and a snow storm delayed us by a full day and we arrived near midnight on Friday night. Check in was smooth and the hotel was only a block from Canal Street where we took a stroll before bed. The street that the Hotel is on, Magazine Street, is a one way and when you cross Canal Street it's name changes to Decatur, the main drag running along the Mississippi. This is the street with the French Market and lots of sites. It's a very nice, safe and a easy stroll. Our room was huge, with 12 foot ceilings and all the niceties one would expect. I'd requested a quiet room and ours had no window to the outdoors, but we had a window over looking the hallway and open air lobby (well, almost open air, there's a glass skylight keeping the elements out) My only complaint was that the walls were a tad thin. We could hear (faintly) the people in the room next to us. Fortunately everyone was well behaved so noise was not an issue, but if you were unfortunate enough to get partyers as your neighbours, it might be. The buffet breakfast was very satisfying and included a do-it-yourself waffle station. When we checked out I was pleasantly surprised that even though I was charged for two nights on my credit card when I booked, they immediately credited me for the first night that we'd missed due to the snow storm! (I had called that night to let them know I was stuck and would be checking in the first night) I did not have to ask for it, they just credited me. They were also happy to let us leave our luggage with them when our cruise was over a week later so we could walk around the French Quarter before our late afternoon flight home. We will definitely stay at at the Country Inn and Suites again.

Reviews.Title: “Fun, comfy and clean”
Reviews.Author: IdahoKaren
Reviews.Content: Stayed here pre cruise and loved it. So much character and ambiance! The staff was wondeful- helpful and smiling all the way. Morning breakfast had a little for everyone and you MUST try the warm cookies at the check in desk- yummy. Only glitch we had- we had booked a king suite cuz it was supposed to have a hide a bed.oooops no it did not and they had no other room available. It worked out cuz other party had 2 queens and some went there but it COULD have been a mess if we hadn't. The front desk was so apologetic about it and wound up crediting us $ off the room because of it. One hint- do not get a ground floor queen suite as it faces a very busy street and is quite noisy! Be sure and ask for an upper room We would definitely stay at this charming place again- and it is also within good walking to French Quarter and Bourbon Street. Just don't eat at MOTHERS- yuck!

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience -”
Reviews.Author: mygetaway
Reviews.Content: I stayed here over the weekend of January 19 and was very pleased with my experience. The hotel staff was excellent. They booked our reservations for dinner and also made special arrangements for a private tour of the Garden District with a van operator on the way to the aiport. The weather was lousy and these arrangements were a life saver. The senior rate was $107 plus tax and included a continental breakfast. Fruit offerings could have been better. The king sized bed was comfortable and my room that faced the courtyard was quiet. Clean and ideally located for walking, dining, or gambling. Good ambience as a converted warehouse. The only reason I didn't give an excellent was that the hallways were a little noisy in the early mornings and suite that faced the small street was noisy as the trash trucks drove by early in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “A very good choice”
Reviews.Author: sewaneeprof
Reviews.Content: This is an all around good choice with a great location between the Central Business District, Riverfront, Arts and Warehouse District, and the French Quarter. You can easily walk to either area. There is high speed internet in very nicely appointed rooms some with great views of the historic New Orleans Trade Building and St. James Hotel. Other rooms that look out over valet parking not so good. Everything was extremely clean, service was helpful, excellent really. There is a decent free breakfast every morning until 10:00am and a great little gym. What I found especially nice is the indoor/outdoor patio space with slate floors, beautiful wood beamed ceilings, lots of light, and a small outdoor soaking pool (and wireless access in the common areas). There is a second very private and comfy lounge off the front desk area. There is also a small bar open nightly. Easy walking distance to La Bon Ton Cafe, Mothers, the Palace Cafe, and Liberio Cuban Restuarant (good and right next door). For the price, it really beats hands down hotels like the Sheraton, IC, and Marriott that charge you extra every time you flush the toilet :)

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Country Inn”
Reviews.Author: Travel1023
Reviews.Content: Don't let the name fool you, there is nothing "country" about the Country Inn and Suites. Stayed for 3 nights and had a great stay. Very clean, new hotel with a lot of charm. Staff was friendly and helpful, good continental breakfast and convenient location. Would stay again next time I am in New Orleans and recommend to anyone who is looking for a place to stay there. Good value!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, very good value”
Reviews.Author: Spaceman58
Reviews.Content: This hotel is typically available for about $80 a night and is well worth it. You can easily spend more elsewhere and get less. In fact, we couldn't come close to this price in Baton Rouge, which is interesting because there is far less to see and do there. The location is good, on Magazine Street about a block and a half off of Canal Street, easy walking distance to the French Quarter and Jackson Square. It's directly across the street from the New Orleans Board of Trade. Valet parking is $23 per night. The fitness room includes 2 treadmills, 1 recumbent bike, and 1 elliptical. The pool is tiny, really an oversized spa, but it is heated. The rooms are really nothing special, but perfectly adequate and reasonably comfortable. Remember this is a converted warehouse, so you wil see exposed wooden beams, pipes, and painted-over brick. We will definitely return to this hotel on our next visit, simply because of the value and the location.

Reviews.Title: “a weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: skbuzz
Reviews.Content: the valet parking was very nice,even thoe it cost a $100 for four days..the luggage carts where great! check in went very smooth,the bar tender at the hotel was very nice..well it's right there on your way to the elevator you can stop by grab a drink an head on up to your room.. the lobby-lounge area is comfortable,they also have a nice court yard to sit out on if ya want to.breakfast was very plain jane, the maids did a good job!! they have safes in the rooms if ya need to lock up stuff. bring your pillow cause all they have is thoes feather pillows.

HotelInfo.Name: Country Inn & Suites New Orleans
HotelInfo.Address: 315 Magazine Street, New Orleans, LA 70130
